title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Roseville, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty quick and easy interview process, basic interview questions. Strengths/Weakness, about myself, why I left my previous job, why I'm good for this role, etc Very straightforward and nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: Strengths/Weakness, about myself, why I left my previous job, why I'm good for this role, etc

title: Licensed Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, standard questions. A lot of behavioral questions not so much technical other than the vignette. Make sure to practice vignettes with different scenarios and pull everything out of the vignette
Interview Questions: Name a time you had a disagreement with one of your co-workers, how did you resolve it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: After applying I was called by the manager and I was sent a link via Microsoft Teams on the agreed upon date and time for interview. Interviewed with manager and assistant manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Cashier/Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Roseville, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview with the hiring manager. The questions were not too difficult to answer. The hiring manger was really friendly and answered all the questions I had.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself.

title: Data Scientist Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed twice, took over a month of emailing to get a response that I was rejected. I did not expect an offer but I would have appreciated more transparency with them.
Interview Questions: Describe the process of how you would conduct a successful marketing email campaign

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The supervisor was very warm an d easy to talk to. Another member on the team was also present which I appreciated. They both asked great questions and carried out a very genuine conversation.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you’re applying to this job. Give us examples of project management roles. Tell us examples of conflicts or roadblocks faced during implementations and how you overcame them.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person with several managers, questions were impersonal, situation based and not really related to position but more related to overall experience, interview was uncomfortable because of the sterility of it as the managers spent most of the time reading from the script and writing, very difficult to connect with them
Interview Questions: all were situational and they wanted specific examples of times I had difficulty with a patient or coworker, when I went above and beyond for a patient, etc.

title: Ambulatory Care Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Application process took a few months before hearing from the hiring manager to schedule an interview. Panel interview with 4 others, behavioral questions, resume-related questions and a situational questions. No case based questions or case presentations.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you provided a recommendation to a provider. Tell me about your experience at company ABC…

title: Clinical Psychology Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at multiple locations in the Bay Area. I would say the substance use clinics were a great experience but not the general clinics. The general clinic did not give time to ask questions.
Interview Questions: They asked what my clinical orientation is.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic interview process. Met with management, as well as current bedside RNs, reviewed benefits, reviewed schedule considerations and different options for shifts. The interview experience helped to outline what it would be like working for the organization.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my experience working at the bedside

title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone call interview with recruiter then passed on to manager. Easy process but most openings are on call positions. Full time positions open internal first. Great start pay and good benefits but I needed full time.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in acute care clinic?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Questions from Back end coding to security and databases. Very focussed on the technologies the role is about... agile development, troubleshooting etc. Cannot say it was difficult... but you need to have expierence in various topics
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Learning Management & Administration Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I had a great experience- I did 3 interviews- all virtual. 1st interview was with the person who would be my Manager, 2nd interview was a presentation that I had to present given certain guidelines, and the last interview was a panel interview. After my last interview, I submitted references. It was one of the hardest interviews I have ever done, but it is so worth it because I really wanted this job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Search Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Ghosted after interview with manager. Emailed twice and no response. This type of candidate experience shows me everything I needed to know. Manager talked a big talk, but never had the courtesy to share an update.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, how many jobs you have hired for, type of recruiting exp

title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Harbor City, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the Director of Radiology and an interview was scheduled. i went in a few days later and was interviewed by the Director and the lead sonographer.
Interview Questions: What is my most/least favorite exam to perform

title: Intern Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: First they asked me what I knew about the position/location, then they asked me about my goals and availability, then they asked me clinical knowledge questions and posed patient scenarios that I had to respond to.
Interview Questions: What kind of past pharmacy experience do you have

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview lasted around 30 or 40 minutes, with questions relating to past experiences, and personal achievements in prior work spaces, ranging to a few technical questions. Or rather examples in the work place.
Interview Questions: What was a typical day like at your previous employer

title: Quality Improvement Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with an initial screening with the recruiter. I then met with three individuals w. at various levels of the quality improvement team via MS Teams. They asked questions about myself, my background, and my experience. I was then asked to come back for another interview where they brought the entire team and all asked me questions, diving deeper into my background and experiences.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser Permanente? Why this industry?

title: ER Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was taken on a tour of the department and then proceeded to a 3-panel person interview in person. Overall the interview felt very personable and comfortable. All questions were scenario based.
Interview Questions: When met with multiple tasks, how do you prioritize? Tell us about a time you had a run-in with your coworker and how did you get through that? Name a time you went above and beyond for your patient, and what did you do?

title: Managing Consultant V Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: 4 stages after initial screening. First interview with team member, second interview with two team members, third interview with 2 leads, and final interview with department head. All interviews were virtual.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with team member who was underperforming?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The discussion was conducted remotely. The interviewer had clearly minimal knowledge of the role, how to effectively screen for the role, or even how to pronounce basic words related to software packages used when trying to describe the role. Fitment was established by a cursory resume review, and tee-ball style behavioral questions were posed. No technical questions were asked outside of establishing self-reported level of technical skill in various packages.
Interview Questions: Describe your experiences managing analytics teams?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Through an agency to get job it was easy not a lot of questions you basically submit resume Through an agency to get job it was easy not a lot of questions you basically submit resume
Interview Questions: Went through an agency to get job

title: Clinical Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Easy and short. The team was welcoming during the tour. Couple clinical cases were given as well. The interview was two days long. Each day was short….about 3 hours. Overall the process was smooth and easy. Even the interviewers.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were done virtually. There were two interviews. 1 was a one on one and the other a group. The team I spoke with were well prepared regarding my questions about the job.
Interview Questions: They were typical scenario type questions.

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Antioch, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with hiring manager and then panel interview with unit managers. They ask basic questions regarding experience and mostly about being a le to deal with labor union. They emphasize the difficulty of navigating union rules and policies. There was no call back, follow up or even a rejection letter. You just don't hear from them ever again.
Interview Questions: Have you dealt with union before?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Bunch of scenario questions - Describe yourself - What makes a good day for you - How would your previous manager describe you? Various skill related to the job questions and your previous experience if any
Interview Questions: - Describe yourself - What makes a good day for you - How would your previous manager describe you?

title: Department Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: 6 interviews for TPMG Position; lots of personal integrity questions and lots of questions on performance improvement projects both past and ability to perform in future. Staff morale seems to need improvement and the team wants someone to bring that together.
Interview Questions: What would your plan be in the first 30, 60 and 90 days?

title: Search Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviews. First was a screening. Second was a 2 on 1 interview. Third was a 1 on 1 with the hiring manager. All went well until the decision needed to be made. I received no communications after being asked for references. I finally decided to call the recruiter and they reached out weeks later to let me know they had so many great candidates and I did great but it was nearly a coin toss. I was affected my layoffs and to hear I wasn’t respected enough to receive an update and my livelihood was decided by a coin toss is outrageous. I’d never consider working for his team ever.
Interview Questions: What’s the most difficult position you’ve sourced for and how did you overcome the obstacle?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Marcos, CA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: During the Zoom call, I was surprised to find that there were four other RNs who have worked for Kaiser Permanente and three hiring managers present. While I understand that group interviews can be an effective way to assess candidates, I found that this interview style gave some applicants an advantage, as they had more time to consider their answers after hearing the same questions repeatedly. Additionally, I felt like I was in a beauty pageant, vying for attention and love from the panel. I was disappointed to hear that some of the hiring managers were giggling and told me that I was using too many buzzwords. While I understand the importance of using appropriate language, I feel that it is unfair to judge a candidate based on this alone and led me to question if I was presenting myself in the most effective manner. I believe that my skills and experience speak for themselves, and I would have appreciated the opportunity to showcase them in a different setting.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser Permanente? Tell me about yourself Tell me about a time when...

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went pretty quickly and the questions were straightforward easy to answer questions. It was a group interview and then a one on one for select few from the group
Interview Questions: What do you do to make your job more efficient?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The process was straightforward. They asked behavioral questions as well as describing the daily tasks for the specialty. They asked for references at the end of the interview, which they called that day.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where the priority changed, how did you handle it?

title: Pharmacy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: About a month after applying, I was emailed to come in for an in-person interview. I spoke to the talent coordinator casually about my interests and hobbies outside of work, then the PM. came in along with another colleague. I was asked a series of typical interview questions and they recorded each of my answers down on a sheet of paper. They then gave me more details about the position, pay, and hours. They told me that I should expect a call or email from Talent Aquisition if they decide to go through with me or decline me. The next day I got a call offering me the job.
Interview Questions: Asked a lot of customer service related questions. Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds of interviews. The first one was behavioral questions. The second was a case interview and the last one was behavioral questions again. Overall, it is very straightforward. They respond very quickly after your interview.
Interview Questions: What challenges have you had to overcome?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Went through two interviews over zoom with 10-12 people on first interview and then 2 people on the second interview. A mix of vignette and experience questions. Took about 45 minutes each interview.
Interview Questions: What are your time management skills like?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied in December, got contacted in January to complete career snapshot and hirevue interview. Completed the hirevue interview in feb. Got called in March from assistant clinical director for a phone interview and she asked if I could go in person for an interview. After the in person interview I got contacted a few hours later and got offered the job!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for kaiser?

title: Regulatory Affairs Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by recruiter for Interview. Process was done by phone call with reciter for first round. Second round was group interview with staff two weeks after phone interview. Mostly basic questions, nothing hard or out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: explain your organization strategies ?

title: Psychotherapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Application, in person interview. Met with 2 current managers. Asked a variety of relevant questions, nothing unexpected or unnecessarily challenging. I could tell one of the managers was feeling pulled in different directions and pressed for time. This was a bit anxiety inducing but we were able to complete the interview.
Interview Questions: How would you connect with a client?

title: Engagement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. Three rounds. Questions on scenarios and experience. Able to interview with the team. The whole process was not difficult. If you are spanish speaking you must take a test to prove proficiency.
Interview Questions: Why interested you about this position and what skills from your previous employment are transferable

title: Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very pleasant; the managers are super sweet. They genuinely wanted to know more about what experience you have and how you can apply it to their internship. It was around 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about your experience doing xyz.

title: Administrative Assistance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: long process then take months to call you back for every step, and they have alot of openings but hardly call back. I have been waiting for call back for the longest
Interview Questions: What does kaiser mean to you? How do manage a calendar?

title: Senior Actuary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 3 hour video panel interview with actuaries at mid-to-senior level. A lot of overly general behavioral “tell me about a time” questions that are aimed at how one would handle certain situations.
Interview Questions: “Tell me about your least favorite manager and why” “Tell me about your communication style and how you make sure your message is delivered”

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview. First question was tell me about yourself, what I knew about the job, and other general questions related to the job description. The interviewer explained the job description and went over training.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and work experience

title: Nursing Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I submitted multiple applications at various times; as a new CNA, CNA with experience, and concurrently attending nursing school. I wish I could speak about the interview process but they're making the application process more complicated than it should be. I went as far as the supplemental application. Mind you, ALL THE LISTINGS I APPLIED FOR ARE STILL ACTIVELY ACCEPTING APPLICATIONS. It HAS NOT BEEN FILLED and this company does not give you the courtesy to inform you why you weren't selected and notify you of any updates to your applications. The job listing would state "preferred" when in reality their preferences are requirements. You don't have 1 year experience, aren't enrolled in nursing school, or aren't bilingual in Spanish = AUTOMATIC REJECTION! My last application was WITHDRAWN WITHOUT MY CONSENT. If this company will only hire within, SAY SO. It's frustrating how I am wasting my time completing applications just to be made a fool with your SHADY HIRING TACTICS AND CLEAR DISCRIMINATION.
Interview Questions: N/A. Apply somewhere else. This company will clearly waste your time.

title: Intermediate Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I took an exam that just asked me basic questions then I was asked to do a digital screening. I still have not done the digital screening so pending !
Interview Questions: Nothing yet since I have not done

title: Undergraduate Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was very pleasant. The person interviewing me was very nice and we had a great conversation, I thought it went perfectly. They just asked me basic behavioral questions and asked easy technical questions. I felt good after the interview. Where this process went negatively was everything else. The person interviewing me wasn't even supposed to be interviewing me for my position, the hiring/team manager didn't show up. Because of this, the interviewer couldn't tell me anything about the team because they didn't know anything about it. They told me that it was a slow process to go through interviews right now, so to reach back out in a week or two. I emailed the hiring manager who was supposed to interview me and no response, but hours after I emailed them I checked my portal to a rejection. Glad they did because I feel like working under this manager would've been a bad experience.
Interview Questions: Can you talk about a significant team experience?

title: Operations Support Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Completed Microsoft Teams interview with a panel. All of their cameras were turned off except for mine (which made it super awkward) I was looking at blank screens the whole time. Interview felt rushed.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have juggling multiple projects at once?

title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Bakersfield, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: You apply online through the Kaiser website. You receive a phone call that sets up an interview. At the interview, you will have a conversation with 3-5 Kaiser employees of various positions. After that, you wait for a call with an offer.
Interview Questions: What are some attributes that you have that might benefit this company?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: first round was about 30 minute long and was virtually done mostly behavioral questions, and it almost felt like a casual conversation i didnt do the second round bc i got an offer from a different place
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself, how would you rate your skills on a scale 1-10

title: Data Analyst Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: great atmosphere, very positive and supportive. Two rounds, with las panels interview. Learn actually a lot during interview with them. Overall very positive experience. Whole process quite long, applied in December, interviewed in march final decision they sent in May. Was not chosen.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself /strength/weakness

title: Optometrist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Filling out the online application, phone call with the chief of the area, and informal interview. Pretty casual and low key. It really was not very intimidating and the people were all very nice and professional
Interview Questions: Goals of career was a main focus

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions:
I have interviewed for a variety of intern positions, mostly related to data analytics and science.  I got an offer with one department who told me they would be accommodating in terms of letting me finish the interview process with other departments. However, hiring manager changed their mind and gave me a time limit. I didn't accept because of this. Other interviewers have completely ghosted me. Some teams are not diverse AT ALL (only white men). I even had a couple of teams show up late to the interview, or talk crap about how school master programs do not prepare students. The fact that multiple hiring managers have been this unpleasant is a HUGE red flag on the entire organization. 

I was also applying for full-time positions with other organizations since I am close to graduating and got an offer with one of those, so I feel like a bullet has been dodged because I don't really want to work for a hiring manager who doesn't stick to their word or who can't return an email/phone call/show up on time, or work with a bunch of white men. Seems like most teams I spoke with were pretty bad (I had at least 10 invites with 3 offers at the end). 

My advice if you want to go forward: remember this interview goes both ways, would you want to work for that specific hiring manager reading off their screen, dodging communications? And ask if they have experience with having an intern and where that intern is at now, if applicable. I personally would not want to work for a team that is not experienced with intern work.
Interview Questions: What is your experience using statistical software (other very similar questions, essentially asking the same thing)?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: I got a zoom interview with the unit secretary and I think the other person was the manager. They asked a few questions and gave me 2 scenarios and wanted to know what i would do in those situations. I think one of them was, if a pt or family member complained about the care given by a coworker what would i do? They where both very nice and i am sure i am not getting the job just because my schedule is hectic due to school and my other job.
Interview Questions: -Tell me about yourself? -Tell me about a situation where you have disagreed with your manage and how was it resolved? -If a patient or family member complained to you about the service another coworker gave, what would you do? Can not remember the other questions

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Tell me about yourself. What makes you qualified for this job? Why do you want to be a medical assistant? Why do you want to work here? Strengths and weaknesses. Behavioral questions and Situational questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What makes you qualified for this job? Why do you want to work here? Strengths and weaknesses

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application, contacted by Talent Acquisition specialist via email about 4 weeks later to verify eligibility. Waited 3 additional weeks and received phone call from the specialist to set an interview with department management. Received a call on a Friday afternoon and was given two days as options to schedule, Monday and Tuesday, at various times. Interview was 30 minutes and timed, one interviewer.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser? What are three good qualities your manager would say you possess and one that needs improvement? Tell me about a time where you let a patient down and how you corrected the situation. Walk me through your typical day on shift, what’s your patient assignment like?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: A lot of interviews including HR screener, panel interviews and three 1:1 interviews. There was also a writing assessment. The interview process took too long and I accepted another position. Fine line between finding the right fit for a position and going through processes. If you can attract talent that you like and can get the job done then do your best to onboard them quickly.
Interview Questions: What communication materials do you have experience drafting and for what audiences?

title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: hr call first, then phone interview, then panel interview. finish some unix question and show the logic how to solve the problems. sent back the thank you letter with the people meet.
Interview Questions: technical skills and behavior questions

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Time consuming a lot of time between the application and actually getting an interview. Everything goes through talent acquisition so there’s not alot of direct answers from the person who actually does the interview

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was a 30 minute interview. Asked lots of good questions, they were every energetic and had good high energy. They are focused on previous customer service experience, and good troubleshooting experience.

title: Software Developer Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: When it comes to technical interviews for software engineering positions, coding questions can be a valuable tool for assessing a candidate's programming skills and problem-solving abilities. The specific question or problem you choose to present will depend on the level of the position you are hiring for, as well as the technology stack and programming languages used by your company.
Interview Questions: Explain the waterfall model in your own words

title: ER RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: They gave real clinical scenarios and seemed to go well but never received a call back. They asked about treatments of different cases you would see, like chest pain or strokes, codes.
Interview Questions: What meds to give, etc. The typical, why should we choose you and how do you handle difficult coworkers or patients.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening with some behavioral questions. The interviewers were friendly. They just wanted to get to know the candidate. They made the environment unformal and comfortable as much as possible
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What is your strength and weekness

title: SAS Programmer Interview

title: Call Center Representative Interview

Interview Descriptions: The process went remotely. The recruiters were gentle and treated me with courtesy. They ask a lot of questions about your expertise and the field. It was a nice experience.
Interview Questions: Things about how you solve a specific problem. What technique should be applied in certain situations, and etc

title: Social Worker LSW Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Honolulu District) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Comfortable talk story approach to gather understanding of real world experience and job app fit screening interview with recruiter -- they had good understanding of local populations and issues. next step fowards app to manager for review.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Status changed to job submission complete. A few weeks later I received an email for a pre screening email interview word doc. Then had status change to review in progress and still waiting.

title: LVN Interview
