title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The process was very quick. I did a interview with a panel of 4 managers from several local offices. Routine questions for the most part. Still waiting for a offer but I did reach out to the interviewer and she was very open to the process and what to expect as far as time frame. Their hiring process is not a quick one but it’s worth it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had a enraged patient how did you handle it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: moderately difficult. numerous interviews. inconvenient to schedule. vague questions. not very flexible and understanding that scheduling interviews while working a full time job was challenging. potential employer not very understanding of this.
Interview Questions: regarding travel to and from work and hours.

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview , manager was amazing. Super easy to talk to her and had Ana amazing experience. Would definitely recommend it again. Didn’t make me feel uncomfortable and seemed like I was talking to my friend
Interview Questions: How often I call in

title: (PRN) Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Jonesboro, GA)
Interview Descriptions: First time I experienced a group interview with 3 other candidates with 2 interviewers per group in a room. It was a little intimidating at first, but after a couple of rounds of answering it became okay. Make sure to try and not repeat answers from previous candidates because you do want to stand out.
Interview Questions: What is a policy that you may have disagreed with and if so, how did you handle it? Recall a time where you may have had conflict with a colleague and if so how did you handle the situation.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It went well. The interview could have gone better. I'll take it as a learning curve for next time. Hopefully, there will be more opportunities for me in the near future.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose their location?

title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Good, fun, good communication, easy to talk to, all my questions were answered, I felt good when the interview was done, 5 interview with 5 people that work with the company.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: online video interview with approx 5 people that were the directors of the related floors. they asked questions and you had to answer using your experience as an rn. every one asked 2 questions.
Interview Questions: they asked about my rn journey and where I saw myself in 3-5 years with kp, when i took on a leadership role, when i had an angry patient what did I do, what did i do when i had a coworker that wasnt a team player, they asked what i would do if i had a pt with cp and one that fell what would i do/see first.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Video interview due to pandemic. 2-3 interviewers. They took turns asking questions and follow up questions. They were kind and well spoken. There were some clinical questions and some general questions and leadership questions.
Interview Questions: How do you handle interprofessional communication.

title: Transitional Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was virtual. I had a great expereince. The recruiter sent me all the information that I needed to know regarding the position and who I would be interviewing with. She also gave me tips on how to do a Behavioral assessment interview and answered all of my questions. It was really a great experience.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time where you had to deal with a conflict with a member and you were unsuccessful at achieving what they needed.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: How can you handle missing values in a dataset? Tell me about a project where you have have worked on a project with missing values. How did you tackle the problem and what did you learn from it?
Interview Questions: Have you ever used SAS in your previous role? on a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the highest, how do you rate your self in your SAS skills?

title: Senior Quality Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well. I first got a phone screening with the manager, who was really nice and easy to talk to. Just went over my resume and experience. I then had a zoom interview with the team and they asked about 20-25 question based on data abstraction, conflict management, creating data without supervision, and resume questions.
Interview Questions: Have you ever dealt with a disagreement with a coworker and how did it resolve? How do you handle dealing with patients who are upset? Can you pull data without little supervision? Excel questions.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I had Two person interview with managers. It was via teams meeting. Situational questions. Not difficult, they were friendly tried to make me as comfortable as possible. They explained their patient population and other job details as well.
Interview Questions: What interventions would you expect to carry out for a patient admitted for sepsis?

title: Compliance Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: First, a phone screen to ask questions and then a simple behavioral interview with the supervisor and manager of the project with some scenario-based questions -- all happened in the span of a week
Interview Questions: Why are you passionate about this opportunity?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Depending on the unit and managers you can have a group or individual interview. The process of scheduling was quick, and sometimes no room yo reschedule as it was done as a group.
Interview Questions: For the group interview a question was taken out of a basket.

title: IT Support Technician - SSD Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: the interview process begins with a phone or video call with the IT department to discuss your skills and experience. After that, you may be asked to come in for an in-person meeting with the hiring team. During this meeting, the team will ask you questions about your professional background and experience, as well as how you would handle certain scenarios. They may also ask you to complete a task related to the role.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for this company?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Process starts with a phone interview to go over job details, next was a panel interview with docs, office manager and other APPs. They ask several behavioral questions and expect you to share your past experiences for each.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a pt stated they did not want to see an APP, only the doctor. Has this happened to you in the past and how did you deal with this situation.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough, professional and welcoming. Interviewer was very engaging and made the interview process comfortable and easy to navigate. Questions were concise and easy to answer, no confusion and straight to the point.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation where you feel you were able to comfort a patient who was in a critical or acute state.

title: Clerical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It could have been better. I think the staff interview skills need work with respect to how it is related to the job. The questions could relate to the job more.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: You have to apply, wait for call. May take months but once they call you it goes pretty fast. Just be patient, give it time. You. An also check the status of your application on the Kaiser website
Interview Questions: What did you like about your previous job

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Lancaster, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Thirty minute Group interview with Manager and two supervisors. Very thorough. Lots of questions. Ensure to have any questions you may have ready. Prepare to talk about strengths and weaknesses.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for Kaiser?

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: From my experience, after submitting my resume I was contacted by a recruiter. After speaking to the recruiter, they sent me a link to apply. After several emails to follow up- Round two was with the hiring manager of the team. Round three was supposed to be with members of the team.
Interview Questions: Interviews were more of a conversation, they asked about my background and mainly wanted to know about my experience with employee relations and unions.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: questions were straight to the point. pleasant interviewer. took 30 minutes. received offer letter same day. felt more like a conversation rather than a structured interview, which i enjoyed. nice time
Interview Questions: how are your communication skills?

title: Employee Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Great process and communication. I enjoyed how great and easy the pre-onboarding process was to complete. It was quite lengthy, but worth it. I think this was the easiest process I've encountered thus far.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions in relation to the job.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: interviewed with recruiter, then separate interview with Principle investigator and other team member. multiple interviews, somewhat conversational interview style. come prepared with good questions to ask and do your research.
Interview Questions: time you worked with a difficult person? strength, weakness?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It can be a long process over months and it starts with a phone interview and then several interviews with other data analysts. They ask both analytical questions and behavior questions.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with missing data?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was friendly. They ask about project experiences on the CV and a few R questions. If you do not know the answer, they will teach you about the correct one.
Interview Questions: Talk about one project experience on CV

title: Estimator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a brief screening phone call to discuss the job and discerption to ensure both parties understood the roles and responsibilities. Meeting was scheduled for 20 min but went slightly over.
Interview Questions: Background in Estimating for healthcare projects

title: Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: For my interview process I had an in person, panel interview. It was relatively casual and I felt that the questions were appropriate and on par considering the job description.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with the Kanban system? What computer programs are you comfortable with? What handheld devices have you used? Are you more comfortable with placing orders, supply management, distribution etc.

title: MFM Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 3 person panel interview through Teams that had 20+ questions. Some were easy, some were hard. After a couple of weeks, I did a scanning interview with the physician of 3 patients. Be confident in your scanning!
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from others? Tell me a time where you faced conflict and how did you solve it?

title: SLP-CF Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vallejo, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via a recruiter who set up the interview. It was a panel interview of 3 SLPs who took turns asking questions. There were several get to know you questions and knowledge based questions on swallowing and CVA.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself. What is your experience with right hemisphere CVA patients?

title: Supply Chain Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line on the Kaiser job site. There were a few manager roles open. It took 4 months before I was contacted to interview. I had 2 rounds of interviews with human resources and the hiring team.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: RN NICU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is Not too bad honestly. It is pretty similar to most other rn interviews but it is panel interview which can be a bit more intimidating. But it is totally doable also their is a virtual interview option.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was virtual and done by a panel of nurse managers and supervisors. They asked me situational questions and also discuss moments in my career that were difficult and how I dealt with it.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Dental Member Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very short. Basic customer care skills and computer skills are needed. You must be able to handle cash and use credit/debit card systems. Must be professional and able to speak properly
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and what makes you unique?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a breeze. I had a panel interview with a total of 4 Kaiser employees. It is not as intimidating as it sounds. It was more of a conversation
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 2 step process with 3 interviewers. Took the time to get to know the candidates and asked open ended questions. Tried to look for personable candidates that are dynamic and capable of being placed in a variety of work environments
Interview Questions: How have you handled a disagreement?

title: EMT-B Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Simple easy interview they asked the basic questions and were overall very nice about it. Just have to ask questions to get a better idea of the job. Not sure what else I can add to this interview review. Kaiser has a lot of background checks which is a pain
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself please

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Large group and panel interview. They have a basket of questions written on pieces of paper which they send around the room and everyone grabs a question to answer. Afterward they give you a few minutes to “interview” the person next to you and you both will stand up and explain why they would be a good candidate to the panel. Incredibly nerve wrecking, but not a bad interview process when you think about it
Interview Questions: give an example of a time you didn’t agree with a coworker and how you resolved issue

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview process, in person and over zoom. Three part interview with supervisor with manager and team lead. Business casual attire. Basic competency tests and quizzes to complete to advance to next steps
Interview Questions: What have you done with a disgruntled caller

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Sent in application, heard back from receuiter, interview set up, on boarding orientation. Takes about 1-2 months for whole process. Asked behavioral questions and was placed in situations pertaining to the law.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and Weaknesses

title: Sr Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Redwood City, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: 2 levels: 1. phone screening with the hiring manager. Asked questions: why Kaiser, Tell me about the time when you worked with large data set, when you had a conflict, when you need explain finance to non-finance. 2. panel interview with the team. Recruiters were very helpful.
Interview Questions: Questions from the top 50 interview questions

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews asked about your work ethic. Relatable work experience and so forth. what is the most changeling work you have taken and how have you managed to execute the job
Interview Questions: describe a situation where you had to handle a difficult patient

title: Administrative Specialist III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with 3 people, I don't know it was going to be panel. They all took turns asking questions. It was about 1.5 hrs long. They seemed very interested, but wanted someone with a complete open schedule. I couldn't give them that since I am in nursing school.
Interview Questions: Drescribe a time you had multiple tasks that were priority? How did you prioritize them?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Redwood City, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward. The unit manager contacted me on the date that HR forwarded my resume to the unit. The phone interview last about 30 minutes. The unit manager is very polite and patient.
Interview Questions: What's your five year plan?

title: Ortho Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Probably the best interview I've experienced in 15 years! all attending were warm and welcoming. Very professional yet also very calm environment, great questions were asked and I already felt valued!
Interview Questions: Your face lit up while discussing casting, am I right?

title: Data Reporting and Analytics Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by recruiter and had interview scheduled.  On the day of the interview, it was cancelled due to hiring manager never accepted the invite.  Hiring manager then reaches out to me directly but without acknowledging the initial cancelled interview.  It was as if that mishap never happened.  Eventually, I had a 1 hour phone interview with the manager with typical questions that weren't very difficult.  Was sent a test to complete later that week.  After two weeks, I followed up by sending the hiring manager an email but never got a response.  I understand that sometimes they hold off on responding while screening additional candidates.  However, it seems that a lot of people have been experiencing this "ghosting" behavior and that is what prompted me to leave this review.  I don't mind not getting the position as I do lack the industry experience but a simple reply to my follow up email with "we found another candidate that is a better fit" would have been perfectly fine.
Interview Questions: Typical questions.  Test was in Excel to show math competency and technical skills

title: Pharmacy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: After the application process, you will have a video interview with 3 members asking you questions. In this position, they gave me a few math questions and then other questions relating to customer service. After they say you will receive the final decision from the recruiter. But this was a lie for me. I did not receive a message, I went and looked myself after not hearing from anyone for a week. The interview process was terrible and the link they gave me to sign into the interview was incorrect.
Interview Questions: Name a time you made a mistake and how did you fix it?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and a panel style interview. Given about 15-20 minutes window per slot. Broad and general questions. The interviewers were very nice and professional. Just prepare yourself for any questions.
Interview Questions: Ask about background, interest, why kaiser, experience.

title: Administrative Specialist IV Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview was to the point. I did an online assessment, a phone interview, and a panel video interview. This took an overall 3 months before I was offered the position. There was a delay in the hiring process due to the holidays. Even after I accepted the position, the recruiting team was transitioning staff which also delayed the onboarding process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your background

title: Cyber Security Analyst Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was very long process with many interviews over and over again. I had in total of 5 interviews and at the end, they never got back to me even though they said they would because I was waiting on the other offer as well.
Interview Questions: What is an IP Address

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for a position, maybe a week later I received an email invitation to answer HireVue questions. Then, received another email to update my application with my license # and certs. Received another email to complete candidate snapshot. Spoke with manager over the phone for about 5 minutes, mostly him explaining an internal candidate had taken merit for the position. He had other positions to offer however, just a different schedule. Received an offer email less than 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: If I planned on relocating

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got a call to schedule an interview. It was a virtual interview that was timed for 30 minutes. There were two people who interviewed me. They started off by introducing themselves and then they begin interviewing you. Still waiting to see if I got a job offer :)
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
What is your strength?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Hollywood, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: 1. Process improvement documentation sent through HR. Director reached out by phone a few weeks later and discussed panel interview. Received teams email with specific directive to have camera on - as they want to see me Panel interview - no one turned on camera - so rude. Panel fired questions at me for 45 minutes - then ghosted HR follow up - plan to go with internal candidates Position still posted months later
Interview Questions: recent process improvement projects that I have completed recently.

title: Case Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by 2 people virtually and got a call back a few days after. The hiring process took a month long and than I was given a start date.
Interview Questions: If I was a team player.

title: Clinical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fort Collins, CO) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Received an email from recruiter about the position.  The recruiter also attached a questionnaire along with the initial contact, asking for it to be returned, along with times for an interview with the Hiring Manager. After the inter with Hiring manager and the team, I was contacted by the same recruiter and given an offer.
Interview Questions: What’s your most rewarding project management experience?

title: Process Excellence Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Started with an online application then had the recruiter call for a phone screening 2 weeks later. Afterwards, the hiring manager set-up time to meet but then disappeared for some family issue. I had to reach out 2 months later to reschedule with him. The interview was 1 solid hours of interrogating my resume line item by line item. Afterwards, he said he didn't believe I was "seasoned" enough for the role. 4 weeks later, I reached out and the recruiter said he elected to just close down the job requisition.
Interview Questions: How exactly did you manage to get XX amount of profits? How did you solve XX problem? Remember, everything was based on my resume as though to find a flaw so be ready to discuss your bullet points with solid stories.

title: Biostatistician I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Got an interview invitation by email and arranged a phone interview. The interviewer called at the appointed time sharp. Then introduced their team's daily work, and start asking questions. Very nice interviewer, even though knowing that I need sponsorship but they cannot provide it, still talked a lot. The interview lasts 30min. Very good experience.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself about your experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward and simple. First started off with a phone call interview, then proceeded to a zoom call meeting with two recruiters. General questions about yourself and how you would act in the workplace were asked.
Interview Questions: What is one challenge you encountered in the workplace?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Washington, DC) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: 4 weeks total from initial application submission to job offer. In between that time was an assessment and two interviews. One phone interview with recruiter second interview was suppose to be panel style and an hour long.
Interview Questions: Open ended nclex style questions

title: Optometric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Video interview. On the fly scheduling. Had 4 people total interviewing me via video chat. It went very well and I was easily able to provide details of my experience. They asked me questions about my current jobs procedures.
Interview Questions: They asked about a time I had someone upset or frustrated and I was able to calm them.  They asked what my boss would say my weaknesses and strengths are.

title: Home Health Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Manager has fabulous integrity and support. Kaiser pays well and affordable benefits- significantly lower premiums than and other health care organization I've ever worked for over the last 10 years.
Interview Questions: How well do you work independently.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Panel of nurse supervisors and director. First they will ask you basic questions about your qualifications as well as your certifications, and then they will move on to situational questions regarding patient care, and how you would handle particular situations.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you have a patient with STEMI symptoms, what are your interventions and what are expected orders

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: There were Numerous interviews by phone and none in person. There were also no interviews outside of the department. The last interaction was to meet for a snack and coffee.
Interview Questions: In your opinion what is program management

title: Customer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: After the application, there is a simulation test which is fairly easy. Then a video interview, I had two people interview me. I answered 5 questions during the interview and heard from them a week later with an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you handled a difficult situation with a customer.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with manager and some staff nurses, asked the typical interview questions. They'll ask about your flexibility in regards to training to different units or scheduling. Staff nurses there will engage as well to see if you are a good fit for their unit. It's a good thing to ask to shadow a day on the unit to see the culture of the unit and their resources.
Interview Questions: Are you open to training to different units/specialty?

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Standard. Straight forward. Hiring manager was professional and experienced. Interview was detailed and I felt I was heard when it was my time to respond.  It was clear that she was impressed when the background of the company was mentioned.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
4 Rounds of interviews:
1) interview with the recruiter
2) panel interview with the team
3) leadership interview
4) case study interview

I think the challenge is scheduling- this is a lot of time to go back and forth with one company.
Interview Questions: Give an example of an improvement project you led

title: Entry Level Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: After you upload the resume, you will need to wait for HR to email you the next phone interview date. You will need to prepare for the basic financial equations and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions:
First talk about yourself (background, school, and internship experience)
Questions about cash flow.

title: Senior Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Efficient, professional, and smooth. 
Communication was great, the interviewer was transparent, and it did feel like they wanted to get to know the PERSON not just the skills. There was a lot of situational/behavioral questions but all some clinical scenarios.
Interview Questions:
What would you do if..... 
How would your current co-workers describe you?
How would you add value to this team?

title: Accounts Team Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I went through three interviews. It was a long process and the time between interviews took more than a week to hear back but met very nice people along the way.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: You are first sent an email to take an assessment once you pass the assessment you will receive another email in which they will schedule you for an interview. If you are a selected candidate you are then selected for a job offer
Interview Questions: How would you handle an angry patient?

title: Associate Therapist: Psychiatric Counselor  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Woodland Hills, CA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email by talent acquisition stating that my resume was being forwarded to the hiring manager and I would be contacted soon. 2 weeks later the hiring manager emailed me to set up an interview. Included in the email was all the info for the position such as salary, schedule, and a pdf of the benefits package. 2 weeks later the hiring manager emailed me to set up an interview (provided several days/times to choose from). The interview was on Microsoft Team and 2 hiring managers interviewed me for about 45 mins.
Interview Questions: They asked several questions like (tell us about you most difficult client, how did you manage conflict with colleague, provide a vignette and asked to give my thoughts on it) . Then asked if I had any question and asked me to email 3 references. I received a call 2 weeks later from talent acquisition offering me the position.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: great and fast and professional, great questions, positive attitude, informative about the job description and the company, kind, straightforward, they really represented the company in a great way and are the most professional people to meet with in person.
Interview Questions: salary, hours, availability, part-time or full time

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Three interviews:
- Phone:  Basic Gatekeeper HR Interview (Positive)
- In Person 1:  Team Leader One on One (Positive)
- In Person 2: Team Leader & Hiring Manager (Positive)

The In Person Interviews were back to back. Laid back but professional.
Interview Questions: Q. How do you approach team work?

title: Data Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
The process consists of: 1 information interview, behavioral interview, 1 written case

The overall process was good but it took over 2 months to hear the results back. Interviewers were nice and the whole process went smoothly but very slow in terms of results.
Interview Questions: How would you present your analysis to different stakeholders

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviewing, two with the manager and one with the PI. Advocate for yourself based upon the job description. The interview process was virtual, easy and accommondating. I recommend being familiar with the research study and prepared for questions regarding the study.
Interview Questions: Q: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Was called by hr recruiter and chatted about whether I would be a good fit for the position. She approved me to be interviewed by unit manager. It was a zoom panel interview with manager, 2 senior nurses, and the nicu nurse educator.
Interview Questions: Talk about a quality improvement initiative I have undertaken.

title: LPN- Private Duty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Easy, smooth.  People of Kaiser are very friendly and relatable. I would recommend  looking up some info about the facility before going into the interview. Also interview are still being held virtually.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time type of questions

title: Cashier Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Group interview after the initial phone interview with the manager.  Questions are all about the job you are applying for.  Overall it was an ok experience, not easy and also not very hard.
Interview Questions: If someone couldn't pay their co-pay, what would you say to them?

title: Physician Assistant, PA-C Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth. I spoke with a few people and everyone was friendly. The entire interview was about 30-40 minutes long. They asked a variety of behavioral and typical traditional questions. Then they spend some time discussing the position further.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for Kaiser?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Good, staff makes you feel comfortable when they're asking your questions and they allow you to get to know them as well. They're not afraid to talk about themselves which is nice.
Interview Questions: What are a few of your hobbies?

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Milpitas, CA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very easy process. Sent an application and got an email about 2-3 weeks later asking for a snapshot that asks typical interview questions to be sent back. Also, it asks for a typing assessment. Got called for an interview 1 week later. Interviewed 3 days later and got a call back with offer 5 days later.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was easy with a few pre selected questions asked.  Very strong emphasis on applicable questions that deal with call center related scenarios.  Overall not too bad and aligns with call center role related questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation where you cannot understand what the member is verbalizing to you?

title: People Listening Analytics Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very fast - from phone screen to offer in a couple of weeks. Relaxed, but professional. It was a comfortable process. The exercise was live, which was interesting, and kept it reasonably short.
Interview Questions: What would you like to be known for?

title: Pharmacy Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview then had an in person with a panel of managers & supervisors.
Very welcoming, asked scenario questions along with typical interview questions.

Called a few days later for offer
Interview Questions: “Please tell me about yourself”

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was actually really unique and fun. We were asked to create a 10 minute power point presentation about ourselves, following a rubric and answering questions about nursing journey and experiences. There were 5 candidates and two interviewers. They were really nice.
Interview Questions: Provide a highlight or highlights from your clinical rotations that demonstrate experience(s) that have shaped your future clinical practice.

title: New Grad Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview in the format of an elevator speech/self-introduction presentation with six panelists and six candidates. The nursing manager directed a behavioral question to each candidate towards the end of the interview.
Interview Questions:
Why Kaiser?
Describe a conflict with a patient or colleague and how did you resolve it?
How would your close family and friends describe you in one word?

title: Physician Assistant, PA-C Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: They ask various, random clinical and behavioral questions. First interview is casual screening, the second interview is panel with manager and providers. Takes around 45 minutes-1 hr and conducted over video.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to deal with a difficult patient and how you handled the situation.

title: Physician/Pediatrician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly staff. Respected COVID regulations and provided an N 95 mask. Spoke with multiple physicians who were all polite and answered questions candidly including things they liked or disliked about their own jobs. Staff seemed genuine.
Interview Questions: My strengths and weaknesses and how I managed them

title: Marketing Data Analyst Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very chill. Asked questions about projects and work experience and basic concepts. But got rejected as it did not accept h1b visas. Consisted of a single round with the manager and an aptitude test.
Interview Questions: 1. Tell me about yourself?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy interview process with multiple layers of management. Can take months to hear back from the recruiter.  The whole interview process can lead you to meet with several leaders and departments and coworkers you will work with.
Interview Questions: Tell about your work experience.

title: Research Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It starts out with them showing a lot of interest. Then, even when the interviews go well, you are left in the dark. An internal source said there is often an internal candidate already selected, but interviews are still held under the premise of an "open search".
Interview Questions: How do you manage competing priorities?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by phone to set up an interview and was asked a few simple questions about what I am looking for. The lady was extremely nice and informative which encouraged me to move forward with the process.
Interview Questions: Do you expect to get a job from this experience?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: No questions were asked.  It was basically what shift do you want?? No tell me about yourself or anything like that.  There were no so why do you want to be a nurse.  It's all a matter of who you're related to that gets you the job.
Interview Questions: What shift would you like to work?

title: Ui\Ux Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
This company treats their candidates like trash.

We had the initial meet and greet. The entire interview was the most awkward interview I have ever experienced. Multiple awkward silences where they didn't even know what to ask. They weren't too sure who was suppose to lead the meeting. They weren't too sure who was suppose to be asking questions. I literally had the break the awkward silence multiple times like I was on a date. It felt like they scheduled the interview but with no plan or agenda.

A week later I do the portfolio presentation and everything goes well. No time for me to ask anything.

2 weeks later they ask me to do another portfolio presentation for more people. 4 out of 6 people who were suppose to be at the meeting didn't show up. They made me present the same thing again for no reason. They left me no time for questions again but this time they told me to submit my questions via email and they assured me that they would reply back within the day.

I sent my questions. Nobody replied. I simply got ghosted.

If I was an unqualified candidate, I would somehow understand. I was interviewing with fortune 50 companies at the same time and nobody treated me like this. I just accepted a role for more than what they were offering.

Learn to respect people Kaiser. And no, you are not a non-profit company when you have 50 billion dollars cash in bank no matter how much you lie to people.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your work history and present your portfolio twice for no reason.

title: Physician, Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Get in touch with recruiter, apply o line. Date fixed for video interview. Timely interview on Microsoft teams with chief of medicine department. Immediate feedback and discussion about next steps
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in the positio

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview. Telephone call from recruiter asking a few more questions and explaining a bit more about the position to see if i was still interested in interviewing.  Then an in person interview with department director, manager and supervisor.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an upset patient?

title: Pharmacy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I Applied online on indeed. Com for pharmacy assistant , and received a call maybe a week later,  and did a phone interview with the screening question, then interview with 2 managers. The whole process maybe took a month to get the answer and start on orientation.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Typical questions such as your strengths and team work experiences. It started off as an interview. After the interview it turned out to be a normal conversation explaining expectations and other logistics.
Interview Questions: Could you tell me one time you worked in a team?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time to set up the interview. Not sure why they had a delay in reaching out to me. The website doesn’t offer very much update.  Once scheduled the interview went fine.
Interview Questions: Why I want the role

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: It’s a series of about five questions about yourself and your skills. Then it’s about five scenario questions about how would you handle certain calls. Then they ask you do you have any questions for them to answer.
Interview Questions: How do you think you would fit into working at Kaiser in this position.

title: Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Three part process that includes common interview questions/scenario questions. Then case study images and deserving pathology, third part is a scanning interview . I need 30 words for this to submit
Interview Questions: Scenario question on how to handle conflict.

title: Associate IT Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Greenwood Village, Arapahoe, CO) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Relatively quick interview process. Main interview was the panel interview where they asked a question about system architecture. The recruiter was nice and I was able to keep in contact
Interview Questions: How would you design a certain application?

title: Customer Srevice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: This interview took place virtually for the position of Customer Service Representative in Duluth Georgia.  This was very nice and very convenient.  I actually live 40 minutes away so being able to meet online was a game changer for me.  It was the first time for me doing an interview online.  I was very relaxed.  I like that
Interview Questions: Are you flexible with your schedule?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The process was about 30-45 min, talked about the basics, why I want to work here, Why I want the job, etc. Talked about who I am and the experience I have
Interview Questions: What interests me to work there.

title: Optometrist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: 2-on-1 face to face for 1 hour after a 45-minute screening phone call. No tour of facility, no meeting with other staff or docs. Was asked more about people I knew/worked with than about qualifications
Interview Questions: Strength/weakness? Will you work 40 hours/week(job posting was for a part-time position)?

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Duluth, GA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Took me a month to get an interview , then another 2 months to get a job offer . I was supposed to start in August didn’t start until January because I wasn’t informed of the Covid vaccine policy .
Interview Questions: Why did I apply to Kaiser ?

title: Contact Lens Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. Panel of current contact lens clerk, back office supervisor, optical supervisor, managing Optometrist, and dept administrator. 1-2 questions from each individual. They explain the position. They ask if I have any questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Group interview
Behavioral interview questions
Multiple interviews may be required 
Interviewing may be done through video 
Make sure to have detailed answers to several different behavioral tasks and scenarios
Understand their mission statement and the reason why you want to work for Kaiser
Interview Questions: Please tell me a time when you successfully assisted a customer?

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through their official website for jobs, then got emailed notified by a recruiter to set a screening call to qualify and then the recruiter coordinated an interview with the hiring manager and then from there a zoom call and then an interview panel.
Interview Questions: Who are you and describe your role and how it may relate to this current position

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I had a call video interview with two managers. After the first interview I had another with the senior manager.  In general the process was pretty easy and was a great experience.
Interview Questions: For the most part it was all Behavioral Questions

title: Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Entire process took 3 months. Multiple rounds scheduled with weeks in between and minimal communication from the recruiter. Somewhat disorganized process, interview questions were repeated at different rounds, at one point, I was asked to answer the same question with the same answer that was asked some rounds before. Some interviewers were not experienced at conducting interviews. After 4 rounds of interviewing (most interviews were 90 minutes long); was ghosted by Kaiser and the recruiter. Bullet dodged, it appears. If this is how little they value your time before you join - how will you be treated after ?
Interview Questions: Standard behavioral type questions.  Same set of questions repeated for 3-4 rounds. Although later rounds were meant to be more technical, the questions were still quite generic.

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The recruiting/hiring process was very disorganized from the start. Poor communication, long wait times. I was tested/interviewed and advised I was narrowed down to meet the team. I loved the manager, but the hiring process was problematic. It took over a month for them to say they offered the job to another candidate only after I reached out in an attempt to get a response. I am glad I received another offer elsewhere right in the nick of time - guess the cards were in the air for me. I would never apply to Kaiser again. I always say, the way HR handles matters shows the inner culture of a company. You always want to feel a company is efficient and truly cares about their employees and their standards.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult person

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Renton, WA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Series of questions related to your previous work experience and how you handled difficult customers or encountered challenging workplace situations.  Must be proficient with call handling and computers.  Do you know any medical terminology?
Interview Questions: How would you respond to an upset customer

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: New grad program Panel of 6 interviewers asking: Why choose kaiser? What is a situation where you have a miscommunication and what did you do to make it better? A time where you have a difficult client and how did you deal with it? What units you are interested in?
Interview Questions: Why choose kaiser? What is a situation where you have a miscommunication and what did you do to make it better? A time where you have a difficult client and how did you deal with it? What units you are interested in?

title: Resolution Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very professional, 7 questions were asked. Talked about my resume and experience. Went over the job description and asked if I still wanted the position. The questions were based on the STAR interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a member.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Alameda, CA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process had 1 phone screening and 2 rounds of panel interviews with staff PT and director. Each interview lasted about 1 hour each. Each staff PT and director takes turn asking questions and you are given time to ask them questions as well.
Interview Questions: Case study: go through the history collection, examination, and treatments for a patient with LBP.

title: Data Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds - hr phone screening, hiring manager, meet the director. Very professional and nice HR experience. Heard from them in 2 weeks. Salary is not that negotiable as it is a health care giant company.
Interview Questions: projects, project management, cloud tech knowledge and experience

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: My Interview was with the primary care team including Doctors, RNs, MAs. They asked great questions about strengths, weakness, etc. Also asked for specific examples for a time when you went above and beyond, made a mistake etc.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time when you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews over a few weeks with almost no flexibility as to when they could see me. This was including a panel with approximately 10 current employees. A bit overwhelming.
Interview Questions: Clinical vignette - gave a theoretical client situation, asked how I would assess and treat the client.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Expect your first interview to be a case study without having time to prepare. "There are no wrong answers".. proceeds to tell you that your answer is wrong. No status updates on jobs either. If I hadn't reached out I would've been left hanging.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about yourself.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was very very Great and straight to the point it was not too stressful or scary to go into the room with all the other people or nurses or other  nurse or staff that were also interviewing at the same time for the same positions as well
Interview Questions: Tell me your weaknesses and strengths

title: Optometry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: There was 6 people interviewing me at once, odd questions, most uncomfortable interview I’ve ever had. Script like questions so no getting to actually know the person you’re about to hire
Interview Questions: Typical stuff “how have you handled a conflict at work”? Followed with odd questions “if you were a bird what kind of bird would you be”?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Apply on website and get call from a recruiter, who screens you for job requirements.   Diverse panel does the interview with a lot of STAR questions; situation, task, action, results;
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to influence someone else and you did not have formal authority

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I did a 30 minute interview with the hiring manager over Teams, then about a week later,  another 30 minute panel interview with the hiring manager + 2 team members over Team. I received an email from the recruiter wanting to meet one week later for a 15 minute phone call and I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: How did you apply [a specific skill from the job description] in your previous role?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Beautiful experience! Very relaxing and straight to the point. The interviewer was delightful, did not make me feel anxious in any way.  It was very professional, one of the best interviews I've ever been on!
Interview Questions: 6 months of experience prior to application

title: Senior Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Overall interview process is 3 rounds
1st round – Summary of the overall Job Profile.
2nd round –  past roles,Responsibilities and also bit technical on Sql, Tableau and python skills.
3rd round – soft skills, how well they fit in on the team
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your self?
Why do you want to work with kaiser
Tell me about the time when you have difficult situation and how did you work?

title: Sr. Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process consisted of an informational interview, and interview with the future supervisor and colleague, and a final interview with the supervisor and senior leader. 

The interviewers were very personable and the interview itself felt more like a conversation than an “interrogation”. Very smooth process.
Interview Questions: How have you handled a difficult employee?

title: Operating Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview with 3 subject experts, mutiple questions ask about many job duties and equipment, and a review of your past employment and experiences. The interview fells more like a test with questions and your answers with no indication of discussion. Any wrong answer can be the difference of obtaining a position or not.
Interview Questions: This should not be addressed. Bring your expereince and be ready

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview with many asking questions
Where do you see yourself in 5 years? · Tell us a time when you had a conflict with a coworker? · Describe a time when you had to deal wit
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? · Tell us a time when you had a conflict with a coworker? · Describe a time when you had to deal wit

title: Data Scientist IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: 1. Fill out questionnaire from recruiter 2. Call from hiring manager more behavioral 3. Interview with Panel 2x mostly project questions and easy data science questions. 4. Interview with director of division
Interview Questions: Tableau questions. Level of detail and basic tableau visual creation questions. Basic Data Science questions like what is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning. Basic NLP questions Python questions: python memory management, the different structures in python, do you know python?

title: Graduate Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was one interview and it was about close to an hour. The interview was very informative. And I learned quite a bit, before I even started my role there.
Interview Questions: How prior experiences relate to current experiences

title: Cyber Threat and Discovery Graduate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from hiring manager directly to schedule a panel video interview. After couple of weeks the interview was schedule. The video interview consists of questions on my resume, behavioral questions and few digital forensics questions. Overall, the interview went well.  I do have to note that it was very odd that none of the interviewers turned on their cameras during the interview. They could see me, but I couldn't see them.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about KP?
What is HIPPA?
What is MD5?
Resume questions

title: Workforce Health Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I went through an initial interview that was one-on-one. That went well. Afterwards, I was invited to participate in a second interview to meet the team. That went well also. Overall the interview process went well for me.
Interview Questions: Why you would be a good fit for this position

title: Mental Health Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Hollywood, Los Angeles) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Transparent and warm. Made sure I knew the pay rate and was welcoming to my questions. Transparent and warm. Made sure I knew the pay rate and was welcoming to my questions.
Interview Questions: The brought up a vignette that they requested my case conceptualization on.

title: Undergraduate Marketing Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very chill, welcoming. The interviewer was very professional and nice, they did not make me feel unwelcome, and the vibe was very casual. Overall, a great experience and would interview there again.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser?

title: Sr. Category Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a Recruiter and I went through two additional rounds of interviewing. In each round the organization and reporting structure was defined differently. By the time I got to the third round they weren’t even sure I was going to be reporting to the hiring manager that I originally interviewed with. It seems like they don’t really know what they want. They decided they didn’t think my questions were answered in detail enough and instead lowballed me on an offer. I declined.
Interview Questions: On my third round the interviewer showed me PowerPoint presentations and asked me if I had done “this side of the triangle”.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal and informative.  The hiring manager had very good knowledge of her departments and ran them well.  She transferred to another department shortly thereafter and her replacement did not seem as confident
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to transition to the payer side of healthcare?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, waited a couple weeks before someone reached out to me.  Had to pass math test.  Interviewed with manager.  Whole process from first call to when I started was maybe 3 months
Interview Questions: Describe how you work as a team member

title: IT Business Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was recommended for the job by a manager within the company, which streamlined the interview process. I was hired after briefly interviewing with the hiring supervisor and the supervisor's manager.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have creating documentation of computing systems for internal and external audits?

title: Compliance Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite ordinary and unremarkable.  I believe it's what you would typically expect, a follow-up questionnaire, an HR screening call, and then a panel interview.   The one thing I can say that was a bit of a surprise is that the virtual interviews were scheduled weeks  rather than days in advance.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult initiative that you had to socialize with senior leadership and implement.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: first is a phone call screening, then undergo an online programming test, during which you were give data and tasks, if you pass the test, then there is a final interview.
Interview Questions: WHat is the project that you worked on

title: Genetic Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Group style interview. Meet often with manager or director first. Not super structured. Also meet with union rep. Gives time for you to ask questions. Current doing virtual with pandemic.
Interview Questions: What interests and areas of practice you enjoy most

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: went for a first interview,  there was 3 people interviewing, I had gotten an offer but I declined. the questions asked was easy and practical, the pay was also good for the position
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff RN II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview questions. Polite, professional, kind. Relatively quick onboarding process. Saved my job for me way in advance, which was very kind of them. However, the job title was a little misleading.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in nursing?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied through KP career website. Got an invitation to interview 2 months later. The whole process was not too long. I had 2 rounds of interview with the manager, the data consultant, and the VP of the department

title: SAS Analytical Programmer I/II, Epidemiologic Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
There is a three-part interview process, consisting of a an initial screening call with the manager, a SAS assessment, and a panel interview. 

For the initial screening interview, the manager asked some questions about SAS procedures (e.g., duplicate identification and removal, merging, etc.) used in hypothetical scenarios. After answering these questions verbally, the manager informed me to look out for an email invitation for the assessment. The manager also commented, "most people find the assessment to not be too hard." 

For the SAS assessment, I was asked to access their computer remotely via MS Teams and was provided with some sample data and some questions. I was asked to write a program to answer these questions and was asked to include comments in the program to explain the process I was using. The assessment is fairly straightforward if you have experience with working with dates, aggregation, duplication removal, and merging methods in SAS. There is also an "extra" question at the end that is more complicated that is explained as "optional" unless you have time left. Your webcam must remain on while you do the assessment. You are permitted to access the internet on your end and look up anything you need to complete your program.

Some days later, I was informed that I was being invited for a panel interview, and I assumed I had been proficient enough on the assessment for this to happen. The panel interview was conducted by the manager, the director, and a programmer from the group. The director briefly described the department and gave a summary of my CV. The manager described a little more about the department from a programming perspective. They asked me to explain why I was considering this position and what my long-term goals were. They also stated that this was a salaried, non-overtime eligible position, and the work would "sometimes" exceed 40 hours. Employee retention and turnover also appears to be an issue, but this is not outright discussed. The manager appeared uncomfortable when asked about work/life balance. 

KP Talent/Recruiting reached out to me some time after that, telling me that I was a 'finalist' for this position and asked me a few other questions about what I hoped to gain from this position. Eventually, they came back and made me a formal offer that I felt was lo. I ended up asking more questions about work hours, including weekends. Although they would not come out and say it outright, it was clear that given the nature of the high-volume/fast-paced work and how it could be difficult to adjust, staff was regularly and not occasionally working well beyond 40 hours, including weekends. Also, they do not appear to really factor experience into the title they offer you. The position is listed as I/II, but they claim that their assessment is what determines who is a level I or II even though their level I description seems like it is written for an entry-level job. Additionally, promoting to level II from level I is not guaranteed. It is quite possible that it might take years or it may never happen due to financial issues. This is something that the manager disclosed, but the talent/recruiting did not convey this. 


Ultimately, I ended up declining the offer. This appears to be a position in which experienced individuals are hired at a lower level knowing that they will churn out work for a period of time before getting frustrated and leaving due to the compensation not reflecting the work volume.
Interview Questions:
1. Have you ever experienced failure at a previous job? If so, please explain what happened and how you handled it.

2. What are the three things that are most important to you in a job like this?

3. This job entails high-volume, fast-paced work with deadlines that are difficult to meet. Are you prepared to handle this level of work?
