title: Medicaid Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
To determine if a household is eligible for SNAP, states must conduct an interview at application and at recertification, typically at least once per year. Successfully completing the interview is essential to ensuring that eligible clients receive food assistance. Reducing missed interviews reduces the need for households to reapply for benefits and for eligibility workers to reprocess redundant paperwork. Although there is no one-size-fits-all approach to completing interviews, agencies have increased the number of interviews completed within mandated timeframes using the following promising practices.

Increasing SNAP Interview Completion Rates
Agencies typically conduct a combination of scheduled and unscheduled, walk-in and telephone interviews. Most agencies allow phone interviews; however, if applicants request an in-person interview, the state must still offer it. In general, SNAP agencies will complete more interviews when they use a flexible interview process that accommodates a household’s schedule and have different options for conducting the interview (phone and in-person). Examples of such flexibility include:

When the client is in the SNAP office or on the phone, agencies can conduct the interview while the client is there and available:

If a client walks into an eligibility office to apply or recertify, conduct a same-day interview while the client is in the office.
If clients can apply or recertify over the phone (using a telephonic signature), conduct the interview while the client is on the phone to complete the whole process in one step.

Note: only state/county eligibility workers can conduct interviews, which may have implications for call center staffing.

Agencies can also conduct an unscheduled interview by trying to reach the client or allowing the client to call the SNAP office at their convenience.

When an application or recertification is received, make a cold call to see if the client is available right then to complete the interview. Contact information is most likely to be accurate closer to the date of application.
Clients may screen calls. Some agencies have found it effective to leave a messagesaying why they are calling and then try calling again in a few minutes. To increase the likelihood that clients pick up the call, agencies will want to be sure that the caller IDcorrectly notes the state agency vs. a general number or “blocked caller.”
Send a text messageto let the client know that a caseworker will be calling soon to conduct the interview.
Make multiple calls at different times over a few days to try to reach the client.
Use a call-in model, where clients are instructed to phone a call center to complete their interview within a certain number of days after submitting their application or recertification. These are referred to as “on-demand” interviews.
States may get an on-demand interview waiver to conduct all interviews on-demand or can use a call-in model without a waiver by still scheduling an interview time but offering the client the option of calling in any time before the scheduled interview.
State Spotlight
New York City On-Demand Interviews

The New York City Human Resources Administration (HRA) identified eligibility interview challenges, including that 20 percent of SNAP applications were denied for missed interviews and that excess staff time was spent scheduling and rescheduling interviews. In response, HRA piloted on-demand interviews for SNAP recertifications and created new outreach materials — an online message instructing clients to call for their interviews after submitting their recertification form, along with emails, texts, and robocalls reminding clients to call in for their interview. Clients are instructed to complete their recertification form online or at a local office and then call the SNAP Interview Phone Line to complete their interview. During the pilot, HRA saw an increase in the number of interviews completed at recertification and a decrease in agency workload from scheduling, rescheduling, and making multiple attempts to reach the client by phone. Following success with the recertification interviews, HRA expanded on-demand interviews to new applicants.

If the agency schedules an interview:

Allow clients to select an interview time that works for them through a mobile app or online portal rather than assigning them a time.
Send a text reminder before the scheduled interview.
For SNAP recertification interviews, call clients at the scheduled time even if they have not returned their recertification form to conduct the interview and remind them to send in their recertification form.
Making the Most out of SNAP Interviews
Interviews are an opportunity for SNAP agencies to clarify information reported on applications or recertification forms, collect verification documents, and answer client questions. Agencies can make the most out of the client interview by:

Trying to resolve all verification issues during the interview.
Interview Questions: Medicaid Strategy planning and sonstructive implementation.

Several months later was contacted by HR saying they had offered the position to someone else, that fell through, and they were circling back with top applicants. Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The text-based interview was absolutely horrid and only provides the opportunity to select the available choices and the user is not able to include any additional information.  I understand their desire to weed out those who are not qualified, however, this is NOT the way to conduct any interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) or other comparable business analyst or IT consulting certification?

title: Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very good and fast process. HR called me to arrange a phone interview with HM. And after that there were two on-site interviews with HM and others. Most questions were about working experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me your work experience in the field of analysis.

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Apply online........    wait weeks maybe months                             
get email interview questions........ answer and send back within two days..............wait........               
get interview call from talent acquisition .....................               
interview with department......tour......wait some more....if offered then decide
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Flight Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Redondo Beach, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: You had to answer a number of questions pertaining to your beliefs, experiences in life. The questions were multiple choice or rated from 1 to 10, they had to do with scenarios  that could happen in the work place
Interview Questions: interview was a personality questionnaire.

title: Speech Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: There are two rounds of interview. one with upper management and one with speech coordinator.  But they both ran very smoothly.  A lot of the questions is the make sure you have experience clinically. Some hospitals also check to see fi you fit in.
Interview Questions: They did ask about clinical questions as well as biographic information.

title: Pharmacy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Panorama City, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The process took a long time but i recommend that you follow up with your application. I got a phone called from Hr and took about 3 weeks to get the assesment test link, After assesment test then you would get a phone call for an interview. Follow up your application and be in touch with your Hr.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me about yourself?
- Have you deal with difficult customers and how you handle?
- Have you deal with difficult coworkers and how you handle?
- What would your supervisor say about you?
- Talk about your previous job experience.
- How did you know about this job?
- Why Pharmacy assistance?

title: Senior Consultant, Medicare Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Overall process took about 1 month in  total. Recruitment team was professional, and courteous. Thanked me for my interest. In the phone screen I had a great conversation with the recruiter. Within a few days I had a first round interview with the hiring manager. There were some technical difficulties on my end, but we were able to have a wonderful conversation. Very shortly after that I was offered a 2nd round interview with a Panel, which was 90 minutes. A little lengthy, but it allowed for a deeper conversation and good dialogue.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your background as it related to market strategy and product development

title: Actuarial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
- In the phone interview with HR, I answered some basic questions such as the qualifications, why choose Kaiser, salary expectation, etc.
- After the first step, I had a one-hour video interview with actuarial team leader. He is very nice and asked me questions about some basic statistics concepts and Excel skills.
- In the video interview with team members, they asked me the same questions I had been asked before, going through again the resume.
- The video interview with actuarial manager is as above.
Interview Questions: - Experience in the resume.

title: Health Education Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: It went smoothly, but also because I was in a contract position and they wanted to hire me for the job already. So it was easy for me since they already knew me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Had two interviewers, the  manager and someone on the team. Fairly easy questions and was laid back. They made me feel comfortable and definitely was conversational. Got offered the job a couple days later after they finished their screening.
Interview Questions: What is customer service to you?

title: IT Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Knowledgeable recruiter.  The position was canceled before an interview was scheduled with the hiring manager.  The recruiter did an excellent job of communicating the process, delays that came up, every step of the way.
Interview Questions: Subject matter expertise in a large complex environment

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Formal but friendly. Job expectations and salary/benefits clearly explained. At least 2 separate interviews - one with hiring director and one to meet with site leaders and staff. Some interview questions included providing examples or clinical scenarios of difficult patients or work situations.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Psychological Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for child and family psychiatry at a few different Kaiser locations. Usually these interviews are with the department managers who ask expected questions about your background and clinical experience.  They also often give you a vignette to conceptialize.
Interview Questions:
Describe your clinical style/orientation. 
How do you manage risk?

title: Home Health Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview was on the phone and my 2nd interview was a panel interview. It took about 30-45 days after the interview to start day 1 with Kaiser. It took about a week and I got both phone and email accepted offer.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situation and how did you overcome it?

title: Surgery scheduler coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview, we interview each other, then they question us about the other person. They ask the group interview question without getting individuals' true qualifications. A very general and impersonal.
Interview Questions: Ask each other what we think of the other person.

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Duluth, GA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Applied - 9.18.21
Received assessment- 9.23.21
Virtual Interview -10.5.21
1st(contingent) offer letter -10.12.21
Background, drug test completion, health(passed)-10.28.21
A final offer letter and start date- 11.4.21

The virtual interview was pretty straight forward no trick or confusing questions. For me, it was the waiting and anticipation of what was next that was killing me.
Interview Questions:
What do you want to work for kaiser? 
what do you know about Kaiser? 
Tell me about a time you had to go above and beyond? 
Tell me about a time you dealt with a difficult customer and how did you handle it? ..

title: Teen Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, asked common question about myself, words that best described me, why I wanted to volunteer, my skills, and many more; it was more like a causal conversational interview
Interview Questions: What three words best describe you?

title: Cashier/Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied a week before scheduled phone interview. The email for representative to reach out was a few days after and scheduled interview the following day. The process took some time.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview within 2 weeks of my application. Performance based questions. Information provide about position.  Interview results within 2 weeks.  Everyone I spoke to was very polite.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for KP?

title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: good really nice staff and company to work for it can be stressful at times but you can manage. hoping to grow with them and be successful and be come an rn
Interview Questions: how do you handle bad situations

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 3 round interview - phone, behavioral, technical / presentation.  Typical questions asked referencing past applicable experiences.  All questions asked were those that you would expect from any analytics related position
Interview Questions: Reference a project that involved statistical analysis

title: Senior Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: i got a call in the middle of the day and had phone interview with hr. during the phone interview, i was offered for zoom interview with a team member. the zoom interview lasted for about an hour. i was told that she would contact me back but never heard from her ever since.
Interview Questions: they asked a couple of math questions in determining a profit from given data table.. and also gave you a scenario and asked for a resolution for certain problem i think she asked what data would you use to increase the profit or something)

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: I got a call to schedule an interview the day after I applied. and that same day i had a phone interview. Typical scenario questions were asked & also a few personal goal questions.
Interview Questions: A patient calls to schedule an appointmment. However The protocol for the patients symptoms is to speak to the nurse. The patient is refusing to speak to a nurse and just wants you to schedule. How would you persuade the patient to stay on the line and speak to the nurse.

title: Scheduling Appointment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: My interview was rescheduled due to technical issues with the video, then I had to reschedule due to work hours.  The interview was today with a panel of 3 which included HR & 2 supervisors who took turns asking questions.  They said they're doing a lot of interviews and will let me know in 2 weeks however, I know 2 other people who said they were hired on the spot so I guess they passed on me.  Overall they were pleasant.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time your manager had something negative to say about you

title: Cashier/Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview lasting about 15min. The interviewer asked one question. She explained what the position entailed. She told you what to expect after this interview. To continue to apply for jobs and not to quit your job before offer. The process is very competitive.
Interview Questions: Explain one situation with a customer and how you handled it.

title: Engagement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The process was a bit long which is to be expected from an organization as large as Kaiser. From applying online I was selected to take a personality quiz, which took close to a month if I recall correctly. I was quite honest with it which obviously didn't hurt me (there's a couple questions about if you're willing to ditch your family for work, for example). After that I had a brief chat over the phone with the hiring manager and asked to put together a presentation on a topic of my choice, and then finally a virtual interview via video call with the interview panel.

I did not get an offer which is fine, however I do find it quite annoying and unprofessional to be ghosted by the hiring manager after making it this far in the process. Unfortunately to be expected of employers when applying for jobs, but I feel like asking for a form rejection letter after doing multiple rounds of interviews is a reasonable ask.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you took ownership of a mistake you made with a client and how you worked through it.

title: Housekeeping Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Got a call for a panel interview with a batch of interviewees, where we each took turns being interviewed by the Head of EVS, a Union Rep, and a Supervisor. Received email and job offer on Kaiser job site.
Interview Questions: What do you like about Kaiser Permanente?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Typical interviews session. There were 2 people sitting in on the interview. The session lasted about 30 minutes. One person asked the question and the other was writing down notes.
Interview Questions: What is your strength and weakness?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself I thought went very well, management that I interviewed with was very easy to talk to and kind.  They asked questions related to the job, and my past experiences. I did
Interview Questions: Explain a time you have had to deal with a difficult coworker and how you resolved it

title: Data Analyst Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 1. Video interview, record your answer in a software platform, questions like, tell me about yourself, take about your project.  2. Meet with the team. 3. Meet with the team. All the interviews have not many technical questions. 95% behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What is your weakness?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very long process.  I applied for the position almost a year before being contacted.  After the interview, I was told I would receive an answer in the next 3 months.  I never received a call or email, I had to reach out to them.  At the time of setting up my interview, I was told there would be 2 other people at the interview from other departments.  When I arrived to my interview, there were 6 people who took turns asking me questions.  A majority of the questions were scenario questions and it was difficult to determine what they were looking for from them.
Interview Questions: There was a question regarding a difficult situation in dealing with a subordinate and how I handled it.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Generally 2 - 4 rounds for leadership positions. Mostly behavioral questions. Have not seen business case type interviews since I've been with the company. If non-union, need to apply as soon as the job posts.
Interview Questions: How do you lead people and build teams?

title: Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I got an email to schedule an interview and was asked to provide a sample of my writing. I had one interview on video with the hiring manager and was completely ghosted. I sent follow-up emails as well and heard nothing. I felt it was extremely rude and the way we ended the interview was on a positive note. It would have been disappointing to get a "we're not moving forward" email but nothing was worse and disrespectful of my time and effort.
Interview Questions: There were some conversational questions to begin with - tell me about yourself, past experiences. There were also a few knowledge based questions in relation to the fellowship.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with 12 people. Two interviewers and the questions start from the side of the line, so try to be in the middle. Semi-professional, a lot of age variance.
Interview Questions: Big question was: Give an example of how you worked in a group.

title: PM Leas Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward process. Initial 30 mins interview with a panel; followed by a 45 minute panel interview.  Panel members took turns in asking questions.  The process was smooth. Interview was conducted via MS Teams.
Interview Questions: How did I manage a non performing project team member?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Great process Easy going Friendly Interviewed with HR and then hiring mgr. received offer directly after. Sometimes can take long time but my experience was fast and easy. Highly recommend company
Interview Questions: What are you Weakness and strengths

title: Data Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straightforward and asked for a mix of technical and behavioral questions. There were two interviews with the second interview focusing more on the technical knowledge of the individual.
Interview Questions: difference between an input and infile

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Multi-level interview. Had one interview with 2 people then called back for second interview with multi-panel interviewer's. Multiple people asking questions and writing as you answer. Asked questions that were expected to be asked but was somewhat intimidating.
Interview Questions: Name a time you were faced with a difficult situation with an employer. What was it and how did you handle it?

title: Call Center Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: They asked mostly about customer service experience, very thorough, explained very well, described the position very detailed and what to expect, position is highly competitive, gave a lot of information about the job
Interview Questions: What was the time you had a difficult customer?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fresno, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied in September of 2021 and then about a month later I got a call from the staff assistant to set up a video interview with two of the department managers. Questions were easy and straight forward.  About 5 mins after I got off video chat with the managers one of them called me back and offered me the position. In all interview process was quick but the actual hiring process took almost a month for them to complete. I guess they like to take to their sweet time but luckily I was still at my old job and had given them a 30 day notice or else I would've been in a pickle.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? 
How would you handle a difficult patient?  What was the outcome or was the issue resolved?
What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: easy and fast they will ask about 10-15 questions , and also ask if you're looking for part time / full time. The process was easy and done over zoom
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
It was long and had a lot of steps involved. 
However, they do communicate well throughout the process. I think it was mostly due to the pandemic. You get an email for a step each week.
Interview Questions: What was a challenged that you faced while at work and how did you handle it?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied through LinkedIN. Received an email 2 days later from the company recruiter to set up a phone screening. Stacy was kind and helpful in explaining the compensation and base salary, and made sure I was aware this would be a remote position indefinitely. After the phone screening I was asked to set up a time for a 30 minute zoom interview with the person who would be my sales manager. Very simple questions,
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and more

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I Met Lead Tech over the phone. Reviewed resume, and discussed Tech work. Straight forward and basic. They basically wanted to make sure I knew how to do the job.
Interview Questions: Describe how to put in an A-line?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 3 different interviews were given. They were straightforward just want to make sure you match the role that they will be having you do if you do get hired for the position. Very welcoming.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this role

title: Credentialing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I went in for interview. Everything went well. I had to submit urine test and undergo a background check. The overall process was about 3 weeks before my start date
Interview Questions: So. Tell me about yourself?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: My interview was 2 hours. It was panel interview. The interviewers were nice. There were scenarios questions and I had a hard time answering a few of them. Overall, I had a good experience.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Why are you interested in this position

title: MEDICAL Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: My interview was a virtual interview with 4 hiring managers through video chat. There were about 6 questions total. The interview questions were mainly about my past experiences and how I can contribute to the company.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Voulnteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It went well, they were nice and straightforward with me. It was over the phone due to COVID-19 but overall a pleasant experience. I can’t wait to get there and see how everything works out.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to this Kaiser?

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Thornton, CO) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I put in an application and then a few days later I got a link to do an assessment. After I did the assessment I got a call a few days later to do a virtual interview. The actual interview was with four other people. They asked four different questions. We were all asked the same questions however they switched the order so you didn’t know which of the four questions you would be asked next. A few days later I got an email with a job offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed by management and supervisor 
I was asked several questions, they drill me to see how I did under pressure. I remained calmed and smiled even when I was u sure about a question.
Interview Questions: Tell us how u deal with difficult situation

title: PACU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Bellevue, WA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Actual interview process was great. Received offer quickly, however hiring process on the back end was slow & took a month to receive negotiated offer. Recruiter seemed to be completely over worked and I felt like I was out in the back burner, not a good impression with recruiter. Also, she seemed unprofessional via phone & text
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where things were not going well for a patient and what did you do?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Conducted via Zoom with CNO due to manager’s vacations and turnover at the time. Interview was straight forward and lasted about 20 minutes. Went through the general questions like, “What makes you want to work for Kaiser?” And “Please summarize your educational and work experience.” Then she went onto more specific questions about past work situations i.e. handling a difficult recent work situation, an example of how you advocated for a patient, tell me about a time your patient was upset and how did you problem solve it, etc. Asked about whether I ever had a conflict with a coworker or physician. Lots of behavioral type questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you observed an unsafe situation (coworker mistake, medication error, your own mistake, unsafe patient handling, etc) and what was it and how did you handle it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Conducted through a zoom online. It was a group interview and all in attendance got to answer to questions accordingly however order to answer was different and at random each time
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the department manager and scheduled to interview 3 days later, on my interview I was told I would find out if I got it or not within 2 weeks. I didn't find out until 6 weeks later. The entire process took almost 3 months from applying, interviewing and actually onboarding. The interview itself was a little difficult because it was questions I wasn't expecting, more customer service based.
Interview Questions: How would you provide excellent customer service?

title: Account Administrative Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel style phone and in person interview. Had to answer about 10 questions in a small amount of time and not miss any of the questions. Also during the pandemic it was a MS teams interview.
Interview Questions: What number from 1-10 would you raw your attendance at your prior job?

title: Assistant Manager RN Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview process went well. I received a call back to go in for an in person interview and scheduled for a few days later. The day before I was scheduled to go in for the in person interview, I received a call that Kaiser was restructuring and was going to be taking the position out completely.
Interview Questions:
What projects have you worked on? 
What is the number of staff supervised?
Tell me a time when you handled a team conflict.

title: BHC Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took a very long time and the reference and background check is incredibly thorough. Since hiring the staffing process has been incredibly slow. Not a fast hiring process by any means.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role.

title: Volunteer Transport Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Was a group interview. Very basic questions on what type of person you are , your goals, past experience, willingness to work, etc 
Was very easy, everyone took turns answering around the table.
100 HOUR MINIMUM!!
Interview Questions: What is an obstacle you overcame?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: They do a panel interview. They interviewed us in groups, asked us to find a partner, tell them something about your partner (basically selling them) then they call whoever was accepted for the next round then youll pick a question and answer in front of everyone. (Like pageantry)
Interview Questions: They ask behavioral questions. Conflicts, communication, difficult times

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Roseville, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Done virtually now due to covid, but may be back to in person.  I interviewed with  middle and upper management. Can tell some questions are pre-set and are kind of awkward, but overall the entire process was fine.
Interview Questions: I honestly don’t remember the questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Online interview with two people, very casual and friendly. Started off with a little background about each person and then myself. Discussed the position and was asked like two interview questions
Interview Questions: Experience working with elderly patients?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, hiring manager interview, panel interview, final interview with regional managers (upper management). You get the sense that hiring manager interview there are about a dozen applicants, Panel interview had probably 6, and final 3-4 candidates went on to the upper management.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you were faced with conflict at work and how you handled it.

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview done through Microsoft Teams with two managers. Questions asked were about past work experience and job scenarios. They expect very descriptive responses. They will take notes on your responses.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to reach a tight deadline?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with a recruiter first then the hiring manager. Interview was a panel interview done virtually. I was an internal candidate. I didn't have a 3rd interview. Offer made and accepted.
Interview Questions: Describe how to handle high priority vs urgent

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews with 6 different employees at Kaiser. Lots of questions about project management and processes, overall very good process. I felt like they were truly interested in my experience.
Interview Questions: How have you handled conflict? How do manage projects?

title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: They asked about past experience. How you can handle a difficult situation and difficult coworker. They also asked about what machines you worked with. It was an average interview process.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult coworker

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a 30 minute phone call with the hiring manager, and the second interview was a 2 hour call with three of the heads of departments. They were not very friendly, or sounded interested in me as a worker.
Interview Questions: Typical. Research Experience and scenarios where you ran into conflict

title: Internal Medicine Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
lengthy interview, interviewed with panel of four to dix doctors
interviewed at three different sites. 
all interviews were similar, you interview with the chief and then panel of physicians. interviews last about half a day, includes lunch.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was hired in 2015 for a pharmacy technician. I had a phone interview, then an in-person interview.  They just asked about work history in the specific role. It was pretty easy. They said they would call with news if I was hired or not on a certain date. They didnt call so I called them. I think that made all the difference.
Interview Questions: Q: Describe a time when you had to work under pressure?

title: Sr. Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was fast, but the paperwork took forever.
Interview included a call with a recruiter, call with the director, sharing some extra information and examples of deliverables from previous projects, in-person meeting with the team.
Interview Questions: Walk me through one of your previous projects.

title: Admin Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente

Interview Questions: Tell us your 3 strengths.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Super nice people. They all greeetes me and made me feel comfortable. I work there now and I love it here. Best job ever. Apply for kaiser! You won’t regret it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Summer Internship Interview

title: Intern Interview

Interview Descriptions: Insightful and informative. Interviewer was friendly and calm. They asked about my experiences and how I had heard about the company and the position I was interviewing for. Overall, it was a good experience

title: Manager Interview

title: Med-surg RN Interview

Interview Descriptions: I had a. Great and through experience. Some delays but usually efficient in returning emails. Good process. No complains from the start to finish.. I would recommend this company to anyone

title: Physician Interview

title: Intern Interview

title: Multimedia Coordinator Interview

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: A half hour informal phone call talking about the role and what my responsibilities would be. Talked about what the project is and the interviewer asked a few questions getting to know me
Interview Questions: What are three things you are looking forward to?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Send your application online through their career website. A recruiter will reach out to you and schedule interview process. Interview was done online due to global pandemic happening at the time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser Permanente?

title: Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed in May 2021 for the Southern California branch of Kaiser. The interview was completed with three interviewers and one other intern candidate. Very casual and only took about 30 minutes. They told me that the position was technically hybrid, but I would only have to go into the office in Pasadena about once a week and that they would assign me to a team based off availability. 

Two weeks later they contacted me with an offer. They gave me 24 hours to accept or decline the offer. I initially accepted. 

About a month later, they assigned me to a team and I emailed my manager about the logistics of the internship. I did not hear back from her for 3 weeks, even after I followed up several times. About 4 days before the internship begins they reply saying I need to be in their Glendale office (which was not the office specified in the interview and is about 20 minutes further than the original Pasadena one) at least 4 times a week. I email back saying I was under the impression that I would only have to go in once a week, not 4, and that I did not have the money to do the hour drive almost every day of the week.  I also asked if there was any way that we could work something out. Finally, on the Friday before I am due to start the internship I get a call from a different manager (that I had no previous contact with before) asking why I want to withdraw from the position. 

To be clear I never said I wanted to withdraw from the position, but the manager that gave me a call said that they were pushing for her to just rescind my internship offer without even giving me a chance to speak and clear things up. She was nice enough to offer to try to smooth things over for me, but I decided that this internship and workplace was not worth my time. I ended up declining the offer (which probably didn't matter because they were planning on rescinding it anyways). 

Overall, I would say I had a horrible experience with this branch of Kaiser. The managers ghosted me for about a month, so I had little to no information about the logistics of the internship, and the hiring manger was unwilling to even try to discuss the problem with me. Rather than reaching out to me and trying to talk things through, the managers decided to just go ahead and rescind my internship offer, which I feel was very rude and unprofessional. They made me feel very unsupported, and frankly unwelcome, which is not something I would ever want in a company. 

With that being said, this was only my experience with one region of Kaiser, I'm sure it's very different in other branches. I am also very thankful for the kind manager that called me and tried to stand up for me.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Excel Sheets?

title: Graduate Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Process was really smooth and straightforward. Depending on the role, you present a project from you courses and they ask you questions based on that. I am sure process is different with every role.
Interview Questions: What is your work style?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was very short, 20 minutes max. It felt like they didn’t want to answer questions about benefits like PTO. While the company pays well, it was a turn off.
Interview Questions: What was your proudest moment as a nurse?

title: RN Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Had a great conversation with recruiter. She has lots of great information on the role and company. We had a great rapport and she mentioned how well of a fit I was with the organization’s mission and values. Then I was ghosted a day before an on site meet of the team.  
I found out three months later after digging as to what happened. Apparently they hired a person who had originally declined the role.
Interview Questions:
Behavioral questions. Standard for the role. 
No issues.

title: Financial Analyst Internship Interview

title: Internship Interview

Interview Descriptions: Questions regarding basic web site development and design including topics such as HTML, CSS, Jave Script. Also asked about experience managing data bases using SQL but was not required for the internship.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience designing websites?

title: Volunteer Interview

Interview Descriptions: Group interview with three interviewers and 15 applicants. The interviewers will ask questions, and each applicant has to follow the order to answer the question. The interview process will take around 30 minutes.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview and quick. Took 2 months from application to interview, took a test. Once passed it was sent back to recruiter and manager called shortly after for an interview .
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work at kaiser

title: Health Education Coordinator Interview

They look pretty far into your work history, including dates of employment and specific job titles. Takes about a month. Also, I am sure it depends on the department in terms of how the initial interview goes.

title: Assistant Medical Group Administrator Interview

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process consisted of multiple steps:
1. First you need to pass a phone screening where you get asked statistical questions
2. In the next round you are given a data set and you have to analyze it and do QC
3. Discussion of the project and additional questions.
4. Panel interview with people from different departments.
Interview Questions:
Are high leverage values necessarily outliers?
What is the difference between the sample mean and a sampling distribution?
How do you deal with missing values?

title: User Experience Design Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application, had one interview (with department head and lead designer) where I presented my work through a prepared slide deck (asked for ahead of time) and was asked questions about my design process. The process of setting up interview was quite rushed (two days after submitting app I scheduled my interview, which was scheduled for two days from then. Got an offer 30 minutes after my interview)
Interview Questions: What is your design process? What's an example of a time it worked?

title: Internship Interview

title: BI Analyst IV Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser takes a very long time to screen applicants but once I was able to get my resume seen by the recruiter for this job it went pretty fast.  By the time I became a candidate others were already in final interviews so the hiring manager interview, panel interview and case study interviews were all scheduled back to back.  Everyone was pleasant through the process.  Three days after my final interview I received an offer.  Unfortunately I did not accept the offer after a few days of salary negotiations.  It was a very tough choice to decline, and I would have been more than happy working at Kaiser if they could have met me in the middle with a competing offer I had.  All in all it was a great experience and interacted with great people.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview

Interview Descriptions: Kaiser Permanente is awful. They will only hire Temps or contractors. I was one for 7 months.  Then got hired after nailing their interview.  Which I must say was stressful because everyone wanted a job and few got hired.  They string you along,  but act like you haven't worked there for the LAST 7 MONTHS. DON'T DO IT. WALK AWAY.
Interview Questions: Look at other reviews.. standard.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I got a Zoom interview through a temp agency for Kaiser.  After speaking to the temp agency, they forwarded my resume over to Kaiser. I then had a phone interview with Kaiser. I was asked to meet them in person. Later, I was asked to meet the rest of the team.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Volunteer Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was nicer than you might expect. The people are all very friendly with no hostility, and the questions aren’t too difficult either and are quite simple. Overall, nothing to be worried about!

title: Communications Specialist Interview

Interview Descriptions: Standard initial 30 min phone screen with the hiring manager followed by a Zoom panel interview with team members.  The initial screen also required submission of a few writing samples to prove competence.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a request with a short deadline.

title: Administrative Specialist IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Rafael, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: My overall experience interviewing for this role was neutral. I found it somewhat unusual that the KP employee that initially contacted me to set up the interview did not identity her role within the organization when she called to set up the interview. As part of that process, she also performed a pre-interview "test" to ensure functioning of MS Teams. I had assumed she was a recruiter or in HR. I later learned through my own probing that she was actually a member of the hiring team. I was not provided any information about who the interviewers would be. I had to request that information, and learned that it was a panel-style interview with five manager/director level staff. (It only ended up being three.) I'm sure glad I inquired. I imagine someone that didn't press for information could have been a bit overwhelmed logging into that kind of interview without any heads-up. The team of interviewers were very nice, and they followed up in the manner promised in the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: I would say this interview was somewhat difficult vs difficult. If I had not have probed about the specifics of the meeting in advance, it would have been more challenging. The interviewers took turns asking questions from a script of probably 10 or so questions. Each question had multiple questions within a question.  Mostly questions that required a STAR format reply. An example would be Tell me about a time you made a mistake. How did you fix it? I can't say there were any major curveballs. Being prepared to give specific examples of successes, accomplishment, how you stay organized.

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Overall interview questions were pretty straightforward. About 30 minute interview. Applied for database administrator. Questions all relating to specific skills, and additionally performance. Consist of a total of 2 interviews
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.

title: Service Unit Manager II Interview

Second interview online again and with three other people. Nice and lengthy. Reminder to those online - we can see you and your expressions. Most times can tel which way you are going by your frowns and rolling of the eyes.

HR - Question about work history
Interview with Manager
Few hours after interview, scheduled panel interview for 2 days later.

title: Bio Statistician I/II-Epidemiologic Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
One you submit your application and talent profile, it gets reviewed, and a coordinator arranges a phone interview based on your availability. As in many places, the phone interview is the first in a series of interviews. The phone interview came across as very poor. The interviewer was difficult to understand over the phone due to a thick accent, and the interviewer made no effort to make their department the least bit attractive to a potential candidates. Even when a reference was made to a publication that the interviewer co-authored, the interviewer showed no interest whatsoever and chose not to comment. To be perfectly honest, it sounded like the department likely already had candidates in mind and was just going through the interview process to look fair. The interview was incredibly dry. After asking questions about statistical analyses, the interviewer then admitted that a "junior biostatistician" (this is how the interviewer referred to the position) would spend most of their time extracting and cleaning data and doing very little analysis. Then why is this title called biostatistician? Additionally, this position was titled "Biostatistician I/II-Epidemiologic Research". Although such positions usually overlap, such departments should understand that those with epidemiologic training will have a different perspective than those who are trained in biostatistics. The interviewer appeared to have a biostatistics bias. Also, not everyone is going to come from a place with a sophisticated setup where SAS directly connects to SQL server, so it should not be a big deal if you haven't done that before. At some places, you have to write the SQL yourself in separate system, manually save the extracted data into excel files, and write a macro in SAS to mass import them.

Some time after the initial interview, I received a message asking me to schedule a 2-hour long "biostats assessment". Once again, the first interviewer, who was a biostatistician, informed me that this "junior" position was not going to involve much analysis and was going to be mainly data extraction, cleanup,  and manipulation. If that was the case, why was there any need for a two-hour long biostatistics assessment?
Interview Questions:
1. Define incidence and prevalence.
2. What kind of data manipulation experience do you have with SAS? (this wasn't exactly a question, but the interviewer read off what I had written in my CV and asked me to confirm.)
3. In SAS, if you have a dataset with a unique identifier, how would you identify and remove duplicates.

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Pharmacy Revenue Downey Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Contacted directly by hiring mgr at 10pm on Sunday night via email asking to conduct phone interview. Spent about 20 minutes on the phone interview and concluded by asking me to provide work samples and a copy of my performance review. I sent an excel and access file with dummy data showcasing some of my analysis and formulary skills along with an abbreviated summary of my last performance review as that is confidential information and none of Kaiser’s business in terms of applying for a job. I was then invited to do a video interview the following week with the hiring mgr via Microsoft Teams. Due to technical difficulties with the video conferencing software, I was not able to get video working despite verifying that my webcam was on and functioning at the time. I later come to find out that Microsoft Teams is known for glitching and does not allow one to test camera view prior to start of a meeting. Despite that, I ended up speaking to the same hiring mgr again for an hr and getting asked the same questions again, interrogating me on why I want to leave my current role and if I was trying to run away from something at my current job, and him insisting again for a copy of my performance review. I was then asked to complete a 1-hr timed excel test the next day which I completed in 40 minutes. Next I was invited to speak to a team member over the phone the following week. This lady seemed uninterested and unmotivated for the entire call and loved to highlight areas I don’t have as opposed to focusing on knowledge/skills I do have that can be beneficial to their team which appears to be lacking in the data analysis area. I then received an email from the hiring mgr saying they will review candidates for next steps and contact me later. I received a generic rejected email a few days later and no feedback upon request. Unprofessional, arrogant elitists run this team. Avoid at all costs if you value your time.
Interview Questions: Can you provide a copy of your last performance review?

title: Senior Business Process Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Jun 2020

The hiring manager reached out to me directly from pulling my resume and information through their talent portal, as I had applied to several similar positions at Kaiser. 
She asked to set up time for an informational interview that same day, and we chatted on the phone for an hour. The conversation went very well, and she asked me to answer some questions and send back responses by the following week, and that she'd like to set up time for second round interview to walk through my responses. 
The questions were behavioral, and I spent several hours working on these responses. When I submitted them to her, no word. I followed up twice over the following week and still did not hear back. Very disappointed for such a poor interview process. The least you could do is circle back to let me know that the role is filled, not available anymore, or provide some sort of explanation. Please don't leave people in the dark - very unprofessional and has left a bad taste in my mouth.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you implemented a new process or improved a process.

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Excellent. Interviewer asked job-relevant questions, there wasn't a lot of lag time to get updates about my status post-interview. I think I could have benefited more knowing a bit more about the department I would be supporting earlier in the process.
Interview Questions: * Why Kaiser? Why this role? * I was asked to talk about my past experience managing projects. * How I managed a difficult colleague, team member, partner

title: Senior Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of speaking with the hiring manager, followed by a panel interview by the whole team. The tone was friendly, welcoming and was not difficult.  I was already an internal candidate.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience as it relates to this role.

title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very seamless. Felt respected and heard. Interviewer seemed attuned to what I needed. They answered my questions thoroughly. Interview started on time. Office was professional and comfortable. I would definitely recommend the clinic. Interview offered good experience.
Interview Questions: Please explain your experience working with diverse communities.

title: Health Education Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had an in person interview with two managers. Was asked behavioral questions and asked about previous experience working in a health care environment. Went well overall, easy questions. I also had to complete an online test about my computer skills.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult patient.

title: Principal Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interview. 1 technical interview. The first round was technical which lasted for an hour. There were two programming questions one was to debug a given java program and other was to write an algorithm to rotate a string.
Interview Questions:
Rotate a string of characters e.g.  input param1 "interview" , param2 2
output ewintervi

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Overall very quick process, with only 2 phone interviews. Interviewers asked both general questions and questions related to the position and background experience. Both were very relaxed and casual, and the interviewers were friendly and informative. Good experience all the way through.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen with recruiter, followed by phone interview with a local head, followed by series of panel zoom interviews with all physician and nursing staff at the practice (zoom interviews were conducted because of COVID 19).
Interview Questions: What makes you stand out compared to other candidates

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I started the job application process in February and after many interviews, e-mails, and phone calls, the process ended 3 months later with a non-offer.  Weeks would go by with no contact from the Kaiser recruiter
Interview Questions: In your entire career, what have you NOT liked about executive level leaders?

title: Nutrition Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in March. My interview was a month later in April. Due to the pandemic, the interview was held online with two supervisors in the department. I was offered the position in June and given a tentative start date in July. It has been a long process but it has been worth it. Drug screen required, extensive background check, and a physical with Employee Health.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time you dealt with a challenging situation/person and how you handled it.

title: Consulting Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Goleta, CA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very positive. Interviewer conducted the interview in a professional and open manner, asking questions that truly gauge technical and behavioral abilities to gain a comprehensive understanding of myself as a candidate.
Interview Questions:
Describe a project where you extracted large amounts of data and implemented an algorithm to gather insight?

What formal experience in your past do you feel provided you enhanced technical abilities to help you in this role?

title: HR Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about five months, however, there was no activity for about a month because of COVID. Applied online then was asked to complete a questionnaire on a Word document then send back to the recruiter. I then went through three rounds of interviews with a mix of panel and one on ones, speaking with eight people in total. The first round was almost all behavioral questions. It seemed to get repetitive after a while. There was also a writing sample requirement prior to the final round.
Interview Questions: Describe your process when handling an employee relations issue.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Ok but just be yourself.  You have nothing to lose so answer to the best of you abilities.  The worst that can happen is you don't get the job, the best is that you do get the job
Interview Questions: How to handle conflict

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I've applied for various positions for this company for almost a year. I've been granted interviews either through video-chat, in-person group, or a phone interview. And I'm amazed that Kaiser is actually using me as a NUMBER instead of looking into my potential and my skills. Why? Because it takes about 5 minutes after each interview, for Kaiser to nix me as a candidate immediately and update my application into No Longer Under Consideration. If Kaiser is using me for a count to nix out candidates, then they are not interested in me joining their organization at all. It's RUDE to ask someone to interview if they are not a viable candidate at all. It's a waste of my time. If they have no use of my services after reviewing my resume and application just close the candidate. DON'T WASTE TIME WITH INTERVIEWS.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Health Policy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very casual interview, felt more like a conversation and just trying to understand your background and why you're interested in the job. They also asked what you knew about the job and if you could add anything to their research, what would it be?
Interview Questions: What motivates you to do your best work?

title: Sales & Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I met with the recruiter during round one and advanced onwards to meet with two more product managers. All of them created a welcoming space where I was free to share my life story as well as the connections between my industry and on-campus leadership experiences.
Interview Questions:
Why Kaiser Permanente?
What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Software Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process, with several rounds of interviews with many people in various roles on the project team. Topics spanned from technical / software questions, project management, and software development methodologies and processes.
Interview Questions: Epic software, medical records software, and software processes

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I received an interview couple weeks after I applied. It was a behavioral and situational interview.  They called me back the day after the interview and offered me the job.
Interview Questions: What does our mission statement mean to you in your own words?

title: Back End Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone screenings.  The first was with the Director of the team I was applying to join and the second was with two lead developers on the team.  The Director discussed the position and went over some basic behavioral questions.  The second phone screen included more technical questions and an overview of my resume.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work within Health Tech?

title: Project Coordination Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with three members of the team. They described their roles and expectations for the team. They asked me about my pastes experiences and how what I learned could best be implemented in the new role. Very kind and understanding. Great interview questions. Very professional!
Interview Questions:
What is an example of conflict resolution that you have exhibited in a past role?
Give an example of when you solved an issue concerning team communication?
What would you do when their is a dispute between team members?

title: Consulting Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute phone interview with behavioral questions, then 2 hour case interview where the 1st hour you work alone on the case and then the second hour they ask you questions about it and other behavioral/technical questions.
Interview Questions: SQL joins and other table manipulations

title: Business Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Hayward, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Two people interviewed me some basic question. it's very east questions and they are very nice. I feel good talk with them. After interview, they said they will interview others and give me the feedback.
Interview Questions: what is you strength in your life?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: One on one she was really nice. Called me within 3 days for offer. After that I started within a matter of 1 months later. It’s a class training about 6 weeks long to learn the job kinda hard but doable
Interview Questions:
Why this position 
How to handle rude customer 
The usual interview questions

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online on Kaiser website: 11/27/19
Requested to complete test assessment: 1/7/20
Phone interview: 1/13
In-person interview: 1/17
Job offer: 1/21
Drug test: 1/24
Background check: 1/27
Onboarding (new hire paperwork) 2/18
Official start date: 3/2
(Background check was marked as urgent so it was cleared very quickly)
Interview Questions: What is your favorite thing about your current job?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, easy flow, did not follow a script. The person was a great interviewer and the way she asked the questions definitely put me at ease. Made me want to work for the company right away.
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: talent recruiter seemed unorganized and unenthused about their work. by time she had scheduled our phone screen, the position had already been filled. another position was identified that I was qualified for however i was "three" months away from meeting the 5 year post clinical work marker, so i was told to try again in 3 months.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Application Online and then received an email to schedule a group Interview .
Once accepted, background Checkup,  Health Clearance will be conducted.
The interviewer was very nice and kind. It was a friendly group interview.
Interview Questions:
1) Introduction and why applied.
2) Two positive things and one thing you need to work on.
3) What kind of animal would like to be when you wake up next morning
4) If you can commit this volunteering job at least 1year.
5) If you have any family who works for Kaiser. If yes, which location.

title: Clinical Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was direct and specific which is what I think an interview should be.  What it was not is friendly, welcoming or engaging.  The warmth that I would desire as a client was not displayed by these staff and despite attempting a bit of light humor, not even a smile.
Interview Questions: What are your biggest strengths, weaknesses?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: After I was informed I had an interview, I received an email stating they had re-reviewed my resume and decided I did not qualify for the position. Was not contacted further.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Java Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was done by hiring manager via phone. It was more on my experience.  Questions were asked on the project that I have worked on.  Then 2nd round of interview was whiteboard and more technical.
Interview Questions: what is a JVM? JRE?

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward interview process. It followed the  standard strategy interview process, meaning it included  behavioral interviews where they asked about scenarios and skills. It was followed by a case interview with a specific problem the team may encounter.  The case interview included support from the interviewer which was really help and lessened the pressure.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to communicate something really complex.

title: Emergency Medicine Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great people, not intense interview. Took you out to nice lunch so could meet large part of group. Then tour of er. They pay for travel expenses too. I interviewed with other candidates
Interview Questions: What is one situation that was difficult

title: Senior Leadership Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
When I was having the interview the recruiter told me, this position is no longer available.  I didn't understand why we were having the conversation and she told me that I need to get into the web page to view if another position is interested to me. Like it was a menu to chose. 

She was really unprofessional, she wasn't interested in providing me information about anything.  The hiring process is the reflexion of the culture of the company, so I was glad that I close the conversation as soon as I could.

The worst interview experience that I ever had.
Interview Questions: There wasn't any question about my experience.

title: EPMO Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Renton, WA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen interview with standard questions. I heard back from KP within 24 hrs that I had progressed to the next stage of interviews. The next interview was a 1-hr interview with 6 panelists. Each person had several questions and it was fairly straight forward. There wasn't much time to ask questions. The third interview is a case study and I'm trying to prep for that. It seems like quite a black box and not sure what to expect.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you had to deal with a difficult member of your team and how you handled it. What was the result?

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
