Long long interview
Lots of behavioral questions 
Not much detail was explained about the role
Transparency about the responsibilities and specially the team smbers and team structure was missing.
Overall I saw conflict between members of the panel during the interview.
Which was not the what I expected
Interview Questions:
Conflict handling
Getting refused handling
Technology 
Resiliency

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: ~ 3-hour interview process. Meet with 2 of their current postdocs to learn about their experiences. Then 2 separate meetings with 4 senior researchers (2 at each meeting). The first set were researchers who were directors of the program that I wouldn't necessarily work directly with. The next two were those whose research interests were similar to mine who I might work with.
Interview Questions: Previous research, research interests, career goals, why Kaiser, and then what questions I had for them.

title: Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It was a three part interview process.  First, a phone screen interview with the talent acquitions manager. During the phone screen she mentioned the salary and commission structure.  Scheduled an in-person interview.  She did not mention it would be panel/group style over the phone.  There were 3 people presents for the first in-person interview.  The second group interview had 6 people present.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite movie and why?

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
1st step: 1 hour Phone screen by Recruiter
2nd step: 1st round Case Interview on skype with Manager level staff. Very simple case for anyone with any experience of case interviews.

3rd step: Recruiter called to schedule final rounds in-person interviews. However after a few days, they ended up not scheduling the in-person interviews as the flights prices from my town to the Bay area seemed “expensive” to them. 

After a few days, I got scheduled for another skype interview with one Senior Director for behavioral interviews with the hope that they would call me for a final round of in-person interviews on a later date if they don’t get a suitable candidate among the pool of candidates for whom the flight tickets were cheaper!
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Systems Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview which lasted about 20 minutes and was just basic questions about my experience.  The next step was an in person panel interview which lasted about 45 minutes and included mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What do you do when a client is unhappy?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: They asked typical interview questions. I was able to fill out a form about which areas of the hospital I was interested in working in which was very nice.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Healthcare

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, emailed a candidate snapshot questionnaire to answer and email back to. If chosen, they email you the time and date of your interview. Panel interview with three people. Roughly 10-15 minutes long.
Interview Questions: Tell Us About Yourself, Why do you want to work at Kaiser?/What do you bring to the table?

title: Applications Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Torrance, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
It took about a month after I applied to hear back.

I had a phone interview several days later, followed by a 2-person interview at Kaiser with the hiring manager and project manager. A week and a half later, this was followed by a panel interview of the hiring manager and team (total of 6 people); the interview consisted of Q&A by the panel, a 10-minute presentation on PowerPoint (any topic you want), and a chance to ask the panel any questions.

This was followed by a reference check the next day and they contacted all of them just several days later.  I followed up a week after to check-in and I was told from the hiring manager I would hear back from recruiting about final decisions.  My understanding was there was 4 final applicants for 2 open positions.

The day after they checked my references, I saw that on my KPcareers application that ‘I was no longer in consideration for this position’ 

I’m certain I had great reviews from previous colleagues.

Despite seeing that I did email the hiring manager once more to ensure that this was the ultimate decision; finding out through a status update on their site :/ and have yet to hear back.

I’m assuming I didn’t get selected for the position which is unfortunate.  What really is upsetting is the status update on the KPcareers page is how I’m finding out that I am being rejected after all this time and effort. 

You figured their system could at least send out an automated email to candidates who’ve gone through to the end of the process.  I mean, your careers page notifies me immediately of any openings that I have on my filter.

This is still somewhat an open door, apparently Kaiser is notoriously late with getting back but I’m not getting my hopes up.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions were asked

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I received a phone call from the KP recruiter within an hour after applying, which obviously showed great interest on KP's part but unfortunately it seems their main concern is not someone's experience or past KP experience but whether or not you pass some ridiculous, outdated, technically flawed assessment. 
All went well until I had to take the online assessment, which was completely flawed with technical glitches.  As a former KP employee of over 10 years, one would think that KP would value their past employees, especially those who were laid off due to budget reasons, but it seems a flawed assessment holds more weight than someone's actual KP experience. Very disappointing.
Interview Questions: Personality, reasoning, and situational questions from the online assessment.

title: Scheduling Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Duluth, GA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process wasn't hard. Actually very easy and direct. Not a bad interview in opinion.  But you might want to brush up on key phrases on the scheduling analyst position.
Interview Questions: can't remember the interview questions

title: Financial Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The manager and supervisor understanding and treated me like I was there employee while in the interview. They had insight and had a clear picture of what type of person they wanted to hire.
Interview Questions: Do you know anything about coordination of benefits?

title: Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Washington, DC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Not good.  More of an interrogation.  I wish I had reported the incident to a member of Kaiser's Human Resources group.
It was not reported.  I'm not sure what else to add here other than that.
Interview Questions: How would you peers evaluate you work performance?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Harbor City, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line... phone interview. Emailed me interview date it  was within one week of application. Panel interview, two managers two nurses .. took turns asking questions . Interviewed with 4 other applicants ask us to sit out side called back in 3 of us offered us a position
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick and simple. They asked about technical skills and how you would handle situations that occur in the workplace. They also asked about availability and talked about what the position entails.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a colleague that doesn't do their part in a group project?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
1. take the Kaiser assessment test
2. Assigned a day to participate in a group interview that is about 2 hours long
3.Participate in a phone prep interview that is about 40 minutes long
4. After the group interview expect to hear from them within 72 hours
Interview Questions: Describe a policy that you did not agree with at the workplace

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a thorough phone screen, followed by a review of my submitted references, and then an in person interview, where I met with the administrative and clinical teams, as well as members of the staff at the facility where I would work
Interview Questions: Tell us about your interest in this position

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview with the hiring manager. The second round was a full day of one on one or small group and panel interviews.  I interviewed with managers, directors and staff in the various departments I'd be working with.
Interview Questions: What made me qualified for the role, how I would approach the position.

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: In person 1:1 interview, then phone and video interviews with a large panel of current team members followed up by onsite, group, design-centered interview process in Oakland California with a dozen other people. It was fun and tough and challenging.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work history

title: Manager III/Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview following a screening phone call with recruiter. Panel included hiring director, several Chiefs and physicians.  Tone of the interview was friendly and open.  Interview took place in director's office and the questions asked for examples of my own work experience.
Interview Questions: Questions about using data/metrics, managing conflict, and proudest accomplishments.

title: Md Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Itinerary was sent in advance. Full day interview with multiple people, some telephonic, some panel and some one on one. Overall interview process was not tough but very lengthy. Offered good opportunity to get to know them with tour of facility, physicians working there seemed happy. That was a good sign. Everyone seemed friendly and that was one of the main reasons I considered this option.
Interview Questions: What kind of practice you envision for yourself ?

title: Technical Rotation Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Online application, HR survey asks why Kaiser and why the rotational program. Then interview with program manager who asks similar question. Technical interview over web call with questions on OOP, Sql, and bash commands.

No courtesy call if you dont get the job.
Interview Questions: Given table, what is sql statement

title: Human Resources Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter emailed me to set up a phone call. She emailed 30 minutes prior to my phone call - saying she had a meeting. And rescheduled the phone screening call.
Interview Questions: Do you have union experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: phone/email screening and then in person. This was the worst interview i ever had. Recruiter was pushy and people working there (who interviewed me) were rude. Vibe at the place was just big no no. It was overall bad experience. I declined the offer.
Interview Questions: work style

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: It took a long time to go through the application process. It was hard to catch the volunteer coordinator over the phone. Every time I called it would ring and send me to the voice mail.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to volunteer here?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Duluth, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Supposed to be a group interview, but 2 managers showed up. They were very nice. They only hire techs with experience, so they ask a bunch of questions about former pharmacy, your values, and basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest accomplishment in your life?

title: Nutritionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Silver Spring, MD) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel of two nutritionists, medical director and two nurses. Interview was scheduled for 4:30pm on a Friday. Afternoon interviews are best and interviewers want to go home.  My interview was 20 minutes and was pleasant. I felt very comfortable and tried my best to smile while answering questions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses? How do you deal with difficult people? Tell us about yourself

title: Managerial Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds including a case interview. Not challenging if you have consulting experience or if you have solid business training.  What you cover is probably not very relevant to the work you will actually be doing, more to see if you can structure problem solving.
Interview Questions: What is something you’re proud of?

title: Actuarial Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Aurora, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through online career site for Colorado office and received an email to schedule a phone interview with an actuarial assistant. Moved on to final second round Skype interview with two more actuaries (an associate and a lead actuary) a week later.  The interviewers were very nice and enthusiastic about their work. They told me they will reach out soon but I never got a response. Checked the application status 2 months later and saw thus I was no longer considered. I had my hopes up since I really felt welcomed during the interview but getting ghosted without an update for the first time after reaching final round was very disappointing.
Interview Questions: Why Actuarial Science? Why Kaiser? Mostly Behavioral questions and asked about Excel/VBA skills

title: Senior Supply Chain Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening, followed by call with hiring manager and two in person interviews. It was a very intensive process and thorough. They presented the company well and made very sure that the potential employee was a good fit. Great communication as far as timelines. Final round was with a panel of 6 people.  Definitely a positive experience although no job offer came from it.
Interview Questions: A mix of behavioral and technical questions.

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a panel of 8 people that included pharmacists and technicians.  It was clear that the position would likely be offered to a current kaiser employee. The interview was very typical for a pharmacist. It included a few clinical questions, but they mainly seemed focused on how you would fit in with the team there.
Interview Questions: Questions related to how I would fit in with the work environment

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: They were quick in scheduling the interview but afterwards they won't even update you on their decision. They just leave you hanging. The interview setup is with 3 people who are department heads.
Interview Questions: Common nursing interview questions

title: Management Position Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: About average time from phone interview to offer.  Started with a phone screen and then phone interview, brought in to talk to different people on the team.  Overall experience was fine at times I felt too many people were  involved in the entire process. Was getting duplicate questions from different interviewers.  In the end went with another company but overall experience was fine.
Interview Questions: Mainly about situational and  behavioral questions. Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted about an hour and was a group interview of about 20 people.  With COVID, I doubt that's the process. They ask situational-based questions in the interview. At a point, they had us pair up with someone and learn about them and then reiterate the information we had just learned about the person aloud.
Interview Questions: They asked questions related to customer service.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was through a temp agency that basically prepped you for the official interview. Official interview was a group. About 30 people split in 4 groups and asked 2 of the 5 questions the temp agency told us to focus on. Found out a week later if hired. Extensive background check, has to verify EVERYTHING.
Interview Questions:
Name a time you went above to satisfy customer?
Name a rule you disagreed with.

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview then in house panel interview.  Questions consist of basic, tell me about yourself, what is your strength and weakness.  What is your long term and short term goal?
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Fill out form type of interview, where they ask about your past experiences and community service experience and a 1 hour group  with 4 other people behavioral interview with a manager. Asked basic questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when...?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 20 Minute phone call scheduled by the recruiter. She forgot about the first interview and seemed uninterested during the call when it eventually happened. She clearly hadn't prepared questions for the interview.
Interview Questions: What did you do at your past internship?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, organized and easy to speak with. They know what they were looking for and highly talented within their field.  I had two interviews total - manager and VP.  Very talented and humble group of people.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of last time you used analytics.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Got this interview from an agency. Went into the tall building at Oakland Kaiser Permanete. The interview was roughy 20 min. Didn't get an offer at last, but it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: How do you usually provide instructions to someone who are new to using a online program

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The first round of interviews was in a group setting where we first introduce our partner and explain why they should be hired. Then we each answer a question in front of everyone including the panel which are all behavioral based questions. After doing these two things, they decide who move forward for the 1:1 interview with the panel which is held within the same dat.
Interview Questions: What are essential skills to have as a nurse?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: It is a group interview and they will ask each person a different question passed out on notecards. You will stand and answer the question. They will ask part of the candidates to join them outside and then they thank them for interviewing and release them. The remaining candidates in the room will move onto the 2nd part of the interview which is a 1 on 1 interview with a supervisor. They will go over some routine questions and then let you know you will be hearing back from them soon to let you know if you got the job.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were basic, such as describe a disagreement you had with a colleague and how you handled it

title: Junior Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Culver City, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was very friendly, he and 2 others joined the call on a conference line to ask some C# and JS and react questions. Some C# questions were a bit tricky.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between abstract and interface classes?

title: New Grad Inexperienced RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: This is for KP Irvine. Submitted app online, selected for supplemental “career snapshot” which consisted of 3 essay questions, then group interview with 25 people. Introduce person next to you and randomly select one question to answer. Not sure if this is normal but 25 ppl just seemed too much for one group. Spent way too much time listening to others and not much opportunity to talk. 60 total people were interviewed for 4 spots.
Interview Questions: Introduce person next to you, background, greatest work accomplishment, 2 reasons why kaiser should hire them

title: Inexperienced RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Group Interview of 15 people, paired up to introduce each other and answered "Why should Kaiser hire them?", jeopardy style interview questions where one person answers at a time. After group interview, selected applicants will move forward to solo interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time a patient/patient's family was dissatisfied with you care. What did you do and what was the result?

title: Marketing Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and speedy. The initial round was a basic phone interview that described the job itself and low level personality questions. The second round was  a market strategy case study with several team members that consisted of a few high level questions. The third round was a panel interview with 6 people. The interview process at KP is speedy and they offer feedback for candidates along the way.
Interview Questions: What database tools are you familiar with?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Brief and quick moving interview with 2 hiring managers..... both asked questions read from a packet, and wrote answers that were given . Pauses of awkward silence. They described the job, what was expected, explained the environment
Interview Questions: How are you able to diffuse a hostile situation

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The worst interview I have had in all my career. They said I got the role wrong and I was mistaken. The interview was in an open room with others present who had nothing to do with the interview.
Interview Questions: The interviewer was rude and belittled me

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with someone from HR first. Then interviewed in person at the office in Portland with the department I was going to work in. Took maybe 45 minutes for the interview, interviewed with two people. Asked general questions about my past work experience and why I wanted to work there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser?

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Lafayette, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called with in three days four a brief telephone overview.   Was invited for in person interview right away.  Had a panel interview: myself and 3 others competed for 2 available jobs in front of 9 staff members that included nurses, physicians,  2 managers and an MA.  Was called the hours later with job offer.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you became frustrated with a patient and how did you handle it?

title: Cancer Center Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The process was very Professional and thorough. I liked the candid additude and honesty of the interviewer. The location is ok but parking is insufficient for employees and cost too much.
Interview Questions: Yrs if exp

title: Health Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Two of the reviewers participated in a video call, while the remaining reviewer was in person. The interview consisted of technical questions within my field (data analysis and geographic information systems), and questions regarding soft skills and time management. The interview lasted about 1 hour, with enough time for me to ask questions afterwards. It was a little challenging to participate in a video call interview, especially when the connection would lag, but it was an overall positive experience. I received real time feedback regarding the strength of my answers, and they really helped me get into my comfort zone, while still managing to press me with challenging questions.
Interview Questions: The standard interview questions included the introductory "Tell us about yourself?",  and "Talk about a mistake you made in a previous job, and how did you handle it?". They also asked me to explain how to transform raw messy data in to an end result at a high level. I did not have to perform a whiteboard session, but the duration of the interview was technical in nature.

title: Health Care Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Multiple steps to the hiring process including phone interview, essay style questionnaire, and in person interview.  In the in person interview they put you on the spot with hard questions that require multiple answers.  I didn't feel at ease with the interviewer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very informative interview process. Was given information by a recruiter and then i had a chance to ask questions from a current employee. Getting all of the letters of recommendation in and your resume is what can take some time.
Interview Questions: What am i looking for in a job?

title: IT Business Analyst Jr Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manager spoke about the position mostly. Few questions were asked. Questions surrounding ticketing, troubleshooting and handling difficult clients. This was a one round phone interview process with 2 people.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult user?

title: Phlebotomist Floater Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: When I first applied to the float pool I was contacted the same week. They said they weren’t currently hiring but would keeping me on file. Got an actual call for an interview about 2-3 months later. Interviewed the next week.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working in a very fast paced environment with many different types of people from different backgrounds?

title: Phone Advice Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online after a week or so was emailed a link to do the assessment tests. They took in total around 2 hours to complete. A few days after I finished those I received a call from a nurse manager wanting to set up an interview and tour. The interview consisted of basic behavioral questions which were not difficult, and then mock phone scenarios which were more difficult. It was intense but they were very nice and encouraging. I thought I did horribly, but they offered me the job after a few minutes talking outside the room. The manager wanted me to verbally accept the offer or not then and there, which I thought was unusual, having not discussed details like pay at all. I ended up not taking the position because the 6 week training was full time and evening shift hours, which I could not do. The actual job was part time and day time hours. I do wish that I could have made it work though!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had excellent customer service.

title: Lvn I Flu Clinic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: They called me for an interview in the Downey location. I was interviewed by 3 people asking basic tell me about yourself questions. They expect you to volunteer to gain experience if you have no experience
Interview Questions: What would you do in order to get members to receive their flu shots?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It seems like Kaiser 'sell' all the positions to 100 recruiters. I got tons of phone call for the same position.  And after the interview, they never call you to tell you the feedback.
Interview Questions: What's the difference between data analysis and data mining?

title: Customer Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: After you complete the assessment an hiring agent will reach out to you and do a phone interview. Then they’ll schedule an in person group interview. They hire in groups to fill up a class for training.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you did not agree with a company policy and what did you do

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Got sent a link through email to complete their video interview. Around 5-6 questions total. Unlimited time to prepare for each question. Allowed to redo once for each question. Mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Architecture Design ManagementUndergraduate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interview was casual. Used Skype for Business and interviewed over voice call not video. Yet the interview invite email seems it was sent to multiple people at once. The email started with Good morning everyone!
Interview Questions: When you confront a group client, and they all want different material for your project, how would you negotiate this situation?

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 group interviews and one interview with the VP. They asked a lot of questions on how I deal with difficult employees. Some technical questions. A lot of behavior type of questions.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Community Health Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The administrative assistant reached out to schedule an appointment. Then I had two in-person appointments - one with peers and one with management - each a couple of weeks apart. I then received an impersonal "position has been filled" email a couple of weeks after the second interview.
Interview Questions: How does your background fit in with the position?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: HR will screen for minimum qualifications. If you don’t have them, you will not receive a phone call back at all. This is a highly sought after company. They pick the best of the best to even interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to quickly change your work to accommodate an urgent situation, and how you handled it.

title: Internal Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a one interview process with two individuals.  The first interview was a phone screen and the second interview was in person.  Overall the process took several weeks before a decision was made.
Interview Questions: Do you enjoy working with large sets of data?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Duluth, GA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Large group interview with typical interview questions. Around 30 people per interview with eight interviewers. They go around asking questions and you have to present in front of everyone. Not a great way to get to know you or for you to get to know them or the company.
Interview Questions: Was there ever a time you disagreed with your boss and what did you do

title: Anticoagulation Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. Got a phone call from recruiter a few days later to check a few things then in about 2 weeks, got an email for a phone interview offee that happened within a week or so. 
Phone interview was mostly "tell me a time" type that lasted a half hour. I believe I had 2 or 3 people on the other line. Within a few days, I had an on site offer that was scheduled for maybe 2 weeks out. There were dates even within the week but since I had to travel 3 hrs, I picked a later date.
Onsite was pleasant.  I had a panel of 3 pharmacists and they took turns askinf questions.  Again, behavioral questions for the most part. I had 2 pt scenarios ans 1 patient case. Interview took about an hr and half. I was the last interview. Heard back later that week with a rejection.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sherman Oaks, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was done with the registry over the phone for the per diem position . The agents will work with you to make sure you have all the documentations and certifications you have on hand before you can start your shift.
Interview Questions:
Please describe your past experience as LVN.
Tell us about your most stressful day at work and how did you cope with it.
Please tell us how will you give injection to those patient who are scare of needle

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied online- I was then emailed with an interview offer. Set an interview date for the following week. The interview was typical in asking behavioral questions as they relate to nursing. Nothing hard or technical.
Interview Questions: Questions like: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with an angry patient.. typical interview Qs.

title: Staffing Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Online recruitment process including online assessments.  Initial interview with the KP recruiter was very pleasant and relaxed.  Second interview with Staffing Manager went very well.   KP recruiter made official offer and scheduled/coordinated on-boarding process. Very organized on-boarding process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were faced with a staffing shortage and how did you handle the situation.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview lasted about 20 min, discussed my qualifications and description of the job. How the company works if I were to be further selected. Very kind and easy going interviewer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experience

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA)
Interview Descriptions: There was a video interview and two phone interviews. The video interview was basic questions about why you want to work at Kaiser and what makes you qualified. Phone interviews are a bit more technical.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you overcame a difficulty.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview, more or less consist of 24 applicants. alphabetical order and the one sitting next to you is your partner. you need to present your partners name, work and why is she a good candidate to be employed at Kaiser. Final question you will pick a number at the board and you will answer the question. Will wait for the call or email if you were hired or not after 2 weeks of interview.
Interview Questions: what does providing exceptional customer service mean to you?

title: HR Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took over three months and I hear that it a regular practice exclusive to KP. As a long time HR professional, I know that great candidates often find other employers who can make decisions at a much faster pace and with far better results.  I had at least five interviews with everyone except the janitor and receptionist. It wasn't just the number of interviews it was weeks long time period in between each one that I found totally unprofessional and unreasonable. I would also send "thank you" emails after each interview and receive absolutely no response. In addition, I would receive requests via email or phone late in the evening to show up at an interview early the next morning. If you are working, this may create a huge problem for the candidate and shows that KP hiring managers have NO consideration for your time or find very little value in your time - either way, it doesn't leave a great impression.  Also, during one of my interviews, I asked f there were any pending strikes, and I was assured that the relationships with various unions were "great". Not true - the very next day, I received Google alerts that KP unionized employees were in the process of voting for a strike. OK, I felt lied to. Also, the job posted was for an HR Consultant (Employee Relations), however, during the interview process the job suddenly changed to a Labor Relations position. Lastly, they tried to low ball me on the initial Offer in spite of my experience and higher education. Also, they gave me seven days to produce an official transcript and  anyone with common sense or with a degree knows that it takes a bit longer. Based upon that ONE factor, KP rescinded the Offer and refused an unofficial transcript for a job that only REQUIRED a HS diploma. Note that KP rescinded after I gave my current employer a two week notice and after I passed the background, reference check and drug test.  I've been a KP member for over thirty years and so has many of my family members. Based upon this traumatic experience, I would never recommend KP as an employer or HMO provider. I will never apply for another KP role - ever.
Interview Questions: Tell us how your background makes you a great fit for this role.

title: Data Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was interesting, I was asked to give my experience with analytics and I could use PowerPoint. I love MS PowerPoint. Interview was great, they loved my presentation skills and my effort to research above my background(non-healthcare).  Second round was focused on behavioral questions. Each interview was about 1 hour each.
Interview Questions:
What kind of data did you have in your projects?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
What interesting you have to bring?
What is your criteria in selecting company?
How is your presentation skills, who were your audience and how do you differ based on the audience?
Any project or success that you are proud of?

title: LVN II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went well.  I applied got contacted by a recruiter and within a month I interviewed for the position.   Once receiving the offer I began orientation very soon after.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: There were a total of 4 interviews, lasting over a time period of 3 months.  The interview process ranged from people in HR, Hiring Manager, member of the team I would be working with if I was hired, managers from the whole department, and a person from the management team.
Interview Questions: How would you handle someone calling on the phone asking for something, with other deadlines?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Ontario, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Group interview  with more than twenty people.  There were a panel of interviewers too. Each one were asked the same questions.  You sort of have to out do each other with looking like you are. Then later on, you pick a question from a basket then you it. Almost like a miss universe question and answer portion. Then the process if elimination happens,  then you have a one to one interview with the panel.
Interview Questions: How do you manage stress?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had two people interview me both on the phone and in person. The manager was very nice and really enthusiastic about having a person of color on the team. The department needed some diversity so I was nice speaking in deep and how the director wanted to e more inclusive
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you?

title: Regional Business Operations Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview. She emailed me  looking for a time for a interview. It was very prompt. Scheduled it within the week. She called me versus me calling them, which made things slightly easier. She was very nice. Very basic questions. STAR questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had difficulty with a teammate or coworker, what happen and how did you resolve it?

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Duluth, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was not too complex but it is still hard to get a position with Kaiser Permanente. The atmosphere was relaxing and they made it to where it felt like it was no reason to be nervous.
Interview Questions: Describe what Excellent customer service mean?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is an automated video submission process. You are given a set amount of time for the video itself and a limited number of tries per question, but you can think about your answer in advance and write it down or memorize it.
Interview Questions: They ask about your past experiences and why you are interested in Kaiser and more specifically, the intern position you apply for.

title: IT Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Hireview screening and Phone Interview. The screening had about 5 primary questions and the the phone interview is about 2 hours long depending on the team. My team had 4 people, each interview taking approximately 30 minutes each in the respective role of the professional and the work they would be doing with you.
Interview Questions: Q. What are the primary sets of tools used in excel for data management?

title: Office Managet Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Panel interview with whole 
dept, lots of questions about experience and scenarios. uncomfortable setting, too many people on interview panel. Most staff dresses too casual. There's nothing more I can say.
Interview Questions: How do you resolve conflict

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Arlington, VA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
In total four rounds, first is a phone interview asked you about your experience and some technical questions. Second is an assignment, after that you need to present the result using WebEx. 
Finally an on-site interview with several directors and managers.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between sql view and table

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Very technical, all about technical questions. And it was not happy with the interviewer. 
It is the first interview. It hired a data scientist of machine learning. But it seems that they need a data engineer, not a scientist

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Got a call the day before the interview telling me to come in the next day regardless of my schedule or else they would consider me no longer interested, so I took off school to go. The minute I walk in the interviewer tells me he already selected the candidates based off resume and that they liked mine and had no questions to ask me. The interview lasted less than 5 minutes. They told me I would hear back the following week. Did not hear back when they said I would so I called to follow up. Got no callback but they changed my status on the website about a day later to did not hire. Complete disrespect for my time - I felt like I was not even given a chance.
Interview Questions: No questions asked at all

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very repetitive because each interviewer asks almost exactly the same questions, word-for-word. It seems like they either do not care to ask good questions or they have very poor interview training.
Interview Questions: Describe a time something was not going the way you wanted it to go and what you did to fix the situation.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Regular, normal one on one. There is a parking lot for visitors there and you must check that you are in the correct place. Make sure to arrive 15 minutes earlier because I was almost late.
Interview Questions: How I rated my MS skills.

title: Laboratory Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied in January and it took 2 months for them to call me for a phone screening. (I had forgot I applied),  A month later I was called for an in person interview which was scheduled for the following week. Went to the interview and was a little bit nervous but I spent time preparing myself so it wasn’t that bad. I was interviewed by two people and they were really nice and made me feel comfortable even though I was a lil  nervous. They asked about 4 or 5 questions and they weren’t hard at at all. At the end of the interview I was told that they still had some interviews to do and that I should hear back in about two weeks. And In exactly two weeks I was called with an offer and I accepted, it was a very long process but I could say it was worth the wait.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself 
Order of draw 
How do you deal with difficult co workers 
Do you have reliable transportation

title: Volunteer Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in a group setting and the questions asked were simple like why you want to volunteer and an experience that shaped you. In all honesty, I am pretty sure everyone who shows up for the interviews gets in as a volunteer.
Interview Questions: Why do you volunteer for this hospital?

title: Summer Internship Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds, first round was a phone call (30 minutes) with basic behavioral questions. Medium difficulty. After this there was an interview with the specific person who I would be working for.
Interview Questions: Describe what type of ideas you could bring to the position that I am about to describe to you.

title: Architecture Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to schedule for the phone call interview with the recruiter, then second interview was through Zoom to go over portions of my portfolio with screen sharing. Later received rejection email.
Interview Questions: Was there an architecture project whether school or other intern you worked on as a team and you had to consider the budget? How did you manage it?

title: Senior Organization Effectiveness Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rancho Cucamonga, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Multiple virtual interviews including a panel interview and presentation, submission of work product, face to face panel with presentation for which I traveled all day and was not reimbursed for my airport parking or mileage, not to mention lunch.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation when you were asked to work on something outside of your current capability

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the website, got an email for a video interview. A couple days later, was informed to be interviewed by the manager. Process took a long time, long time of silence before getting an offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Natural Language Processing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Two phone call interviews, one for personality and the other more technical. The latter consisted of a 5 memeber panel, while the former was a single individual. Throuight the interview process they were extreemly polite.
Interview Questions: The hardest question I recieved concerned methods of validating topical model.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Had a group interview. We sat next to a partner that we interviewed and asked questions then stood up one by one to sell our partner and said why they managers should hire your partner. Then played jeopardy to answer questions. Then there was a break and we got to ask them questions and they called out the ones who didn’t make it to the next round of the interview.
Interview Questions: What is customer service?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was one on one with a floor nurse, the director, and the nurse in charge of the new grad program. Overall it was a friendly process. Mostly behavioral questions were asked.
Interview Questions: A time you went above a beyond for a patient.

title: Associate Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview that went well, was told I would be brought in for an interview, and then heard nothing back. I emailed them upwards of 4 times, only to receive an email blast that the position had been cancelled.  Such a waste of time, including the several, lengthy documents I had to fill out prior to the phone interview. Completely unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your production experience?

title: Claims Processor II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Renton, WA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process depends on the position. I had one interview with a single manager. The interview was more of a casual conversation the an interview. The interviewer already had a copy of my resume so I did not have to provide one.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you had to make a difficult decision. What skills do you have that makes you a good fit for this position. What experience have you had with Medicare claims

title: Interviewee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter calls or emails you to set up preparation phone session. i.e. help you navigate the website and interview process. HR person sent the extensive profile test and went over the next steps. Phone interview with the hiring manager to screen.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was about a ten minute interview where I spoke with the manager and she pretty much told me what they expected and asked if I could be up to their standards I said yes asked a few questions and was offered the job but I was also hired threw a temp agency so it was probably easier.
Interview Questions: Can you speak with someone in a friendly manner?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Streamlined, online due to Covid. Nice people. Relaxed. Multiple stages of interviews and each person was nice. I didn’t feel intimidated at all. Each stage was with a different person in the company which was nice to meet other people and gather other perspectives. Everyone was honest.
Interview Questions: How do you treat back pain.

title: Platform Automation IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was asked to complete a text "interview" where you simply answer questions asked again from the online application and a video interview followed right after it asking questions and allowed yourself to record yourself unlimited times to answer the questions
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Washington, DC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview process, 3 rounds. One with recruiter, one with intern program leads, last round with manager of department. If intern program leads think you’d be a good fit for multiple departments, there’s a possibility you would interview with those different departments to possibly get an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your interests and background

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Group interview and panel, process took 3 hours. Overall was a laid back experience seemed to settle in after others answered their questions presented to them.  Received feedback to elaborate on clinical situation as to make it not as generic.
Interview Questions: Clinical situation

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied on indeed and had a phone interview. They asked about my previous experience and asked if I knew about the programs that they used. While I didn't know the programs that they had in mind, my other experiences showed that I was a quick learner. I proved myself very capable after being hired and am in the process of receiving a full-time offer.
Interview Questions: How have you led a team in the past?

title: Shift Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Concord, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, approximately 3 weeks later received a call and had a phone interview, after which an in person panel interview was scheduled. Panel interview consisted of three people, two RN supervisors and an LVN.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us of a time when you made a mistake, the outcome and your plan of correction?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
4 interviews. 3 panel, 1 1:1 with director
Culture interview, skills interview, asked about experience with data, comfortability presenting, asked abt how past work related to job responsibilities. Met with the team and also met with the manager and director separately. Shows example of my past work. Discuss weaknesses and strengths
Interview Questions: Example of  working with interdisciplinary team

title: Analytical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Average, but never received notification if I moved forward or not. I emailed the hiring manager and was ignored. This happen with another interview for a similar position. Have the common courtesy to let candidates know about their standing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Pharmacy Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: the interview is a panel interview which include 90-minute interview, lunch and a 20-minute presentation. Candidate has an opportunity to tour the facility afterwards. Interview invite typically will be sent out from mid to late January.
Interview Questions: What was the most challenging mistake you made in life?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. All went smoothly. I had to wait about a half hour.  I saw the other interviewees while waiting.  It was a little uncomfortable knowing who else applied for the job.
Interview Questions: What qualifies you for this job?

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Moreno Valley, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview, about 8 of us in total. Paired us up and asked basic interview questions including why they should hire our partner, they gave us about 5 minutes to come up with answers.  Interview was about 30 minutes in total.
Interview Questions: Explain why we should hire your partner?

title: Project Manager Intermediate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interned for KP in my last year of undergrad for an international business degree with a focus on management.  for 3 months. It was an amazing experience and honestly it came down to having technical experience. I went aboard after my internship and came back to an offer.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with SharePoint before?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a short 30-minute interview with a director and another HR leader. They explained more about the role and after I was asked a series of questions. It was over the phone.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in Kaiser Permanente and why this position?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied during their available window. (note: if you’re applying it’s a 3-5 day window they accept applications be on the look out) within a week I received a call back from the hiring manager, who called me in to be interviewed in a panel interview which was a delight. I was called back within two days and was offered a spot.
Interview Questions: Tell me something unique about yourself- why you stand out?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: 1 pre-interview video to HR, 1 30 minute interview, 2 45 minute back to back interviews, 1 15 minute interview with hiring manager (ALL over phone), interview process seemed long at times, took a long time to receive an offer after final interviews
Interview Questions: When was a time you failed and what did you learn from it?

title: NICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was rushed through questioning d/t the fact they had already chosen who they were going to hire. Unfortunately I would have rather have been cancelled and told they chose someone else. They started with questions via email then set up an interview date
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at kp? What values do you have that reflect kp? Describe a time where you encountered a difficult situation and how did you handle it?

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview along with 3 in person interviews. Interviews were easy for the most part, but intimidating for one of the interviewers. Questions ranged from knowing about the company and how it operates to past experience working for healthcare.
Interview Questions: Asked about my past experience and what I hope to learn.

title: Operational Excellence Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interviews total. Mostly over the phone but offered for you to come in as well. I conducted mine over the phone. The initial screen was short and then they gave you a presentation/case to do remotely where you made slides and presented to one or two people.
Interview Questions: How many pancakes were eaten in the U.S. today?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview was not very organized, it seemed like social conversation rather than an interview. The interview only consisted of approximately five questions, they were interested in my personality and didn't focus a lot on experience.
Interview Questions: What projects have you done to help improve things in your last role?

title: Senior Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted resume through consultant. 
Got a phonecall saying I was selected for initial round. It was 3 rounds.  Phone interview, personal interview(technical questions) and last one was with HR.  I got hired on the next day.
Interview Questions: It was a very much technical question.

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very easy going. I was greeted by two managers and sat in a private conference room. It was very comforting/ reassuring. I am looking forward to continuing here .The first step of setting up a structured interview process is really understanding and defining the role.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Medical Assistant Sub Specialties Department Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online about 2 weeks ago. I got a call from the department manager on Monday afternoon to come in for interview on Tuesday.. showed up for the interview it was a panel interview. I interviewed with the supervisor, manager and lead medical assistant. They asked basic interview and behavioral questions. After they where done with their questions I had a chance to ask questions so I asked my questions once the interview was finished the dept manager escorted me to the entrance of the the building and said that she would be in contact with me. On Wednesday mid morning they called me from HR extending the offer for the position. They sent me the order for thr drug screening and now im waiting to clear the background check so I can do my physical and attend orientation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser

title: Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two managers. Asked me about a few coding guidelines then the rest my experience and personality.  Interview was average beside knowing codes Off the top of your head. A couple days later got a general email that I didn’t have enough experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: SAS Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Phone screener interview. Fairly quick turn around time after applying online. I was told this initial interview was a screener and the next step would be an in-person coding test.
Interview Questions:
-I was asked to describe my approach to data cleaning and data management process from the very beginning given a hypothetical research project.
-I was asked to describe my duties working on projects related to this role at my previous employers.

title: Account Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The process is long so be prepared to be patient. It took about 3 months from my first interview to when I got hired. One phone interview followed by several in-person interviews.
Interview Questions: Questions were mainly about work history and how you handle different obstacles.

title: Associate Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: HR was overall fast in responding and looking over your resume, but the process does have many steps. I had to fill out a background screenshot which is basically a pre-screening. I passed it and then 5 days later I was scheduled to have a 30 minute phone interview with the director. A few days later I had an in person interview which consisted of the director, CFO, and a team (3) of analysts who asked mainly behavioral questions (lasted 1 hour), afterwards I had an Excel test and I had to present my work in the Excel test to them (approximately 2 hours long). Three months later I was notified the position was canceled.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation where people higher than you disagree with your analysis?

title: Administrative Services Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Short interview. It seems as if their minds were already made up as to who they were choosing for the position. Seemed as if the interview was being done because it was just part of the process that had to be done to get to the person they already chose. More or less that I was given an interview to appease the minimum interview requirements, not really sure if it was the case, it's just how it felt.
Interview Questions: About dealing with confrontational coworkers.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Largo, MD) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick easy informal it was at a local health center very busy center. If the pay was right I would probably have accepted the job. They were honest about the responsibilities but tye pay did not match
Interview Questions: How do you view change

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was  pretty tough process and they honestly didn't really seem to care all that much about being likable or personal able. I think it could have been a little more treatable and less stiff and formal for not a huge role. It might be the right fit for someone else just not me.
Interview Questions: If I could make an impact or not to their company and why

title: Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Online Application, Testing, and Interview. Not as simple as it seems.  Testing was timed typing and Language test. The language one was the hardest, i speak Spanish fluently and i had a hard time understanding the person who was testing me. I believe she was from Spain, Spanish varies by country a bit.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work as a floater employee?

title: Business Process Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Truly a joy - team focused more on fit than on core skills. HR process screened for initial qualifications so by the time I got to interview stage the decision was primarily about interest in rpojects in the portfolio and fit within the team.
Interview Questions: Talk about a project where stakeholders changed scope as work developed

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had 8 questions asked regarding questions on my experience with patient care. I sat at a table waiting for 3 managers to enter, each asked me questions about my experience and education and training on how it relates to the role.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for a Kaiser

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Video interview with both general questions and job related questions.   They asked for introductory and technical job related presentation.  I had 72 hours to complete the interview once registered
Interview Questions: what is the most difficult part of forecasting

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied in Jan and got the offer in March.  It was done with the manager and lead in her office. Overall it was your basic set of interview questions.
Interview Questions: When was a time you did not agree with management?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone call screening, 1 to 1 interview,  in-person interview with a panel and decision. Not heard from recruiters for a while, did follow up and finally I got a negative answer without an explanation on what went wrong.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Tableau Developer/Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Setting up Tableau server and building out Tableau dashboards, There were various technical questions regarding the Tableau environment. The hiring process was very easy. The Director was a very kind person.
Interview Questions: Find the Data lake and pull data for building out visualization Dashboards

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: it was good as taken in group panel made us gain confident and also educational questions were asked also learnt what the employer wants from us learnt different things about different company
Interview Questions: if you can work in holidays and weekends

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and easy no pressure and at ease.  They make you feel very comfortable, and excited. I never felt uncomfortable. It was very quick when i found out about being hired or not.
Interview Questions: whats my best quality

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: 5 person panel interview. Round robin questions. 30 min interview with in depth description of position and complete list of requirements. Included in panel was clinic manager, one of the clinic doctors, admin manager and nurse manager. Pleasant experience with time to ask questions at the end.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a coworker kept leaving their work unfinished?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: phone screen -  pre-screened like 40 people for 2 spots. Took several weeks for them to get back to me, they had already interviewed in person their selected candidates and offered the position before getting back to me.
Interview Questions: why kaiser, strengths, weaknesses

title: Consulting Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Short, all things were expected. Had a brief phone screen followed by a skype interview (because I was out of area). All the questions were easy because they had my interview materials from a previous interview already, I was nearly hired the time before. It was mostly about fit for the role.
