Interview Questions: Minimal talk about code, mostly about the research and interest

title: Clinical Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with multiple mental health professionals. Asked relevant questions regarding my experience, goals. Cordial and informative. Answered all my questions. Provided tour of facility. Prompt followup with job offer. Very professional.
Interview Questions: Many questions regarding my experience.

title: Community Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Actual interview process was fast. Had 3 interviews in total, all on skype, with each step getting more intense. Whole interview process took about 2 weeks total. The background check, however, took forever. Took them 3 weeks to get it done. Longest 3 weeks of my life
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with community outreach?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was not offered a job, not notified of results. Followed up with HR a few times regarding the job, initially stated that interview was well and will be receiving a call in a week or two for a staff panel interview. HR did not have courage to reject applicant.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions. Why are you leaving your current organization? Behavioral questions.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: One interview for a contract position. Was asked behavioral questions and was given an at home excel assignment.  The video interview was in front of a panel of PMs and Analyst.  Pretty straight forward.
Interview Questions:
1.  Give me an example of when you set a goal and how you achieved it.
2. Tell me about a difficult client, etc

title: Technical-Rotation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very rushed. The Hiring Manager was very nice but the way they organized the interviews were very rushed. even the Technical Interviewer wasn't prepared at all. He just had slides with many java debugging problems, which he just randomly picked few and asked me. Overall the interview was very easy but very unorganized. Interviewer needs to have a set of problems and questions before hand rather than be very unorganized and take forever to ask questions and have that awkward pauses.
Interview Questions:
Basic SQL questions.
Some Java Debuggings.
OOPs questions.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The usual HR questions (tell me about yourself, why do you want this job, etc) + about 2 hours of clinical questions. For the clinical questions, there were both oral answers as well as written answers. They gave you a calculator for the calculation problems.
Interview Questions: Tell us which of these medications need to be renally adjusted (they read off a list of meds)

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an application online.  After approximately 1-2 weeks I was contacted via email to set up a phone screen with the hiring manager. After the phone screen, I had an in-person interview where I was asked all situational questions along with describing my background.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to work with a challenging person and how did you react?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Filled out the application online, I then got a email for the candidate screenshot. I filled it out and submitted it in and had a in-person interview followed about a couple of weeks after.
Interview Questions: What are some of your long term goals in healthcare

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied multiple times over a couple months. I got a call back after three months of applying. They asked me to do a phone interview. After the phone interview, I got an email asking for an in person interview. The interview was about 30 minutes long. I got an email later that same week telling me I got the position.
Interview Questions:
What qualities do you bring to a team?
What differentiates good care and excellent care or something like that. 
I can't remember the rest, but they were pretty basic/standard questions.

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was called in October to interview. Interview was with a large group of about 20. We picked numbers off of a board, read the question and answered it. We did this for a couple of rounds before being asked to go upstairs and interview 1 on 1. Completed all the requirements for hire and started in December.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of when you helped an angry customer.

title: IT Rotation Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the college/new grad IT Rotation Program at Kaiser (Pleasanton, CA campus). The process was slow and messy.  I applied online at Kaiser's website and received an email asking follow up questions (salary expectations, school information) less than a week later. One week after that, I did a phone info session with the program recruiter. Two weeks after that was a technical phone screen (no coding, just domain knowledge questions), and they promised feedback and candidate selection by the end of the next week. It took another three weeks of following up before the recruiter scheduled a phone call with me to "discuss candidacy" but he never ended up calling.

The technical interviewer was knowledgeable about various programming and scripting languages, but the recruiter wasn't too helpful in answering questions other than the basic facts about the internship.
Interview Questions: What is Object Oriented Programming and what is it used for?

title: Legal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Pretty smooth phone interview, general back ground questions. Talked about the position then talked about my resume. Asked about experience and future goals. Seemed to want long term commitment. Pretty standard job role for a legal role.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions about back ground etc.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: 3 remote interviews. Easy experience. Only phone calls with a few members of leadership. No presentation, no portfolio. Just informal conversations. Personable & informal. Easy process. Took about a month.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to leave my current job

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straightforward. There wasn't any surprises. Make sure you know why you are volunteering . Also you should know how to answer a question about dealing with conflict in a workplace.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with conflict in a workplace?

title: Psych Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen initially, invited for group panel with panel interview that took approximately an hour. Followed by a 1:1 meet and greet with the Chief of Psychiatry completed in 2016. Typical interview questions. Prepare for a vignette with diagnosis, rule-out differential dx, risk factors, safety concerns, how you worked with others, identify ways you  managed cases, application of evidence-based strategies.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult case you managed with suicidal ideation

title: Coordinator Care Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first interview is via Skype. I was email a conference ID and Access code to join the Skype meeting.  The interview was about 30 minutes.  The interviewer was really friendly.
Interview Questions: I was asked questions such as Tell me about yourself. Tell me about  a time when you had to resolve a conflict with a patient.  Finally, Tell me about a time when you had a lot of things to do how did you prioritize.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: They take really long to review resume and follow through for an interview. It may take months for them to actually respond to you but once you do a phone interview they will keep in contact
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple. They wanted to know my background in education and work. They definitely wanted to get a feel of who I was as a person and what my working style was like. They also asked a lot of scenario questions.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths and weaknesses?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview and then in person and then received an offer. It was also a panel interview. The questions were not shared in advance. They were all really friendly. It was also a very diverse panel.
Interview Questions: I don't remember. they were mostly about my abilities. I was able to tell a story

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I received an email after applying online, asking me to complete a video interview where I recorded myself answering various questions that were given to me on screen. I was allowed to rerecord my answers up to three times, but could also choose when to begin recording so that I could perfect the wording of my answer beforehand.
Interview Questions: What is your availability this summer?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Richmond, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with clinic manager and medical assistant.  Took turns asking questions. Interview went smoothly, lastly was asked if I had any questions, asked and they answered them.  Was told to expect a call from HR. Was called a week later and offered the position.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a angry/upset patient?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Union City, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took some time but it was very pleasant. There were multiple interviewers but the amount of questions were never overwhelming. The type of questions asked ranged from personal, situational, and professional.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work at Kaiser?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Conducted a phone interview followed by a case study interview panel. Wanted to know how you can solve problems. Interview was very structured and required explaining your experiences in depth.
Interview Questions: What challenges did you overcome and how did you overcome it?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with two managers with typical behavioral questions and some questions about my knowledge and past experience with finance. I think this was a bit easier than normal-- I didn't apply through their website first
Interview Questions: What do you know about Kaiser Permanente?

title: Research Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview went very smoothly and I interview with three different directors. All very nice! There were a lot of questions! I recommend that you take the time to pause and think about your answers before answering. They tend to interview a lot of candidates for the same position so it is very competitive.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, how do you manage multiple tasks at one time, etc.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rocklin, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied to an open position and got a call from a recruiter within 10mins. I did not receive any details about the job in question.Then 2 days later got another call to set up my interview
Interview Questions: Tell us about you

title: Human Resource Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very organized process with scheduling and met very nice people during the process.  Facilities are new and modern.  The interview process was professional and used panels of peers and leaders.  There were threes interviews total.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you disagreed with a plan or process.

title: Emergency Department Technician Temp to Hire Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and welcoming. My interviewer asked me 4 questions, and stated that they are looking for 10 techs temp to hire 90 days. Didn’t feel rushed nor unwelcomed. Was told I should here something back by the end of the week on selection process. This is my 3rd time interviewing with Kasier for the same position. Overall this has be the best experience. They say 3rd times a charm.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself.
2. Describe a time when you gave compassio to a person.

title: Senior Data Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Thirty minute phone interview with hiring manager. Given a data exercise to complete. Was then brought in for an  1 hour long interview where I presented findings from data exercise to a group of people (4).

Ended up getting a verbal offer from HR at the end of 2018. During negotiation there was a holiday break where hiring manager and other leaders where out of office. Soon after the new year (2019), I followed up with HR and they explained the company ended up rescinding the offer due to budget issues that put a freeze on all hiring. 

Thankful I didn’t not put in my notice with my employer. It definitely changed my perspective on the company.
Interview Questions: Give an example where you had to deal with a difficult client.

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I went through a phone screening interview. It was a simple screening. The person interviewing me was very friendly and easy to talk to. The interview took about fifteen minutes. The questions were basic questions aimed at ensuring a good fit with the company.
Interview Questions: what are your goals?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Great facilities and wonderful work/life balance. It seems the company cares for the individual physician. Excellent benefits. Great MAs. Kaiser has done well in the past because of how well they treat their employees.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about who you are, why Kaiser.

title: Doctor of Chiropractic Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Aurora, CO)
Interview Descriptions: I met with Melissa Glassey after being referred by Dr. John Hanks and after submitting my resume. We met in person, she looked over my resume, ask me some questions and told me she would call me if I was hired.
Interview Questions: What days, shifts and locations I wanted to work at.

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Ontario, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser contacted my nursing program to give my class information on how to apply for the externship. All students who applied were given an interview at one of several locations, I was assigned to Ontario, CA. It was a panel interview that included nurse managers from various units, a clinical instructor from my school, and myself. The interview was very friendly and lasted about 30 minutes. I was eventually selected for L&D and lived the experience. After the interviews all my peers that had interviewed there went to lunch. By the time we had gotten out food we all began receiving call notifying us if we had been selected.
Interview Questions: Standard behavioral questions. Simple clinical questions relative to their unit (L&D: if a patient was anxious what would you do?)

title: Strategic Planning Consultant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
I’ve worked as an intern at Kaiser and had interviews in the past but I’m really disappointed this time with how they treated their interview candidates. The interviews went fine where I had a 3-step process. First by a recruiter who screened by background and salary expectation on the phone. Then followed by another phone interview by a hiring manager who invited for an in person interview. The in-person interview was a 2 1/2 hour long process where I had to do a case study, followed a panel interview with a big group then a smaller panel interview with a Director and a Consultant. Everything went well and I felt a good vibe from all the interviewers. At the end before closing our session I asked when can I expect to hear back from the team, in which they told me it was a fair question since they are still conducting interviews for the next 2 weeks and told me to expect to hear back in 3 weeks. 3 weeks passed by and no word. So I followed up with the first hiring manager who I spoke with on the phone. A week later, no response. I politely followed by that following week, only to have no reply yet again. I reached out to the executive assistant as she was the only other person I had emailed in the past, but she had an out of office reply and mentioned her backup. I followed up with her backup and let him know that I was trying to reach so and so. Still again, no reply. 

I thought KP would be a professional place where you don’t just leave anyone hanging. We are human beings too and it would be nice to know if there is a path forward with KP or should we move on to something else. Waiting for weeks that turned into months to hear back is very disrespectful to someone’s time and effort. And not to mention, can bring a lot of anxiety and stress into someone’s life. 

Note: I never had an interview outcome but since Glassdoor made me choose, I had to pick something. It would be better to know there was no offer, though.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with conflicts and how you resolved it?

title: Senior Learning Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was Long!!!!! September 36th initial contact. Phone screen 2 weeks later. 2 weeks later Skype interview since I'm out of state. 3 weeks later .an offer was made. Recruiter told me i will then start in 1 month if everything goes well
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, give us a time that you had to develop cirriculumn.  Tell us about some best practices.

title: Senior Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Leandro, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
1st round of interviews: met with 2 inpatient physical therapy supervisors and director of rehab.
2nd round of interviews: met with 5 rehab staff members (1 PT assistant, 1 occupational therapist, 3 physical therapists)
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Received an online document with questions. Then later received an invite for a telephone interview. After that did an in person interview with a panel of department administrators who took turns reading off questions on a sheet and grading responses. Very thorough.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult member?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: When they say it's a group interview that's exactly what they mean. There were 25 of us in the conference room all vying for 7 different positions. The candidates didn't say much we spent more time listening. The had us do 2 different exercises the first was pairing up with the person next to us and learning about their work history, work related accomplishments, long term goals and then presenting them to the panel of dept supervisors. We were also asked to give two compelling reasons why they should hire this person. The other exercise was choosing a number from a slide that was attached to a hidden question, then we had to read the question aloud and answer it. There was a lot of energy in the room and the whole experience was nerve wracking, exciting and even a little fun. My advice is, if you get the invitation to attend the group interview stay calm, take notes if they have you do the interview and presentation of your partner and give thought to your answer for your question before you speak.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time when you disagreed with a supervisor or manager and how you handled it.

title: Business Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly straight forward in that I communicated and was interviewed by peers and managers. They asked basic questions and fairly summarized the hiring and on boarding process.
Interview Questions: What is one of your strengths, and what is something that you do that can hinder your performance.

title: Customer Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Renton, WA)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at the Administration building in Renton and checked in with security. I got there 15 minutes before the interview and ended up waiting 25 minutes after the actual interview time to be called back. Quick Interview, the supervisor I interviewed with went off of a sheet with basic interview questions. She was pretty straight up with me and said she felt that I'd be a really good fit based on my interview and skill set but she felt that I'd be taking a step back in taking this position as I was over qualified. The honesty was very fresh as most companies would think of their best interest rather then the interest of the applicant.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Credentialed Site Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Your first interview is with the HR representative who asks you typical interview questions and tells you more about the position. The next interview is an in-person interview with the manager. The last interview is a group interview with the entire team. They ask basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult customers? Please provide a specific example.

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to a few positions, took a long time to hear back from a recruiter, set up for a phone interview, then another interview with a doctor, then a panel interview in person.  Took quite a few months to move through the process.  It was pretty disorganized for the most part--lots of back and forth to confirm details that should have been simple.  I was told certain people would email or call me to connect and it would be days or weeks later than promised.  I guess everybody is busy.  During the application for two sites, a doc from a 3rd site called not knowing I had applied elsewhere.  Did not seem like the recruiter was on the same page with the other doctor-managers or staff.  I had much better idea of what was going on in the process than the recruiter. Not a great feeling.

Long story short is, after many months of back and forth with long periods of no contact, I still have no firm offers and no real clarity on the process.  If interested in a job, be prepared for it to take many months at best to get an offer, and maybe even longer to get trained to start?  

I did get the impression they kind of know who their want to hire and I guess if you aren't at the top of the list, perhaps you don't get a phone call or an email back very quickly, unless their top candidates turn them down.  I just wish the process was a bit more transparent, and the communication was better. 

In the end I feel like my time has been wasted and maybe I was a backup and not a serious candidate.  It would have been good to know earlier on I was not at the time of the list and I would have looked elsewhere.
Interview Questions: tell us about how you handled a difficult patient?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Had a phone technical interview followed by an on-site interview.
They went over my resume and asked questions based on my work experience, resume. Asked some team based behavioral questions followed by technical.
Interview Questions: Posed questions based on a scenario- system design based questions, security-based and overall architecture know - how. REST API calls, 2 programming questions on reversing a string, removing duplicates from an array

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Carson, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Group panel interview. They asked about 6 questions each. It was straight to the point they made it very fun. They wrote our answers down as we answered the questions. Entire process took 2 weeks from apply to getting the interview. Got the job offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Why this position here at kp over any other position?

title: Clinical Informatics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, 6 weeks later received an email to complete a questionnaire, week later received an email to setup a phone interview with HR.  The same week I received an email to setup an appointment to complete a proctored Epic assessment from home. I took the exam the next week, it was pretty much just logic based questions.  The week after taking that exam, I received an email to complete a personality analysis.  Next, I was contacted to setup a panel interview with some of the top managers of the IT department and asked to give a presentation.  Although the process went pretty smooth and everyone was extremely nice, the process was very long.  I completed the process 3 months after applying, but definitely worth the wait.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a time where you have learned something on your own.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: First is a phone screen to talk about more background details. Then, HR sent two two data assessment exercise , and it will be required to complete in one week, and will make another appointment to present the findings to team members through Skype.
Interview Questions: What are three RANK functions in SQL and difference between them?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: it takes about a month to hear from them in which they’ll ask you through an email for your certifications and BlS card and any other certification you may have. in a week from that email or so they’ll do a brief phone interview after this they ask you for a career snapshot which basically a written interview you have to upload to he computer as pdf and the. finally an invitation to a group interview! hang on you’re not done yet! in the group interview it’s about 24 MA’s you have to do about 2 group exercises, in front of a 9 person panel this is the time to brush up on your speech class notes and tactics if you ever took one! then you will be singled out individually and that concludes the 2 hour long group interview make sure you’re personable and very nice and hold your own in stressful environments im still waiting for that call. I did my group interview today 10/01/2018
Interview Questions: when has been a time you handled a stressful situation at work and what was the outcome? (stand up and answer in front of 23 other strangers) on the spit the questions are numbers you draw so they really vary. it’s a game of chance

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard. It was a panel interview.  They gave an overview of the position and looked over my resume. It has been a few weeks since I interviewed and I haven't heard back.  It also took awhile for the recruiter to contact me to set up the interview after they had already reached out to me.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Bellevue, WA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was more so of getting to know more about you and how you would go about handling different situations. The whole process was quick and took about a week.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a difficult situation?

title: High School Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
-apply online 
-wait a week or two for application review 
-receive an email about availability and choosing an interview 
-choose a group interview time 
-attend interview, introduce your name
- questions asked in various orders of people: from one side of table to the other and then the opposite way, people picked randomly
Interview Questions: Why health care and why this location?

title: Intern/Associate Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was in the pharmacy , no quiet at all so i did not have to be dressed up formally. the manager was very nice and tired. Questions were very  similar to the typical questions that are available online.  I think you should be very enthusiastic for this company to get hired .
Interview Questions: What is your 10 years goal

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: There is a group interview and then one or two more. The interview process is timely but thorough. There are multiple managers looking for the position watching so it feels intimidating but its actually a good thing. Love this company.
Interview Questions: How will you be an asset to our company?

title: Nursing Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Long process but you will get email after email for interview process. Panel of other potential candidates in the same room with you. need to shine versus the other candidates
Interview Questions: provide a time where something was not going the way the customer wanted and how did you fix it?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Duluth, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Majority of the employees are hired through a temp agency. The background and drug test depends on the temp agency, however I’m sure majority have been urine test ... & they all require a intense background check, all job dates should be precise as possible or it can delay you starting.. possibly losing the position.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What is excellent customer service to you? 
Name a time when you didn’t deliver the best costumer service? 
Tell us about a time you didn’t agree with a rule or policy at your job? What did you do about it? 
What does it mean to take ownership of a call?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview process ran well, but the background check takes a long time. The HR did not tell you there is a more than one month background check until you get hired by the company, it would be better if they could shorten the background check process and tell the candidate all information in advance.
Interview Questions: What was your most successful project>

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: It was a huge group interview. When I received the invite it came with some packets of information that we were told to become very familiar with prior to interview day. We participated in group activities, introducing each other and their history(personal/experience). Then we were broken up into groups of two and personally interviewed together.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking to leave your current position?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview, cold and impersonal. It was neither enjoyable nor insightful. It was a series of 3 interviews, which basically rehashed the same questions, just asked by different people. All in all, I didn’t learn much about the company nor the culture during the process, which I suppose should have been a red flag.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: OD Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I had some wonderful meetings with the OD/Leadership Development team. Unfortunately, by the time I was interviewed by the actual client group, it was so late in the process that the discovery of my skills not being a match that the entire experience left a bad taste in my mouth. My conclusion was that it hadn't been clear from the start exactly what they were looking for, and so for them and for me it was an inefficient process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experiences leading change with a very large employee base such as ours.

title: Travel Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The interview was automated.   A call was made to me by an automated system that asked questions and recorded my answers.  There were only about 5 or 6 questions that are very common in an interview for a travel nurse contract.
Interview Questions: Whow do you deal with a doctor who is difficult?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Riverside, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then group interview about a week later with 10 other candidates. Part of it required you to learn about the person who was sitting next to you and their professional background and"sell" them to the interviewers. Then Jeopardy style questions where everyone picked a number on the screen and answered the hidden question chosen. Interview ended when they called you back in one at a time and let you know if you were offered the job.
Interview Questions: If you planned for a vacation and requested time off, but your manager denied your request, how would you handle it?

title: Departmental Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Lots of technical questions were asked as well as personal. Most important question is why do you want to work Kaiser? What skills and qualifications can you bring to this job?
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict in the work place

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Orange, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The first step was to do a group interview, and you are to present your partner and why they should be hired. You are then in the group interview asked situational questions that you are asked to answer. 

If you are selected for the 1:1 interview it was more what would you do if?.... They give you situations and you are to answer them  accordingly. It was definitely not what I was expecting, but I should of anticipated the questions. So review your clinical skills and every step to do everything. Know your levels, rights, and effects of medications. 

They called about 5/6 days after the 1:1 and offered the job. You are required to complete a drug test in a certain time frame.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
How do you remove a catheter?
What are the steps to starting an IV.
What are the adverse effects of .....
What would you do if you saw your superior doing something they shouldn't?
How do you handle conflict in a work situation?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: A majority of the interview questions are now geared towards behavioral interviews where they will ask you questions about how you have handled situations in the past (sometimes they will give you questions beforehand, but most are just the common generic questions).
Interview Questions: How have you handled a disagreement with a supervisor and what did you do?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It is a multi-process for hiring new employees. Typically, the Recruiter contacted me, and ask about my experiences and skills, then she ask me to send my resume to her via email. And finally I got an in-person interviews by Hiring Manager.  Right now, I am just waiting for any results from recruiter. This was only yesterday.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: 1. Applied online 2. answered 10 screening questions via email 3. Completed a phone interview 4. Panel interview. Interview questions were standard to our field- various vignettes, previous experience questions, etc. After an offer is made the background check process moves very quickly. Be ready to complete an additional application & drug screen almost immediately after the offer is made. Also be ready with proof of employment in case they can’t verify employment. Good luck!
Interview Questions: Various patient centered vignettes

title: Enroller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter reached out to me and did a phone screening. After few days, she sent me supplement questions that I had to answer and emailed back. In a week I got a in-person interview. And I was hired a day later. But background check and starting day took a while. It took a month.
Interview Questions: Most of the question during an interview was 'scenario' questions

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: All behavioral/scenario questions like describe the time you had conflict with your coworkers. Something we all dealt with at any work place. Very pleasant experience and will try again for sure.
Interview Questions: What is your next 5 year plan?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two people at the same time. Questions were very typical interview questions. I did not get a call back but I did follow up and they had went a different route with that position and stopped all interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you react in a stressful situation?

title: Help Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
About 2 weeks after I applied, I got a phone call to discuss the position & do a phone screening. I was especially excited because this is such a well known, successful, & highly reviewed company, and because I did not expect to ever hear from this company (I felt that there would be many very qualified applicants to an organization like KP).

One of the first things that he mentioned was that "he found out more about the hours of the position" and that it was a graveyard shift, 8pm-4am.  This completely contradicted the job posting, and made me feel like the company was being misleading when it posted the position. The listing specifically stated three things:

"Shift: Day"
"Working Hours Start: 8:00 AM"
"Working Hours End: 5:00 PM"

I, and probably a lot of people, would not have applied to this position if I had known it was a graveyard shift. I think they're possibly being misleading on purpose, because they'll get more applicants if they say it's a Day shift. If it was an honest mistake when the listing was created, why have they not updated it to reflect the graveyard shift?

Two thumbs down, KP.
Interview Questions: We didn't get that far. The first thing we talked about was the hours, and that this was now a graveyard shift.  I immediately thanked him for his time, and told him that I was not interested in a position involving the graveyard shift & that I wouldn't have applied if I had known they'd changed it.

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vallejo, CA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two Supervisors met with me and described the job and their expectations (good attendance, dependability...) and they were really nice and the environment was comfortable.  I could appreciate this because I was nervous! lol
Interview Questions: What would you do if you received a call and the person had a heavy accent that was hard to hear?  How would you handle this kind of call?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very easy...I applied online and was called in for a group interview. Very laid back. They will call on you specifically sometimes, but even if they don't, make sure you try to answer every question they propose.
Interview Questions: How do you work with a team?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The HR contacted me after I submitted the application. I have conducted two rounds of interviews. Overall, the interview is not too difficult.  Later, they require you to go to orientation to learn the basic health information.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you would be a good fit for this position

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Group interview of about 10 candidates. Group of administrators representing different regions within the GA area. Learned about the company, answered questions regarding K.P. Learned about other candidates and had to intro them to administrators. Had to be creative as a group to represent K.P.s values as well as showing your skills while working on a team.  Comfortable and professional atmosphere.
Interview Questions: Tell about a difficult situation with a patient and/or family member and how did you handle it.

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fairfax, VA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about 2 months. I was invited to take a timed typing test about a month after I applied I did the test and got an email to respond to a few questions. Weeks after that I got a call from HR to interview and I interviewed the following week. The interview went very well (I used questions found on Glassdoor to prepare and it helped immensely). About a week after that I got a call about my availability and preferred schedule. Then I got a call a week later to officially offer me the position! I am now waiting on my background check and immediate drug test then I start training in a few weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser Permanente?

title: Teleservice Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Vallejo, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the TSR position online. A few weeks later received a call from a recruiter to take the assessment test. After completing the assessment test received a call from recruiter to inform of passing score and phone interview with hiring manager. After phone interview with hiring manager. Had a 1:1 was interview with the Hiring Manager. After the interview received a call from recruiter with an contingent offer. Completed Drug Screen and Background check and formally offered position.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a language barrier with a customer who refuses to speak to an interpreter?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Corona, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview. They had us arrange ourselves by last name alphabetical order. They had a packet with how the interview would be conducted. We answered individually and worked in groups presenting our partners response. After the interview we waited while they reviewed our questions and resume to see if they had any further questions. The email stated allow for 2 hours but was there almost 4 hours.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been provided feedback that you didn't agree with?

title: Licensed Optician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Bellevue, WA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two leads for about 20 minutes. Asked a few questions and then spent the rest of the time of them telling me how awesome the company is to work for.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult time you had at work and how you dealt with it.

title: Director of Surgery Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baldwin Park, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Several panel interviews.  Clear communication from facilitator on location and panel participants.  All interviews were very well organized and each participant had a list of behavioral based interview questions.
Interview Questions: Questions about ethics, dealing with resistors to teamwork, and difficult physicians.

title: Senior Professional Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the hiring manager and after thorough explanation of the position, I confirmed that I was still interested. We then set up a time to meet within the next week. The interview was 1 hour with 2-3 people from management, then followed by another hour with the team (about 10 staff).
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you made a mistake. How did you fix it?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baldwin Park, CA)
Interview Descriptions: disorganized HR. received a call a day before to schedule for an interview next day. group interview was only a powerpoint slideshow- had to wait about two hours for actual one on one interview with department supervisor/manager. interviewer seemed rush and didn't want to say much. robotic response.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for kp?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: This is the worst interview experience I've ever had. The HR lady didn't respect me at all. I am still working during my OPT time and I put Yes for the question "Do you need a Sponsorship now or in the future?" I can understand if you don't want to hire international people, but she consisted I am a liar and she said I didn't mention I need the sponsorship. I checked the document I sent to her, there is a big "Yes" for the sponsorship. If the HR doesn't know how to respect their candidate who has the passion to contribute, how could the company select the right fit? The HR at Kaiser Permanente at LA office is so terrible! Besides, she called me at 5:30 PM PST, so unprofessional!
Interview Questions: Do you need sponsorship?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by charge nurses, Director and educator. Brief review about what they were looking for and asked what I would be able to contribute to the team. Explained usual patients they receive.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult co-worker?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with the DOR, the head of the ortho department and a few other experienced therapists. It was a through interview, with questions that made you really think.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an employee at Kaiser Permanente?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of Diagnostic Imaging  supervisors, which made me very nervous. They tried their best to ease my nerves, but it didn’t help. They alternated asking questions while scoring my responses .
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself...

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very well and covered the basics. They just want to make sure that you are a hard worker and aren’t afraid to take on leadership roles if need be.
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about a time when you had to take on a leadership role?

title: Psychiatric Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Complete online application, phone screen, individual interview with hiring manager, panel interview. Call and offer. Accepted. Moving through hiring process which can take a long amount of time due to credentials.
Interview Questions: What are the downfalls of short term therapy?

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are very casual. You can interview in a conference room or someone's office. Usually it's one or two people max. You should bring a few copies of your resume. They always ask for resume.
Interview Questions: They always ask "can walk me through your resume?" and then questions such as "tell about something that your proud of".

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Woodland, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: easy, it was in a group setting and very simple personality questions were asked. You are asked about why you would be a good fit and other things like that. You schedule your interview online with a form
Interview Questions: Where do you live

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: After applying, it took about 2 months to receive a call from a recruiter to answer pre-screening questions, almost 3 weeks to receive a phone interview with the recruiter, then another 3 weeks to receive an in-person interview, then heard back in a week.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself. 
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
Tell me about a time you made an error and how did you fix that error?
If you were given 5 tasks with deadlines and knew you could only finish 2 tasks but the due date, what would you do?
Give an example of how the work you do in your department is important to another department.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone interview by Human Resources to discuss job history and qualifications. Once "approved" it was followed by a scheduled panel interview, consisting of peers, charge nurses, the department manager, and the educator.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength and weakness?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first part is a phone interview with the department manager where it is a general get to know you type of questions. The second was a panel interview with the department manager and the current case managers within the said department. It was a virtual face time interview.
Interview Questions: Experience, challenges, strengths and weakness

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Tacoma, WA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR then they forwarded to clinic hiring manager. Notified by email to obtain 5 references to be completed in a couple days. Then Received by clinic after to arrange interview.
Interview Questions: Questions like how you handle a difficult situation with either a coworker or patient.

title: HR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: LONG! The entire process tool over 6 months. They only pay for airfare if you are an out of town applicant - everything else is on your own (e.g., food, Uber, etc.).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on the Kaiser Permanente website and got email to do an online on demand interview a few days later. Got a phone interview a few weeks after submitting video interview. Question were pretty straightforward and easy since it was just an intern position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA)
Interview Descriptions: This was for a temporary position as an Employee Health Nurse. The interview was an informal phone interview with the floor manager. The manager asked questions regarding experiences in the field and why I was interested in the specific position. I was also asked what I know about Employee Health.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser? What experiences do you have in this field?

title: Business Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application online, received an email to interview. First interview was online video interview where you were asked a series of questions and submit at your own will. 2nd part is a phone conversation with some follow up questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Kaiser?

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Renton, WA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone call from HR recruiter to discuss the job and later a phone call to set up a Technical phone screen.  Technical phone screen with the lead systems administrator and hiring manager. Upon doing well that led to an in person interview with 2 systems team members a program manager, and the hiring manager.  Later a followup from the HR recruiter.
Interview Questions: Standard technical questions.  Basic commands and switches, how do you troubleshoot a down system, virtual machine and disk storage questions... Behavioral questions such as how do you keep your tech skills current, how do you deal with an angry client.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Redwood City, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call from the hiring manager. After I set up a interview date,  I just had one interview with her, and she told me that I got hired. After that HR  reached out to me in 2 weeks later as what the manager told me so.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, strength, and weakness.

title: Data Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied on Kaiser Permanente website and a recruiter reached out to me. There was one round of interview on phone and then I was invited for an on-site for another 2 rounds of interview. The team was friendly but a very slow process. 

The main skillset requirement was Base SAS and the manager asked me questions based on SAS Base and a few behavioral questions. 

In the on site interview, I was given 3 questions and was asked to solve them.The question had a couple of tables and was given a program. I was to solve what the output of the SAS program would be and what records from the table would be selected. Another question was to write a SAS program to derive a specific table from given tables.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with SAS functions such as string functions, numeric functions?

title: Compliance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The prerequisite for an interview was creating a PowerPoint presentation and presenting it before a large panel. Never heard back from interviewer(s) after interview and follow up attempts went unanswered.
Interview Questions: Describe your problem solving skills.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter by phone for a brief phone interview  where we discussed my background and then was scheduled for an in person interview with the hiring manage
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background in communications?

title: Employee Health Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Norwalk, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with 10 other applicants. One round had questions and the. During this round you interview your partner about past work experience and best achievement. Then present each other to the panel of directors/managers of different departments. Then you play a game where you pick a question of the board and answer. If you pass that round you get to go to one on one interviews with the department heads.
Interview Questions: How would you keep a peer motivated if they were showing lack there of?

title: IT Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Silver Spring, MD) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by HR to do a video interview, then was called in to the office for an in person interview with the hiring manager and two other team members. Heard back a few days after my in person interviews. There was a background check and drug screening after job offer.
Interview Questions: What are your biggest strengths and weaknesses?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the Kaiser Permanente website. It took a while to hear back, as Kaiser HR is notorious for taking a long time to screen applicants. I was finally given an interview offer after 3 months. Standard pre-interview process, with paperwork to fill out, drug screen, physical etc. Panel Interview with 4 interviewers. Group interview with 10 interviewees.
Interview Questions: Describe your partner and why they would be a good fit for this position.

title: Optometric Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baldwin Park, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Saw the job opening on their website and submitted interest. I think 1-2 weeks passed until I received an e-mail requesting for me to submit a career snapshot within 3 days. I turned my snapshot 5 minutes past the deadline, but I still received a class by the recruiter the next day. The recruited invited me to an in person interview after the weekend. I was interviewed by 2 people: the office manager and 1 other person. It was fairly formal/serious. I received an e-mail the next day stating I was no longer considered for the position.
Interview Questions: If we were to call your supervisor, what would they say is something you need to work on and what you excel at?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied through KP website. Got on-demand video interview, and about 1-2 weeks later got a notification for a webcam interview with the team lead. The interviews themselves were relatively straightforward, no curveballs.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Senior Technical Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews were scheduled on the same day - unfortunately the first interviewer never turned up. After waiting for 45 minutes, I disconnected. The second round of interview was with a person who asked me developer level questions and claimed that the role was a Senior Developer /Lead role. Not sure why the role was advertised as a Technical Architect role.  Looks like this position has been open for more than 6 months - would advise the hiring team to set the right expectations - architects specialize in Design and not specifically writing syntax level code. No concepts were discussed.
Interview Questions: Specific questions on Java, CSS, HTML - coding level questions. Non Concepts were discussed.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online then got an invitation to do a pre-recorded interview session. Probably around 2-3 weeks later someone reached out to me over the phone to go over the position details then they forwarded my resume to the hiring manager and I got contacted for a phone interview about a week later. A day later I was informed that I would be moving onto the next round to speak to the senior director, but he had a work emergency and couldn't make the interview. A few days later, I was made an offer. The hiring manager was very friendly!
Interview Questions: What do you know about Kaiser?

title: MBA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for 2 different positions here, and both had different interview questions and focuses.  For the position I was ultimately not hired for, the questions seemed mainly geared toward finding a cultural fit and did not touch on my working capabilities, for the position I actually accepted the questions seemed more appropriately aligned to my job context.
Interview Questions: What was your favorite organization to work for?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Olympia, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Had one interview over the phone with HR that lasted about 30 minutes, and then a face to face interview on site with the hiring manager & the team lead.  About a week later I received a call with the offer.
Interview Questions: Think of a time when you had to make a choice between two unwanted solutions.  How did you choose?

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was nervous but the interviewer was kind and very friendly during the interview that I was able to relax . I was able to answer all her QUESTIONS and then we bid each other farewell as we part ways
Interview Questions: If you were having a hard time understanding what the patient wants, how would you deal with the situation

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend and current employee. I was called back for an interview within a week. After I interviewed I received a call back from the manager that night.
Interview Questions: Tell me of a time you had an interaction with a challenging patient and how did you handle it?

title: General Dentist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: This was a standard one-on-one interview at their office in Portland.  The interview had standard prepared questions.  Discussed the job and benefits.  Very nice and friendly, not very stressful.
Interview Questions: How would you handle conflict with team members?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call about 2 weeks after. I did a phone interview with the office manager then was asked in for an in person interview. This was with the office manager and 6 physicians.
Interview Questions: They asked typical interview questions such as my strengths and weaknesses and how I would handle certain situations.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Clackamas, OR)
Interview Descriptions: I got interviewed at brookside mental health. I worked full time at kaiser through in angency already which helped get me an interview. I was asked questions not really involving if I can preform  the task  but more personal problem solving questions to see if I would be a good fit also abut experience with mental health. Later found out someone who worked for Kaiser had applied and she gets first pick so I didn't get hired but I would've if she didn't accept.
Interview Questions: what do you do in stressful situations

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Victorville, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied every night after work for 6 months to every position within a 40 mile distance of my house and received an invite to an interview once a month. I finally decided to take an interview with Moreno Valley.
Interview Questions: Group interview with manager and recruiter who ran the interview. Group consisted of ten candidates. Two interview exercises. First exercise to introduce a partner and present why kaiser should hire them. Exercise two was jeopardy with behavioral/personality questions. Two rounds of that.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and I was contacted by the Hiring Manager a month later. Following a phone interview, I was asked to come in for a panel interview. My references were contacted a few days later and then I was offered a position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your background.

title: Software Engineer(Internship) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for a Webex interview 2 weeks after I applied online from career site. They asked mostly behavioral questions and my previous experience to determine if I was qualified. They made it clear during the interview through praise that I was going to be selected, rather than quietly ending the interview and making me guess what their next move will be, which I liked. Took them quite a while to get back to me after following up with them to receive the offer letter.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser?

title: Senior Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Centennial, CO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called to set up a phone screen with the  hiring manager. The hiring manager called to tell me about the job, asked me a simple technical question. Didn’t really care about my background- just told me about the team and the position. He then asked me to come in for an in person interview. When I arrived the hiring manager was the only person there and four people where on the phone. The first person on the phone  asked conceptual technical questions that didn’t really make sense or apply to real world setting. I couldn’t hear and there was no visuals and could hardly understand the person on the phone. I got annoyed and frustrated and after the initial three questions I made no effort to answer the rest of the questions that the 3 other people asked. The guerella style interview didn’t work for me and I wouldn’t want to work with them. I would have been fine with real world questions or an online assement. They made no effort to get to learn about my background so an assement would have been adequate for this purpose.
Interview Questions: If you had a database with two tables and the fields are ‘ couldn’t hear what he said)  how would you join  to get the data for something I couldn’t hear.

title: PM Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied and 3 days later I was contacted by a recruiter and needed to complete a video interview within 48 hours. Then a month went by and I didn't hear anything, then I got an email from the hiring manager that she wanted to interview me along with the mentor I would be working with. The interview went very well and about 2 weeks later I was told I am getting the internship.
Interview Questions: Asked several questions about my experience on my resume.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with three people and it was nice.  They asked me about my last job and how I deal with the union.   If I have Epic experience and if I can train in Epic.
Interview Questions: Are you used of dealing with the union

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2 weeks, fast turnaround time and process, multiple rounds with manager and other consultants, interviewers were patient and explained to project they were specifically looking to hire for, answered all the questions I had
Interview Questions: strengths, weakness, why do you want to work here? what are your career goals?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: the video interview is behavioral and depending on department/area of interest, will speak to the director of the department you might be placed under. Research the department for 2nd round and brush up on skills that may be required
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Business Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very transparent , scheduling, expectations - it was very clear that the team cared about approaching a new candidate with respect and set expectation of what role would entail. I really appreciated the transparency and the communication
Interview Questions: Previous experience, plans for future, standard interview questions.

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty simple. I went on their website and applied to the internship and a few days later, I was asked to perform a video interview. I was asked to record myself answering standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Kaiser?

title: Applications Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Round 1 - The company sends you an invite via a 3rd party to do a video interview where you answer some questions about yourself. They ask you questions and you either respond by typing in the answer or recording a video where you answer the question. Questions include why you want to work for the company and tell me about yourself.
Round 2- Technical and behavioral interview with the team in a panel format, 1 hour long.
Interview Questions: Give a high-level overview of what a virtual assistant does when you ask it to play a song from a third-party application.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a prescreen questionnaire to complete. I went in for the initial interview and completed a case study onsite. Thereafter, I was contacted to go in for two more interview appointments.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to join Kaiser?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process took almost a week. A day after I applied online, I received an email from the HR department asking me to answer and submit a pre-screening interview in document form. I received a call 3 days later and got an invitation for an in-person interview.
Interview Questions:
Mix of basic personal and behavioral questions. 
1. Past experiences (research and non-research such as clerical duties)
2.  Why are you interested in this position?
3. Are you comfortable working with and speaking to various people?
4. How did you handle a difficult situation?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Honolulu, HI) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Smooth. I had no issues to speak of.  Staff was nice. Personal and knew the history of work here on the island.
  Basically the same as anywhere else.
Interview Questions: It was the usual. What are you good at.  What are you bad at.....

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2018
