Interview Descriptions: Brief and to the point. They new what they were looking for.  I felt they had specific initiatives they were looking to fill.  Did not ask very many questions about work history.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: ER Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I actually didnt have a formal interview, I was already hired as a contracted employee. But it was a smooth transition and I really liked it!  They were able to get me hired easily through my contractor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Internship Interview

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and 3 weeks later I received an email from HR to set up a phone interview. The phone interview was with an HR representative. It lasted all of 10 minutes. HR asked "Tell me about your work experience" and "What is your biggest strength". A week to two weeks later I had a second phone call with the Hiring Manager. That lasted 30 minutes. The hiring manager explained the job duties and based on description given asked "detail your work experience relative to this position". She asked a couple more questions specifically about my work experience. Two weeks later, I received an email  to schedule an in person interview. Four days later, I had my in-person interview with the hiring manager. That interview lasted one hour and was mostly about job responsibilities and some departmental challenges. I responded with some ideas I had to potentially alleviate issues. It was a very casual interview. Two weeks after that I was scheduled for a fourth phone panel style interview with 5 people including the hiring manager. Each asked 1 to 2 questions. Mostly behavioral questions...ie. how would you handle certain situations. Finally, and two agonizing  weeks later I was offered the position. From my experience it is a very, very lengthy interview process. I read almost all these interview questions on glassdoor (which was super helpful) but there is one thing I wanted to read so here it is....DO NOT GET DISCOURAGED DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS. It took me a total of 3 months to go through it. Just because they have not responded in 1 week after interview does not mean you didn't get the job. Again...three months with 4 interviews. Continue to read through these interview questions listed on glassdoor because they helped me prepare! Good luck!
Interview Questions: Most questions are behavioral..ie..how would handle a particular situation.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by 3rd-party firm that said my experience would be a great fit. After working with the 3rd-party we identified that their target salary was well below my target, but the 3rd-party identified he was able to get them to increase their range and arranged a phone interview. The phone Interview with the direct supervisor went well - focused on past experience, complexities of environment at Kaiser and how my past experience is applicable, familiarity with Kaiser, and why looking for this position. The interviewer also wanted to get to know me as a person and my style as well, which was awesome! Within a few days the 3rd-party identified that they wanted me to come in for an in-person interview, which would be arranged directly through Kaiser. The interview consisted of 2 separate panel interviews - one with staff-level & manager-level peers and the other with management/leadership - over the phone. The interview with the peers went ok, however they were not very engaging and the overall vibe I got was not friendly (more like why are you here?), excluding one team member. The questions asked by peers were focused on previous experience in working with teams, working offsite/remote, and past project experiences. The second interview (with management/leadership) went well. In general, management shared their vision for the team and how they want the candidate to fit in. The questions asked focused on experience managing staff, performing projects, challenged and how they were overcome, adding value, leadership, and communication. Within a day or two was contacted by HR and provided an offer that was significantly lower than what I was making and what was discussed. I did not decline the offer, only acknowledged that an offer was made. I spoke with the 3rd-party and he was also upset and said he would find out. Ultimately, it appears that they decided they had some limits based on making sure people are being paid same amounts for same positions and also they wanted to fill the lower position. I declined the offer and the counter offers made. I feel like it was deceptive and waste of my time as I was very clear about salary expectations upfront and had received multiple offers well within and exceeding my salary expectations. I don’t believe this is a good practice to advertise for one position to draw people in and switch to another position without clearly discussing with the candidate. I am not sure if this is an issue with Kaiser or just within the specific area the job was in, but I reluctantly have a less favorable opinion about Kaiser now than I did when I was pursuing the opportunity.
Interview Questions: What experiences have managing staff?

title: Assistant Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: This was for an APC job @ KP Educational Theatre. Disorganized and unprofessional. After several months, 3 interviews, with the last interview requiring a presentation and writing sample, I was not given the common courtesy of an update about the position. Save yourself the time and energy. Don't waste your talent here.
Interview Questions:
Project Goal

The project we've prepared for you to work on is designed to show us some of your writing and communication skills. Our goal is to get to you know you and your skills better. 

 

Components

Please select a topic to teach a group of people in a workshop-like setting. The topic can be anything that requires a few steps toward achieving an objective. It can be a physical or mental skill, a life skill, a trick, a game, etc. but it will probably work best if it's something you are interested in or have some expertise around. It does not have to be related to theatre, education, or a work skill. Once you've selected your topic or idea or whatever, please prepare the following:

 

1. A 1-3 page written narrative that talks about your topic in any way you want. 

2. A short visual presentation of what you're going to teach and the appropriate steps towards mastery or learning objective. (PPT, Prezi, whatever presentation platform you prefer, but please use technology appropriate to a visual presentation.) Please use short bullets where appropriate. Please time yourself to no more than 7 minutes. 

3. Be ready to teach what you've selected to a group of people in our conference room. Your 'lesson' should be 5-10 minutes. 

 

We think it would work best if you could send your written narrative ahead of time. Is Wednesday end of day possible (5pm)? Then you can plan on presenting your visual info and then teaching the group on their feet. We will provide a projector/screen/computer if you would like to send us a file, or you can bring your own computer if you'd prefer.

title: Sr. Brand Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Multiple levels. Screener, then team interview, then Vice President, then external consultant, then I had to come back in and present to the other strategists on the team. It was thorough, well-rounded and positive.
Interview Questions: If we were sponsoring a disaster relief benefit in a part of the country that was impacted by a natural disaster through our community benefit arm, how and where would you use the thrive logo and tagline?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Modesto, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview. There was a panel of different therapists and supervising managers. Asked straightforward questions about my previous experiences. I worked with a recruiter which was very responsive and helpful.
Interview Questions: Can you see yourself working here for a long period of time? What is your treatment philosophy? What has been your experience?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Usually it is a group interview, however, we had such a large group that we had a group "orientation" before the interviews. The manager and several supervisors were present for this and told us about the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: Appointment Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a 5 person interview it was long and consisted of many questions. Be prepared using the STAR method you will do good. It took a few weeks to hear back.
Interview Questions: One negative thing about yourself

title: Sr Business Process consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initial screening with Human Resources department recruiter then with regional reporting manager, director  followed by two of his direct reports.  Then was made an offer.  All depends on timing and availability of personnel.
Interview Questions:
How do you successfully build relationship with stakeholders? 

How do you make decisions in collaboration with  work groups? 

How do you manage difficult conversations?  

How do you manage conflict and repair relationships?

title: Paychiatric Social Worker Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: This is a long process starting with applying, being contacted by a recruiter, having a phone screening, taking a language exam if applicable, waiting for results, being contacted by hiring management, having a phone interview, waiting to be invited to an in person interview, being offered the position contingent upon your background check going through 3 months later.
Interview Questions:
I interviewed at several places and these were the common questions:
-What does customer service mean to you? 
-What is your preferred treatment modality? 
-If you had a problem with someone at work how would you handle it? 
-A vignette is presented and you’re expected to conceptualize; diagnose, Tx plan, and provide resources 
(Case management)

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple interviews: phone interview, panel Interview, executive medical team interview, one-on-one, interviews, etc. During the panel interview there is the typical getting to know you (tell us about yourself) section, a dimensional interview section (...describe a time when you had to...), a consulting case study section (they provide), and a presentation section (you provide). The process can be lengthy, but they did a good job keeping me informed or answering my emails or calls.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you over the other candidates?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and after 2 weeks I received a phone call from the service chief to have face to face interview.  There was NO iternary. I was asked  to spend 3 hours shadowing  a physician doing patient care in the floor ( kind of odd to me). The physician herself was upset with her current job that I am applying !
After that, I was taken to lunch at a local restaurant. There were 4 physicians from that department who showed no or little interest in explaining the job descriptions. When I asked where shall I work ? The answer was : we have seven clinic and you need to cover them on as needed basis. After that, there was an interview with another 5 physicians asking several  questions: why Kaiser? Weakness? Trade off with academic and research,,,,,etc.

After finishing that day...I was waiting for 3 weeks without receiving a reply. I texted the service chief and he didn’t bother himself to reply instead the recruiter called and left a voice message.
Interview Questions:
Why kaiser
Weakness
Interest
Trade off academic with pure work

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed at the same time with 2 other applicants. There were 2 assistant nurse managers and 1 nurse manager of the unit. They asked questions from a list and wrote down notes as you answered.
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you? Describe a time when you weren't able to provide the best service and what you did to resolve it.

title: Clinical Practice Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: First interview was an informal conversation with the department manager. Second phone conversation was with sub-team leader. Third contact was an in-person interview with a panel (virtual and live). Prior to the actual interview, one hour was given to review a case study. During interview, I was expected to present and answer questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when a project did not go the way it was expected to; what did you do?

title: Registered Nurse I (New Grad) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Process took less than a month. I applied online (external hire) for the New Grad Residency program at the Irvine location. After about 2 weeks I received an email to fill out a candidate snap shot (info for desired location, certifications, etc. plus 2 or 3 questions). A week later I received an email invitation for a group interview. It was about 30 candidates in room, with a panel of initially 5 staff members + 1 recruiter.  A brief orientation of the days layout and introductions by members of the panel. First activity is to get to know your partner, after 10 mins. stand in front of everyone and you sell your partner as to why they should be hired to work at KP. Second activity included choosing a random question and answering in front of everyone again. We were given a short break and returned to them making the cuts. Those left were given appointment times (same day) to return to have a 1-on-1 with just you and the panel (3 staff members). 

The atmosphere is more impersonal than most interviews I’ve been on, which were also Magnet recognized organizations. For me personally, I felt here, you aren’t able to connect on a level for them to even judge if you fit their unit.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Appointment Setter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Called after a week I applied. Interview was cool and easy. Did about three interviews including a phone interview. Hired after 1 month process and after they did a full drug and background check.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 20 people interviewing for 3 spots. People who got job offers were already employed as nursing assistants at kaiser. My interview had 2 candidates and 2 peoples people interviewing us.
Interview Questions: Why kaiser?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: My interview was a group interview. There were about 10 of us. We answered 2 questions at first, then the interview questions were started. We were seated in alphabetical order and took turns answering the questions. They want to make sure that you're paying attention, so be sure that you know what questions you have answered already.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in a call center?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fayetteville, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Fill out the application and if selected you will be asked to do a video interview. If you pass the interview then you'll get an invitation to group interview. The interview start promptly at 9:30. They advertise the position as days but they only give you the option of 10-7 or 11-8
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to reach a goal? Did you reach and how did you reach it?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions:
After submitting my resume I received a phone call asking to set up a phone interview with the team recruiter. The Phone interview lasted approximately 30 minutes and went very well. The recruiter ask me what my salary expectations were and I replied that I would like to make what I was making at my last job when I left, which was $19.50 an hour. He replied " oh I think we can do better than that with your amount of experience". I replied well that would be great. He said he was actually going to recommend me for the job to the hiring manager. After checking my references I would be receiving a phone call requesting a face-to-face interview.
I received a phone call on the Tuesday before Thanksgiving and set up an interview for the following Tuesday. I was supposed to be interviewed by 3 people however, just one of the managers showed up late to interview me. After answering normal interview questions, she said I understand you interviewed on the phone with Lolo. I replied yes I did. He went over the starting salary and told you that it was a union position, didn't he? I replied well he didn't tell me that it was a union position, but I said that's fine my last job was a union position as well. And he also told you the starting salary is $14.80 an hour., correct? So I replied no, he did not tell me the starting salary was $14.80 an hour. I then went on to say he asked me what my salary expectations were and I told him that I would like to make what I was making when I left the VA if possible, which was $19.50 an hour. She said she thought that that was a very high salary for only 1 years of experience and I was probably being paid more because it was a temporary position that didn't include benefit. Which was a wrong assumption on her part. I told her no that was incorrect that even though it was a temporary job it did include benefits after 60 days and that I had 11 years experience, not 1 years of experience.. I then asked her how much the union dues were a month and her reply was I don't know because I'm not Union. I said no I would need to know those answers so I can make an informed decision if the position is offered to me. She said she would get the answers to those questions and send me an email. That was 3 days ago and I have yet to receive an email from her
Interview Questions: How did I handle a situation when I made an error when the answer was obvious

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Took about 2 months. Initial interview were about qualities and character. Technical interview with the manager of the department, then with the director of the sector. Intensive interview process after initial interview.
Interview Questions: Give me an example of a project you worked on regarding data. How did you overcome any obstacles in a group project environment?

title: Communications Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process has been long, but well worth it. I have met some amazing people throughout the process, I have interviewed with a total of nine people. I had three phone interviews and then was flown out to Pleasanton, CA where I had interviews with different people in various departments.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Ontario, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter is the one who reviews application. Many times not sure they actually read it.  If he/she decides, goes to departments manager for interview.Meet with manager. Many times manager already knows if you will be hired or not. Usually only 1 or 2 positions but 30+ interviewing for position. Manager does not contact your, nor does HR to know status of position unless you're basically hired on the spot. If not given offer of position at interview, pretty can assume you did not get posotion.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an incident that was difficult to handle

title: Grill Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick 10 minute interview. They asked about my background in foods and how my experience has helped me throughout my foods carrier. They asked why I wanted to work for their company.
Interview Questions: What do you do when something isn't labeled correctly?

title: CSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with several other applicants. It was organized and effectively ran. I found out that same day I had been selected. The training is more disorganized but overall I was pleased with the onboarding process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two phone screens and an interview involving knowledge on basic JAVA, SQL, and Linux commands. Java questions revolved around OOP concepts, basic code troubleshooting (for bugs), and asking how code can be more efficient (data structures). SQL questions revolved around basic employee schemas which can be found online.
Interview Questions: What are the properties of OOP

title: Clinical Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied on a Monday, got an email to do a "career snapshot".  Did that and emailed, then was called the next day to set up a phone interview. Had the phone interview that Thursday. Was told "don't expect to go further because you don't have as much experience as your competition". Then was called on Monday for an interview that Wednesday. In person interview was a panel of 5 people asking basic managerial experience questions. When I left they told me they would call all applicants by the end of the next week. I still have not received a call.
Interview Questions: What was one thing you have done in your career that you wish you could do over? What are your greatest Strengths/Weaknesses? How would you describe your Managerial Style? ETC

title: Assistant Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: There are three sets of panel interviews. First set is with the unit staff. Second set of interview is with the managers or your would be peers. Then finally, the last set, is  with your director.
Interview Questions: How would you handle stress

title: Acupuncturist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Lakewood, CO) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough and professional. The interview also include meet and greet. They require the applicant to dress professionally. They didn't ask a lot of clinical question s.  Overall they prefer you to answer no if you don't know the answer
Interview Questions: How would you explain to your patients what acupuncture is?

title: Information Technology-Rotation Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was online with web cam with some from the hiring team and former participant in the rotational program. They asked some basic programming questions then went over a few easy questions about SQL and one or two HTML questions.
Interview Questions: What is encapsulation?(The questions are really basic)

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied on a Tuesday got a call on Thursday of the same week and interviewed Friday.Got offered the positions within an hour of leaving the interview. Took me at least 5 years to get a call back..Just be patient :)
Interview Questions: What do you like the least about your current job?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Interview was professional, quick, and easy. I met the supervisor of the department interview was about 30 mins long. Got hired same day. The process afterwards took a long time from screening to orientation.
Interview Questions: They asked about the reason I wanted to join kaiser.

title: Transcriber Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and welcoming. Management offered a refreshment prior to the interview. We sat in the ER administration office, there I was Interviewed by the Manager and lead staff member.
Interview Questions: why did I want to work there, what do i like to do for fun, how long have i been in the field.

title: LVN Float Pool Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Lancaster, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter to fill out a candidate snapshot and send it in. Within 2 days I received a call for an interview. The interview was 2 weeks away from initial call. The day of the interview there were 12 applicants. We were told that day they would have made their mind and decided to pick 6 applicants. There was a nurse administrator, director and 2 specialty nurses that would be interviewing. We were interviewed 6 at a time with 2 kaiser employees. We had to pick a question from a small basket and answer it on the spot.
Interview Questions: What does the word THRIVE mean to you and how would you implement that at KP?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Granada Hills, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview that went over why I want to work there, how I handled a difficult situation in the past, and my experience then a face to face interview with 2 Hiring Managers.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in a company?

title: Management Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview, lasted about an hour and a half. Interviewer was very nice and explained the position in great detail. Lots of behavioural questions. After the interview I checked in with the interviewer a couple of times over a 3 week period; she was very responsive. At the 4th week I received a generic form email rejection. Week 5 I received an generic email saying the position was cancelled. Week 6 I saw the job posted again?
Interview Questions: Standard

title: Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
My interview was with 20 other people, a panel of 6 managers, and the director. The interview consists of two rounds (if you're lucky).  The first round is with a group and  you are paired up with a partner for the first half and answering questions alone for the second half. If they like you then you come back for the second round which is you alone with the panel to interview.
The hiring process took me about 2 months, but it will be well worth it.
Interview Questions: Tell us why we should hire your partner?

title: Staff Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Kennesaw, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Group Interview (9 Interviewees)
Interviewers (4 district managers & head HR)

Everyone was nervous being that it was a group interview. 
Our group started off great. To make myself comfortable I made sure to introduce myself to my fellow interviewee to break all tension because I was (no exaggeration) very nervous. However with forming a conversation with each person we were able to get to know each other prior to the actual interview.

The group interview was broken into categories
Part 1: you had to team up and describe to the interviewers who your partner is in terms of their role as a Pharmacist and also say what your partner feels is a true patient advocate

Part 2: KP Facts Jeopardy (The HR lady was phenomenal, she cracked a lot of jokes and was silly. She made everyone feel comfortable). You were asked questions from the packet she emailed you with the time of your interview

Part 3: Role play Tech & Pharmacist. First scenario (rude tech that counsels patients even though it wasn’t her job) Second scenario (line cue is long and you have. Tech that refuses to follow your instructions) 

Part 4: Interview group split (
Interview Questions: What is the difference between a manager and a leader?

title: Medical Records/Medical Secretaries Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Jose, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from the department supervisor he asked me if I was still interested in the position I said yes still interested, he invited me to go to a face to face interview. Interview was scheduled for October 10th. They day of the interview I got there it was a Panel interview I met with the department Manager, Supervisor and Lead. The department supervisor was the one that ran most of the interview he went over some details on what the duties are and the locations of the position, all 3 took turns asking questions, the interview took about 25 minutes once done with their questions they asked me if I had any questions I asked my questions and they informed me that they are a union company and that there was no negotiation on the payrate which I dont know what it is because they didn’t disclosed the amount and that they still had more interviews to do but I would hear back  from them in a week with the outcome. The week came by and did not hear anything so I I left a couple more days go by and called and left a voice mail On Thursday day 10 and got a called on Friday morning from department supervisor informing me that they had choosen a Candidate that I was a very strong candidiate but they had made an offer and he invited me to reapply  to a new position that is going to become available in about 4 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self, work experince

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met at a specialty conference for initial brief interview over 20 minutes or so. Thereafter was invited for formal interview in person at location, where I was allowed to stay in the city for 3 nights, with paid hotel, flights, car rental, dining, etc., and then had an all day interview at clinic with six different physicians and clinic directors.
Interview Questions:
Why interested in position?
Would you consider re-locating?
Questions regarding comfort with standardization/algorithms for care based on diagnosis.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: They had me fill out an emailed questionnaire. It asked general questions about myself and experience. A few days later I was offered an in-person interview with the department supervisor. The interview with him was very awkward. He had a list of about 12 question printed out that he repeatedly explained are questions provided to him by HR that he is required to ask, then turn in, and HR makes a decision based on what he turns in. So it was basically a thorough HR related interview that they have the department head do for them. After 2 weeks of not hearing anything, I was offered a job with a different company. I contacted HR for an update and never heard back from them. I contacted the department head that I interviewed with. He said he recommended me for the job and it was in HR's hands now. I never heard back from them after multiple voicemails and email. It's extremely unprofessional to leave an applicant hanging like that.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation you had with a difficult patient. How did you handle it?

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: First it was a interview with the staffing agency. Then a group interview with kaiser. In the group setting interview it was two people that interviewed us. There was 8 people interviewing.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you

title: Government Relations Principal Policy Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email by a recruiter to schedule an interview with the hiring manager. During the interview, it became clear that the position was not going to match the job description and would instead be focused on data security.
Interview Questions: Describe managing people in charge of compliance efforts

title: Senior CopyWriter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interviews were pleasant but rushed. Hiring managers seemed unsure what skills they were looking for in applicants and the job roles and duties changed during the hiring process without explanation.
Interview Questions: Are you flexible and how do you work in an environment that frequently changes priorities, direction?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Group interview process. This was a new experience for me but it was definitely something that allows you to experience a new way of interviewing. Part of the interview was interacting with the other candidates.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for kaiser?

title: Proofreader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: After phone interview, was sent a lengthy proofreading test but no instructions on how to make changes to document or submit. Spent lots if time carefully doing but eventually was only given a curt response: “Sorry, we’ve moved on to other applicants.”
Interview Questions: “Ours is a very busy, stressful office. How would you manage that?”

title: Project Manager Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 sets of interviews for the position that I applied for, not including the calls with the recruiters. The initial interview was a panel interview followed by what would have been an in person interview with the Hiring Manager. Overall the questions were fair and I was asked several questions about my experience as well as understanding how it would be applied for my first project.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about your project management experience and the tools you're familiar with?
What questions do you have for me?

title: QA Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: In interview there was a skype round and asked me to code on coder pad.and other questions are more about selenium and java. Questions on GIT,Maven and other automation related tools. Questions about agile process.Questions about old experience.
Interview Questions: write selenium script to  log into kaiser account and capture the alert message if lofin details are incorrect.

title: Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter will email you, you will get call, and they will make an appointment for an in-person interview with manager and charge nurse. They interview wasn't hard, just the assesment test which was stressful.
Interview Questions:
EKG Assesment Test
5 multiple choice questions + 20 strips!

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
First I did a phone interview with the HR talent recruiter. It was nice and easy about 15 minutes. She explained the position and asked me some brief screening questions. Then scheduled me for a group interview that Friday. The day of the interview I was grouped with about 50 people. We were all brought into a conference room and sat in alphabetical order. We all had to stand, introduce ourselves, and explain why we wanted the position. Then the next phase of the interview was to partner up, interview each other, and present your partner and explain why they would be the right choice for the position. The last part of the group interview was to select a random question and answer it in front of the group. The managers excused themselves for a "lunch break" and we were all excused 1 by one. Depending on which door you went out of meant you were actually selected for the 2nd interview phase, which was 1 on 1 with the managers. 
Luckily I got selected for the 2nd interview. It was pretty easy. The manger asked me some written questions and wrote my answers down. He also allowed me to ask some questions as well. Overall I thought the process went really well.
Interview Questions: Explain a time you disagreed with a manager. How did you handle it? What was the outcome?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: This process was ridiculous and frustrating. It took so long for the recruiter to get through the applications that I received an email asking if I was still interested. I responded in the affirmative and then waited a week to be scheduled for an interview. After the interview, which I thought went very well, I waited as the hiring manager alluded to a 2nd round of interviews the next week. After I did not hear anything from the recruiter, I sent an email asking for feedback. This went on for a MONTH until I was finally given the news that they had hired another candidate. I asked for feedback that I could use in my pursuit of another position and was told that the person who was hired had more experience. I later found out from internal sources who the candidate was and that the candidate did not have more experience, but that the hiring manager was interviewing me to fill the requirements by HR to interview for open positions despite the desire to promote someone that was already identified to fill this role. Lesson learned that not all posted positions are real opportunities, but a way to use candidates they don’t intend on hiring. I had heard this happened at KP, but did not want to believe this of them.
Interview Questions: I should have known this was a set-up when the hiring manager did not ask me directed questions about my experience, especially my previous KP experience.

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Woodland Hills, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
-Made an appointment to take the required test for positions I applied for. Took the typing one as well, just because.
-Applied
-Group Interview: Partnered up and introduced partner and why Kaiser should hire them. Next, randomly select number/question, answer on the spot in front of panel and other candidates. Lastly one on one interviews. 

The staff is very friendly, be yourself, relax and smile! They make it easy, just show your confident and pay attention when others are presenting. Just keep applying they will take note of that. Take all required tests even before you hear from them. Bring a snack in your purse, it ran pretty long.. just because there was 36 of us. This was the biggest group they had, so it might not be that amount for all.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went against company policy. What was the situation and what was the outcome?

title: Grill Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Moreno Valley, CA)
Interview Descriptions: On my hiring was good, I was nerbes on the first time. But the good thing it was the mánager believe on my and he give me the job.  He give me the oportunity to try.
Interview Questions: Do you lier on any cuestión?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: After an initial screening of my resume and cover letter I was contacted and asked to submit a 10 question questionnaire further elaborating on my experience. Then I was asked to take a logic test via Epic (like  a standardized test you take at home on your computer). I was brought in for 2 rounds of interviews a week apart. The first week was with the hiring manager and a random person from another team for contrast. The second interview was with a high level decision maker.
Interview Questions: How would others describe you?

title: Executive Director Service Unit Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, recieved an email for interview. Had a large panel interview with 8 people including the ED director, ED manager, 2 ANM's, 2 educators, and 2 ED SUS's.
Interview Questions: How I handle stress.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (North Hollywood, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application and was given one day to prepare for my interview, which was fine. I was told that I was going to be interviewed by the hiring manager, but I arrived to a four person panel. One interviewer was extremely rude and unprofessional, as he was wearing a backwards hat, ripped jeans, and a sweatshirt. This interviewer also sarcastically laughed and smirked at my answers to questions that other interviewers were asking. I informed my recruiter about the terrible interview and proceeded to tell me that the interviewer was a contract employee through the same recruiting company and should not have even been at the interview. I feel that Kaiser is a great company, as I was born in a Kaiser hospital and have been attending to their hospitals for my whole life, but they were poorly represented by the employees that were interviewing me. I am very disappointed with this interview process and have lost respect for Kaiser as a company.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with MD and NP Mgr meeting for about 40 minutes.  They weren’t particularly friendly., seemed stressed.   Asked standard  questions.  Told me they would call within the week. Didn’t call or send any type of follow up.
Interview Questions: clinical scenarios  that require current  acog guideline knowledge

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Richmond, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: At Kaiser Permanente, we believe health isn’t an industry – it’s a cause. And there’s no better feeling than a willingness to serve others for a worthwhile cause. By volunteering, you can add to the quality of our members’ lives – and the quality of your life, too.
Interview Questions: NDA signed, cannot disclose

title: Psychological Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Redwood City, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted immediately and scheduled an interview.  The process was as expected. I was screened initially by phone, then called in for a in person interview. I was interviewed by three people in a panel.
Interview Questions: Name one time you had a concern or issue with a supervisor and how did you handle it?

title: Assistant Community Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening with hiring manager currently overlooking the position. Asked primarily about management experience and knowledge of the position of the direct reports. Asked about my knowledge of public health and health coaching and how I would learn about it if I didn't know.
Interview Questions: What management experience have you had in the past?

title: RN Quality Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Team interview with quality management team face to face after having HR call me and then I was given a phone interview by the hiring manager.  It was a well done process.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are qualified for this position?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: The whole process is very lengthy, spread out over 2 months with very poor communication with the candidate. I had to email the HR representative for follow up. This lack of professionalism was frustrating.
Interview Questions: They gave me 4 case studies with poor formatting for review in 45 minutes with no guidance regarding what was expected upon completion of the review

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Tukwila, WA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and in-person interview with two managers. From application submission to getting offered the job, it took one month and ten days. Interview question's weren't hard at all for me but this is because I really spent time preparing a few days before.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Was told to call back and didn't realize that I was having a phone interview that lasted close to an hour. 

Make sure you are kind to the recruiter that call you.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

Who are the kind of people you cant stand to work with?

Did you receive an rewards or accomplished anything?

Describe a time you went above and beyond the call of duty?

How do you deal with complicated people?

What are 5 adjectives a co-worker or boss would say about you?

(you should brush up on your basic skills such as shots placement, infection control) I was tested right away.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Duluth, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went through two interviews, quick preliminary interview and group interview. The group interview was long for no reason.  They have you partner up and explain the other person's background experience. Did Nate ask you to questions in a group setting
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you didn't like the policy what did you do and how did you handle it

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a group setting through an employment agency. It consisted of about 40 people with about 4 conference tables in a room which amounts to 10 candidates per table. You start out with a brief introductions by the hiring managers and the operations manager. They then go into the details of the job. Then you're partnered with a person sitting next to you. (Don't think you're going to introduce your friend because they will alphabetize you by first name). Yes you will have to stand up and introduce your partner to the class. You will say their name, their work experience, and what excellent customer service means to them. I would focus heavily on their work experience because this seems to be the sales pitch of that person for the position. You then will get a break. Then you will return to your conference table. Small trivia icebreaker. Know history, important people, region/ locations, fun facts so you can win small prizes. Then back to the interview. The two hiring managers at each table have a total of 4 questions in which they will alternate in asking the candidates. You will only be asked ONE question which will be out of the 4 they have. It'll be totally random but you can hear the other questions being asked at other tables. Use the STAR technique that your agency probably provided. Answer to the best of your ability. Once everyone has answered, the interview is over and you're free to go. The staffing agency will reach out to you regarding their decision within the same or next business day.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time where you provided customer service at a lower level than you wanted and how did you resolve it.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Anaheim, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Group interview that involved introducing your partner to the group. We were all invited back for an individual interview with a panel of three nurse leaders. The overall process was very intimidating and it made me feel as though I was automatically not a good candidate compared to the other people in the group.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you could not give adequate customer service for a patient and what did you do?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: I had a quick phone interview with the hiring manager first then had a 3 panel interview with 2 managers and 1 full time staff assistant. They tried to get a feel for who I was and if i was truly comfortable with the offered hours.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with the hours ( I applied for a 20 hr PT position)?

title: Human Resources Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: you apply online, take an assessment test and skill test, You then are offered 1 interview with a panel and then possibly offered a 1 on 1 or 2 on 1 interview.
Interview Questions: They ask you alot of, How would you do this or Handle this questions?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. Initial phone interview, then an in-person with a panel of three. The in-person interview as not structured, very laid back, and more of an outline of the job rather than a traditional Q &A.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser Permanente?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process is extremely drawn out for some positions. I applied online for a position, went through a HR phone screen, an hour long phone interview with a manager and direct report, and then a 1.5 hour in-person interview on-site with a skills test.   

After the in-person interview, I was told that I would likely have to come in for another interview with a panel of my future co-workers.  For a entry/mid-level position, this amount of interviewing seems excessive. 

As of today, it has been four months since the first phone interview and I have not heard whether the position is still open, if I am still a candidate, or where I am in the process.  Kaiser could do a much better job communicating and streamlining the hiring process in order to keep well-qualified candidates interested.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview that was very informative with a person who was very knowledgeable. Explained all aspect of the position. Asked relaxed questions and was very asttentive. Was honest about the qualifications needed. Explained all of the company background.
Interview Questions: what qualifications did I have that should be considered in decision making?

title: RN I New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was in an interview with 2 managers. It wasn't stressful, relaxed environment. They started by introducing themselves and then began with the questions. At the end, the two managers spent time telling me about what the program entailed and what to expect--I really appreciated this.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview for this position wlwas a group interview that included about 45-50 people. There were 3 sections with about 15 people per section answer interview questions aloud with the hiring manager for that table. There were 3 hiring managers. Really nice and down to earth people that made it comfortable for us. Not too much pressure. However the answers had to be preofessional in nature and well versed.
Interview Questions: When was a time that you did not agree with company policy?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Bellevue, WA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was one interviewer. Basic questions are ask about yourself as well as situational questions. The interviewer is more focused on getting to know your personality and see if you are a good fit for the role.
Interview Questions: What characteristics do you have that will help with this role?

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was standard with introduction of the department and what the job entails. Then straight into asking generic interview questions. They were primarily looking if you are able to learn and adept.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a suggestion that you don't agree with your manager?

title: Financial Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Made several applications on line, through their website over several week with no success. Finally through a friend I was able to speak with a rep on an informal basis. The meeting was informative and geared more towards the requirements necessary to have in order to be considered. What I took away from the meeting was although I have many years of business experience, I do not have specific experience in the health care industry, without which it is very difficult for them to place you in their organization.
Interview Questions: What is your level of experience in the health care industry

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baltimore, MD) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, waited 3 weeks for a call, finally Drug screen and background takes a week very straight forward for the interview. Reference Check than a phone call from the recruiter . Dress for success, answer questions honestly and you won’t have anything to worry about
Interview Questions: Recall a time that you went above and beyond for a patient

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was really easy. They do not ask me much. Just the basics and where I wanted to volunteer in the hospital. But, I would recommend to prepare yourself either way since each hospital is different.
Interview Questions: What is customer service?

title: Senior Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was long, phone interview; panel interview and then the interview with the hiring manager.   The process is lengthy, but it well worth the wait.  Once you are in your are in.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your executive's calendar

title: Executive Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: First I submited online application through KP TALEO website. HR contacted to set up a screening phone interview. A week after I received a second call asking me to come to the office for in-person interview with potential manager.  Very Efficient and Organized. I got hired and love  working here.
Interview Questions: Work experience and job related questions.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Olympia, WA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and easy, I got a full tour of the department I was interviewing for. The manager was very friendly and appeared to have a good relationship with her staff.
Interview Questions: Are you able to commit full to being at work and on time for every scheduled shift?

title: Licensed Massage Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Three person staring at me and asking me all kind of personal and professional questions. I left the room without a real sense if did well in the interview or just the opposite.
Interview Questions: What was my most successful case as a Massage Therapist

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by a panel of three people. It was a very relaxed interview. The people were very friendly and laughed alot during the interview. The interview questions were from a list.. and thet wrote your responses on. The interview took about 30 mins.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you

title: Ultrasound Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online for two positions. For the first, I was invited to complete the online assessment, which was mainly logic questions/brain games. I was pretty sure that I bombed that section. At the end of the assessment, the system said that I did not meet the requirements for the position.

For the second position, I received an email stating that I was not selected. A few days later, after both positions said that I was not selected, I recieved two emails stating that I was invited to a group interview session scheduled for just under a week from the email date. I responded back to the email and have yet to receive additional information on this interview that is now days away.
Interview Questions: The online assessment asked a lot of question that were brain games. Each question had to be answered in three minutes.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Email exchange with recruiter.  She told me Senior Financial Analyst role pays $84k base salary.  I told her that's really low for a senior level when just about all companies in the bay area can get you towards $100k.

Not willing to renegotiate even though recruiter thought my qualifications met the position
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Desktop Support Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy process. Standard help desk analyst questions.  First a phone interview and then an on site interview. After the on site interview another phone interview was conducted by the hiring manager.
Interview Questions:
What are your stenngths
What are your weaknesses
Why are you applying for this position
Do you have any experience
Describe a conflict with another person

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Rude interview by telephone, outside consultants involved in the process.  Position posted for more than a year but not because of candidates experience, its because the outside consultant.  Looking back at the situation, I think this person should have applied for the position themselves.
Interview Questions: Asked to describe experience but was interrupted, this interviewer seemed to have a chip on their shoulders, demonstrated lack of professionalism and this person could be suffering from superiority complex.  The best way to describe the experience was this person was aggressive, had already developed an opinion of me before the interview took place and it happened in the first few questions.  This set the tone for the rest of the interview.  It seemed it was important to this outside consultant that they were in charge and it was their way or no way at all.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews with different levels of staff, from admin managers, research staff, and clinical (doctors) at different days. 1st a phone interview with a hiring manager, then in person with various staff. The process was standard, with a standard list of questions.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with different demands and prioritizing them?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a job online. 3 months later a recruiter called me and said they were interested and would coordinate over email. Three weeks later I get a call from a senior-level person in another group saying someone had passed him my resume and he wants to bring me in to discuss. Excited I said yes without thinking - bring me in for what job?! So, I go in at the appointed time and had a 1:1 meeting in a tiny room where our knees were inches from touching. He asked me generic questions, and when I pressed for more information about the specific role, the team, anything, he clammed up and suggested I hadn't known what I was applying for... which was correct! When I reminded him of how I'd come to get the meeting, thinking he'd gotten me confused with another candidate, he started nit-picking my word choice. It was totally bizarre. I left definitely NOT wanting the job, but still followed up with a nice thank you email, asking that he keep me updated, and if not for this role perhaps another one!  No response. When I checked in 3 weeks later he never responded.  Definitely relieved it didn't work out, but was shocked at my experience as I was pumped at the idea to work for such an awesome company!
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser? Why healthcare?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an invitation for a phone interview after about two weeks. The interview was conducted by an HR personnel. She asked me some basic interview questions. She also said that the interview result would be released on the coming Monday. Although I was not invited to proceed to the next interview, I was still glad that she kept her promise and the result was given quickly.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in using SQL?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 2 managers. They asked mostly behavioral questions. One took note, the other asked. Reviewed resume and asked questions based on previous experience. Asked for specific examples, and elaborate more on situational analysis and resolution.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you made a mistake and how did you resolve it?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a 4 minute security check point for identification verification at a self service kiosk and attending officer, one hour question and answer interview with two department hiring managers and a facility tour immediately followed by an one hour grammatical and written test about case scenarios.
Interview Questions: How would you organize your day to day case loads?

title: IT Infrastructure Undergrad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the Kasier website for this position sometime in late June. About two weeks later got an email to have a panel phone interview. Another two weeks later, I had an offer, but rejected because I couldn't afford to move closer to location where the internship is at.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself? Would you consider yourself to be a go getter?

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (North Hollywood, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick response from managers, who were straightforward with the questioning. I was notified within reasonable time of the result of the interview. Friendly staff and the work place looked very warm and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Define safety.

title: Member Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Tukwila, WA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Group interview that included and introduction, team questions and communication.  Included Director, Manager and Supervisor of the department.  They were all very welcoming and approachable.  The board room was very comfortable as well as the break facility.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had no management to provide you with an answer and how did you handle it.

title: Admitting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Manteca, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied on KP website received a call the following day from a recruiter she emailed me some assessment tests( PC test, Medical Terminology), one week later i received a call from the manager and had an interview couple days later. Interview went great waiting for a call back.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience at my past job (urgent care)?

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Leandro, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by a recruiter. On the day of the interview, I was given a situational questionnaire to fill out prior to my one-on-one interviewed with the Assistant DON.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and weaknesses?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a large panel process.  The panel had an air of arrogance, as they felt Kaiser was a complex place to work and that you had to be a superstar to survive in the organization.
Interview Questions: What mistakes have you made?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: A panel of three nurses in a meeting room who had me wait 40 minutes past the agreed upon interview time.  They clearly watched a YouTube video on how to group interview. Or had the advise of some over zealous HR consultant who knows nothing at all about Nursing
Interview Questions: The weirdest questions that have nothing at all to do with nursing.

title: Grossing Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Baldwin Park, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview processes was very straightforward and to the point. I was asked standard interview questions, then met with everyone in the laboratory and received a tour of the laboratory
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick and insightful interview. The interview process itself will most likely include a part where you have to give a presentation of the prior work that you have done and how it relates to the current position that you are applying for. If you nail this, you'll impress the employer and get a job.
Interview Questions: How would you resolve an incorrect credit balance?

title: Quality Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: After you pass the first stage, there is an online assessment that is very similar to the LSAT. Mostly logic games and math questions. Not only is it difficult, to me, the experience did not mimic a natural work environment. However, I assume that's how Kaiser selects their employees.
Interview Questions: Questions were similar to: Jim, Peter, Jackson, Michelle, and Sarah all have planes to catch. Sarah can leave before Peter, but not before Jim. Jackson and Jim are on the same flight, however, Jackson can get on an earlier flight if available. Peter must leave last. You get the idea. Oh, and you are allowed 60 seconds per question.

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Harbor City, CA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied for night shift position. Recruiter called suggesting a different night shift position and to apply. Recruiter sent a prescreen questionnaire. Received phone call a few days later to interview with unit manager. Interview was only with unit director and manager. Took about 15 minutes. They were both welcoming and easy to talk to. Received call next day that I was offered the position. Overall experience was easy just nerve wrecking that it's with Kaiser.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and experience as a nurse.

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Tacoma, WA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR, did not go beyond that because job required travel I was unable to do. Next step would have been in person interview. I have heard they take a long time to hire and are very careful in their process for hiring.
Interview Questions: How many years experience do you have?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
Basic questions panel tell me about yourself? How long have you been a nurse?
What units have you work? Have you had a issue with doctors before? What is good about you? What is your weakness?
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Answered 5-7 questions via email with recruiter followed by phone interview with recruiter. Email questions included questions about relevant experience and how it would relate to the position. Pushed to know salary history and requirements.
Interview Questions: Salary history and a few behavioral interview questions

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: CSRs at the new call center in GA are hired through local staffing agencies. I participated in a group interview of about 25 candidates. Interview process was laid back. The hiring managers tried to get everyone relaxed and have a good time. They start with a trivia round and give out small prizes when someone has a fun fact about Kaiser. Then you partner up for 5 minutes with the candidate sitting next to you. After the five minutes, you stand up and introduce your partner, their work history, and what "excellent customer service" means to your partner. After the introductions, there is a behavioral interview round. The managers ask each person one question. There are 4 possible questions and they rotate. You are asked to keep answers brief. You might also have time to prepare while others are answering their questions. After everyone has answered, the interview is over. They told the results to the staffing agency same day. Really easy and positive experience.
Interview Questions: Tell us why we should hire you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Duluth, GA)
Interview Descriptions: It was an interesting interview I sat across from four people who had papers with scenario type questions to ask me it was a good interview but it wasn't very personal.
Interview Questions: What current certifications do I hold.

title: Benefits Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from Kaiser to fill out a questionnaire. The questionnaire was emailed to me and I sent it back same day.  Was told I'd hear back within 10 days for an interview.  I heard back 1.5 months later requesting an interview.  I had forgotten I even applied. I had already accepted a job with another very well known hospital making much more money than Kaiser would ever pay me.  I kindly told them to go away.  They really need be much faster with recruiting.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in coding benefits

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Received a call from a recruiter in HR four weeks after I submitted an online application.  The 
 recruiter asked if I was still interested in the position.  We then set a date and time for the call.  The same person called to conduct the interview.
Interview Questions: Asked me to go through my background.

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was reached out by an expert recruiter through multiple emails to set up phone screening. During phone screening was told I did not qualify for the position rather sending me an email to tell me I did not qualify for the position.  Was advised that you must meet the minimum requirements are else your job applications will go into a black hole. There is no room for growth even if I have a Master's degree and zero years of experience.
Interview Questions: Do you have an updated resume.

title: Undergraduate– Data Center Operations (DCO) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: One on One interview with the Director.  Questions were review of my qualification and my knowledge of software courses I had taken in college.  There was tour of the facilities and questions on my comfort level working in the enviornment
Interview Questions: Adaptability and ability learn new thins

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Interview: Phone interview, mostly behavioral questions, followed by in-person interview that contained a case and behavioral questions.
Hiring: Offer extended via HR about 3 weeks after phone interview. Background check and drug test required before offer was official.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you improved a process.

title: Business Operations Interview
