Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Aurora, CO) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews, one was a basic screen and the other was a more in depth interview pertaining to my experience and how badly I wanted the internship. They were both about ten minutes long with a few people involved. It was a simple process with some preparation involved. I am very excited to start my internship in a couple of weeks!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Commuincations Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: From initially applying to accepting job offer took about 1.5 months. I had a brief interview over the phone, followed by 2 in-person interviews. Interview questions were fair enough to answer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy process, long panel interviews, kp always prefer BSN. Questions may be challenging and panels are usually intimidating. I’ve interviewed at three different locations for different new grad positions and every kp location has their style of interviews. Some are coordinated by the HR consultant and managers sit back and listen and others are conducted my managers and nurses.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict with a patient and how did you handle it?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Rockville, MD) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Kaiser interview process is awful, ridiculous, tedious and unnecessarily long winded. The HR department at Kaiser causes the interview process to become grueling and stressful. Worst interview experience of my life. The HR department is run by a bunch of chimps for lack of a better term. I got an offer but turned it down. Longest interview, hiring process. Seems Kaiser do not value or want quality employees. Once HR finally came back with an offer after all the flip flopping and games these people play, I declined the offer. I do not want this HR department to be the ones handling my paperwork over my career at Kaiser. I lost a ton of respect for this organization. Get rid of everyone in HR and start over with employees who actually care about the existing and potential employee or who even care about the company. HR can actually cause a company to not "Thrive". Disappointed in this company. Kaiser do better!!!
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you over other qualified candidates?

title: GraduatePsychiatry Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Ana, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two panel interviews, clinical vignette, and a phone interview. There was opportunity to network with supervisors and interns. Food and light beverages were provided, and a relaxing atmosphere as every part of the interview was explained thoroughly before hand. There was well over 20 applicants.
Interview Questions: How do you determine which situation/issue to address first in a crisis situation? What helps you make that decision?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Contacted coordinator through the website. Filled out a form about why and list references. was emailed for an interview . Interview was casual. Was offered right after the interview. The interviewer was very friendly.
Interview Questions: What's my purpose for applying

title: Claims Resolution Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview or shall I say phone conference call with about 8 to 9 people online.  I called a little early so I was on the line before my start time however as I was sitting on the line waiting I heard someone one of the interviewers say well its almost time and she ain't on the line so hang up that's when I said hello good morning I've been here just waiting for the exact time they were all shocked that I heard such thing and she said it with an attitude (ghetto) Idk about this one here............
Interview Questions: The same questions just in different terms and forms

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Tukwila, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, and then there was a Phone Interview, in-person interview. After the phone interview, I got a call from a different manager, and she took my application (same position, different manager)
Interview Questions: Strengths / weaknesses

title: Senior Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter outreach. Pre-qualifying with recruiter/resume, which was passed to hiring manager/team for review. Team selects candidates for interview. Phone interview with team manager. Candidate is brought to location to interview manager (and possible team members). Process typically takes 60-90 days for total onboarding.
Interview Questions: Describe the best tools and methods you have used for sharing and updating rapidly changing data at a departmental level.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Bellevue, WA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went through the typical online application process. Then I went and had my blood drawn for the drug screen, criminal background check, credit check. 5 to 7 references were required. Everything went great and I even got an offer but that was retracted when they weren't able to verify one of my references.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Technical Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1. one hour phone interview
2. one hour video conference call 

There was not too much of an emphasis placed on technical questions. Most of the interview focused on fit questions.
Interview Questions:
Why Kaiser?
What is the difference between dml and ddl?

title: Front Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions:
A highly resourceful, energetic and competent customer service representative with over 15 year’s experience ofproviding the highest standard of administrative support. A proven ability to deal with all aspects of front office duties
and able to work well under pressure professionally and efficiently.
Interview Questions: when can you start?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Sacramento, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 3 pharmacy managers, ~ 20 minutes filled with 9-10 situational questions. Several interviews were done in one day. Recruiter called to ask what time I would like to interview at.
Interview Questions: Discuss one time that you had to deal with a difficult employee.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online through my campus job board and was contacted roughly a few weeks after. I was summoned to go to the location in Pasadena, CA but since I was in school at the time, my interview was conducted via webex. 

The overall interview was pretty straghtforward, overall a positive experience. Heard back about 4 days later telling me I got the job pending a drug test within 48 hrs. 

I cant wait to work for them this summer.
Interview Questions: Who is someone that drives/motivates you?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Half day interview process. Met with 5 different people that I would be working with for about an hour each. Each one had a set of questions related to their role and the PM's interaction with that role
Interview Questions: Was asked the old standard 'What's your greatest weakness?'

title: Regulatory Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Walked into a small room with one director and another employee. The room was very friendly and the interviewers were smiling. They had a sheet in front of them with interview questions to ask me. I answered the questions as they were asked of me and answered some questions ahead of time based on some of the answers to previous questions.
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you were in a position of leadership and what was the outcome. What did your colleagues think of you and your role during the experience?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very straight forward and easy. Hiring process is not that exhaustive in Kaiser. They made me feel at ease. Didn't try to make nervous. Kaiser is hard to get noticed but they interview you only if they are serious about you.
Interview Questions: What motivates me to work for Kaiser?

title: Pharmacy Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Harbor City, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Process took 6 months.  Applied online then that same week went to take a typing test, 5 months later got a call from recruiter asking if I was still interested in the position he then forwarded my application to pharmacy manager. Got an email to schedule interview.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths and weaknesses?

title: Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Downey, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a little bit intimidating. It may have just been the interviewers but they seemed very serious and a bit hard to talk to. I was interviewed in a panel of two people. They had me sit in the office and took turns asking questions and jotting down notes.
Interview Questions: Why should we pick you for Kaiser over other candidates? What do you have that other people don't have?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a casual interview with typical interview questions. I went in with the perception that there would be typical interview questions. Of course, everyone was really friendly and that's what attracted me towards the company!
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about yourself

title: Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email by a recruiter to set up a WebEx interview with the respective heads of the project.  The first interview consisted mostly of background and personality questions.  These tested temperament and working style.  There were also some questions regarding my relevant experience. The second interview was also online.  These focused more on the specific project for which I was applying.  They were looking for some level of product research/knowledge applicable to the project.  They also wanted to know what I wanted out of the experience.
Interview Questions: How you would bring a non-participating colleague into the fold?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through their website and they responded probably within a month. I spoke with one person on the phone for the first interview and two for the second one. I believe there was two rounds in the interview process.
Interview Questions: Name a few characteristics you would describe yourself with

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Englewood, CO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very long and time consuming, Multiple rounds of job interviews and/or other candidate selection methods may be used where there are many candidates or the job is particularly challenging or desirable. Earlier rounds sometimes called 'screening interviews' may involve fewer staff from the employers and will typically be much shorter and less in-depth.
Interview Questions: Why I felt I was qualified

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initially began with a thirty minute phone screen followed by online coding exercise guided by an interviewer. Was offered for an on-site interview the following week but declined due to other obligations
Interview Questions: Tell us about the side-projects you mentioned on your resume

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Leandro, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: good, not that difficult of an interview, it was average behavioral interview questions. their on boarding process however takes quite a while. Kaiser is competitive and they tend to hire only within the union
Interview Questions: tell meabout yourself

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was challenging but a great experience overall. Everyone makes you feel comfortable. We did group work and also individual interviews as well.  All the candidates were great and knowledgeable.
Interview Questions: To name a time we’re I had to handle a difficult patient?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Super easy, I was located far away so we did 2 phone interviews instead of an in person interview. At first I was surprised that they were comfortable hiring me based on a phone interview but once I was hired I realized why. Almost all meeting occur over the phone and not in person.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern/Associate Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Requires a typing / personality test prior to the interview. The day of the interview, it was a panel interview with pharmacy managers in the region. The questions that were asked were standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Kaiser

title: Senior Portfolio Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Excellent interview. Met with two senior staff. They were very engaged and present. They asked several follow up questions. They asked me about several individuals - if I had worked with them and in what capacity ( this was appropriate given the role and the subject matter).
Interview Questions: They asked me to describe an experience with building consensus and what the outcome was ultimately.

title: Senior Provider Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online (indeed.com). Three months later I received a call from KP recruiter who did the phone screen. Next, I received call from hiring manager who scheduled 4 interviews with one of them being a panel and the last was an interview with VP of the dept. I began employment a month after offer was accepted.
Interview Questions:
What do you want to get out of this position? 
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?  
How do you handle conflicts? 
How do you feel about team work?

title: Senior Financial Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had to go through three rounds which consisted of one-on-one and panel.  Two were over the phone while the third one was in person.  I am still waiting at this point to see what the outcome is.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this role?

title: IT Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Pleasanton, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The manager and I spoke about my past work and school experience. I mentioned the skills I have on my resume. I also printed the job description and highlighted certain things I wanted to talk about during the interview. I went through each bullet and mentioned what I knew how to complete and if I had experience doing it in a previous work place. I was asked how much PowerPoint, SharePoint, charting (excel/powerpoint), and Excel I knew. I mentioned I worked on all of those things in previous positions. I had plenty of my own questions as well.
Interview Questions: I was asked to what extent I know certain software and how much finance knowledge I have.

title: Performer I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: You have to sign up and be accept to come to an open audition. From there, they would select you to come to a callback at a later day. The callback would last an entire workday. They narrow candidates even further after the callbacks and schedule only certain candidates to come in to interview for the available Performer-Educator position(s).
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict in a work group?

title: APPOINTMENT CLERK Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Fontana, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I first applied in Feb didn't think too much of it. I had applied several times and had no luck. I got the phone interview in March. I passed the phone interview and was selected to go forward with a group interview. The group interview was in March 20 something. I got the phone call same day saying I got the job! I started training as of April. 

I personally had 2 different types of interviews. The first interview I had was a phone interview with someone from HR. She had asked many questions for about 30-45 mins. The questions were all different from what do you believe is good customer service to why why did you want to work for Kaiser Permanente? 

Luckily for me, I was chosen and they offered me the group interview. When I arrived at the group interview I was in a room with 35 other people. It felt extremely intimidating especially since I was in the room with 6 other supervisors. Overall it wasn't too bad just felt very intimidated. I left the job interview feeling nervous and scared but I got lucky enough to be told the same day I got the job! Once I finished all my paperwork and went for training the first day I realized out of the 35 people that were in the group interview only 4 of us were picked. Also, try to do your very best at the group  interview turns out if you don't get offered this position you CANNOT apply for it again at any KP for 1 whole year and that includes the interview too. Some of the pre req they asked for was several different tests.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser? Tell me a time when you had a goal you wanted to meet what did you do to meet that goal? What would you do if you requested a weekend off and your manager decides to add you to the schedule what would you do about this situation? What is customer service to you? Who do you want to make proud? Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Human Resources Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente
Interview Descriptions: Nothing usual about the interview questions. Mostly standard questions about previous experience and practical experience around the system used and working in a service center environment. Interviewed as an internal candidate
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: 4 rounds. 1. Resume Submission through website. 2. Pre-Interview Questionaire. 3. Phone Interview. 4. Panel Interview. From first submission to offer, process took about 35 days. Before the in-person panel interview, there is a writing assessment taken on-site. Staff was extremely friendly, helpful, and professional. From HR to interviewer to office assistant.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself pertaining to your career. How do you deal with ambiguity? Give examples of relevant job experience that pertains to this job.

title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Inglewood, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was group with other people with difference question and with other people altogether to answered each person question. Question and answer to the question my experience to safety patient life.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work with Kaiser

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was simple; I received a phone screening interview which had basic behavioral-type questions before proceeding onto the second round, this time with an executive who I was to work under should I have gotten the position. These questions were much more open-ended, being focused on my experiences as a student at my university and why I care about healthcare.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you successfully responded to a challenging time at work or in another environment.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Oakland, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening process was very good. In person interviews more challenging because staff are not well trained to conduct interviews. Offered little time for candidate to present and the panel talked constantly which made it difficult to find an entry point without appearing rude.
Interview Questions: Not very well thought out questions. Low level administrative staff feel empowered to "screen" you without the benefit of having experience to it.

title: Medical Assistant Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Olympia, WA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and welcoming which put me at ease as a student looking to extern at one of their clinics.  Explained how the role of medical assistant worked and let me know what they expected of me.  Took me on a tour and introduced me to a number of people that I might be seeing as I extern.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know if I had any questions for them.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Chapel Hill, NC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a behavioral and case. The behavioral consisted of typical questions such as "walk me through your resume" and "why are you interested in this position". The case was given to me 3 days ahead of time and required me to exhibit my skills in Excel and Access. I was then asked to present my findings and recommendations to the interviewers.
Interview Questions: What other data would you have liked to have to address the question and better inform your recommendation?

title: Clinical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Silver Spring, MD) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Uncertain of the hiring process. I've been called or e-mailed by them 4 times within the last year about positions I've applied for. Person interviewing me laughed multiple times as if I was telling a joke except I wasn't and was speaking openly and honestly about my experiences and where I am now. I used to think KP was the promise land after so many positive reviews from not only employees but patients within their system. I felt that my interviewer was for lack of better wording unprofessional. She said she would call my most recent supervisor and call me back and never did.
Interview Questions: Basic questions. You understand this isn't full time? You undetstand where the location is in comparison to where you live? Talk about your most recent position and past positions and why you aren't with them any more. Discuss any gaps in employment

title: Physical Therapy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview followed by two in person interviews with 2-3 interviewers asking multiple questions. whole process took about 4 weeks or so. Process was fairly streamlined and only the background check took the longest .
Interview Questions: why kaiser?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Tacoma, WA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a one on on e interview and the interviewer broke the ice and it was a pleasant experience. I heard back the same day. The further process was quick
Interview Questions: describe a situation when you showed empathy

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Irvine, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process is extremely long. I applied for a position online through the KP careers, was contacted a few weeks later by a recruiter who did a brief phone interview. After a week or so I was called in for a panel interview, about 8 managers and directors all interviewing for different departments. The panel interview went from a group of about 20 applicants and they made cuts each round, which then led to an individual interview. After the interview, I was offered the job the next day.
Interview Questions: Most questions are based on your past experiences - how would you react in this specific situation, how have you reacted in the past, and then clinical questions as well.

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Rosa, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Great interviewing process. Tough.  I did 2 rounds of interviews.  No phone interview just in person if they are interested.  1.5 hours long. 3 people interview you as a tag team.  It was intimidating
Interview Questions: How to you deal with a difficult coworker?

title: RN Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Portland, OR) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Initial phone interview with panel. Usual screening interview to find out more about me and why I was interested in the job.
2nd interview in person with panel. More extensive interview with specific questions to learn more about critical thinking skills, problem solving, etc.
Interview Questions: Why Kaiser?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Salem, OR) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was very quick for me but I’ve heard that others have a harder time getting in. Try to make your resume and personality stand out. Apply to multiple positions even if they’re not what you really want, if you can get your foot in the door, you will have a better chance getting where you want as an internal employee than someone who is external, as positions are first offered to internal applicants.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you dealt with a difficult patient

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Santa Clara, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview followed by a panel interview. The panel interview has chief physicians, medical assistants, and management. They take turns asking various questions and set up scenarios related to the department and job.
Interview Questions: How familiar I am with A3

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Kaiser Permanente (Burbank, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: HR contacted candidates for pre-screening questionnaires, then selected best fit candidates for the interview. It was a panel interview with three managers for 1 hour. They asked questions regarding your academy and work experiences. They also asked some behavioral questions to make sure you're a good fit for the team.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?
